Sentence: On earth, other species would move into fill the void, but our Martian biosphere is not as flexible.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: It takes hundreds if not thousands of years before Mars becomes a stable environment.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: But eventually, the planet will have the potential to sustain large, shoe and colonies.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: With air, water and food available, we can finally call Mars, black, blue and green, our hope.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: A giant volcanic island in space.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: Will it last, though?

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: Challenge 3, the long-term future.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: There is a problem we haven't addressed.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: Mars' cord is not produced a magnetic field, so it doesn't have enough protection from solar radiation or cosmic rays.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: This becomes dangerous for the long-term health of Martian populations.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: So, as a final step, we need an artificial magnetic field.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: It doesn't have to be huge like Earths.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: It just needs to deflect the solar wind enough so that it doesn't touch Mars.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: The easiest way is to construct a magnetic umbrella far ahead of Mars that splashes the solar wind to the sides.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: A big, superconducting ring powered by nuclear facilities is all it takes.

Title: How To Terraform Mars - WITH LASERS
Sentence: It would orbit at the Mars Sun L1 point, keeping it constantly in between the Sun and Mars, and protect the new atmosphere.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Everything changed when the slave nation attacked.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: What used to be a thriving colony is now a captured country.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Slaves do the work, serving their new masters until they die, only to be replaced by new victims harvested in brutal raids.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: But let's go back to the beginning.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The World War of the Ants is claiming millions of lives every day.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: But in the brutal world of ants, straight out war is not the only way.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Around 50 Ants species, practice and slavery, the most extreme division of labour.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: We don't know how this began, but some Ants species perfected this cruel trade.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Meet Polyone.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The most intense of the slavre and tribes.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: There are different species, but generally there are 4 to 10mm long, with round to blackish bodies and sickle-shaped mandibles.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Polyergus has specialized in slavery so much that they've lost their ability to care for themselves.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: They don't clean, build nests, care for their brood, or feed themselves.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: They only exist for raiding.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Slaves make up 82% of the ants in their colonies, so a few hundred polyergus and a single queen control thousands of slave ants.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: We'll summarize and simplify what we know about polyergus into one grand story.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: You can find more information in our sources.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: So now, let's witness the cruel banality of nature.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The rate.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: It all begins on a mild summer morning on a sunny field.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Witness this colony over 10,000 formic ants, genetically cousins of polyergus, who build a thriving nest underground.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: They are a widespread genus, so species are good fighters, some great builders, and some cattle farmers, often welcomed by humans because they hunt vermin that hurt forests.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Nobody noticed the lone polyergus scout that briefly showed up this morning before she bolted away again.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The attack begins in the early afternoon.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The scout returned from her mission to find the former colonists.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: She dances erratically and spreads furrimones that excite and mass recruit more and more ants, until a large raiding party of a thousand warrior ss has formed.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: A close pact well organised column up to 10 meters long begins to move.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: As the polyergus raiding party arrives at the former colony, the attack begins almost immediately.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Dusns of attackers begin digging and clearing up debris from an air stentrance to make it easier to stall.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: As soon as they're done, hundreds of attackers rush inside.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The defenders vastly outnumber their attackers, and are formidable warriors able to shoot at it.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: But instead of fighting back effectively, they seem confused and scatter rather than fighting back.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Polyergus also seems to be somewhat resistant to the acid sprays of the defenders, and so even if a defense is forming, the attackers use their mandibles to pierce and kill.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: There are a few different ideas as to why polyergus attacks are so efficient, and one of the most fascinating ones is chemical warfare.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Instead of relying on brute force, they release a propaganda ceremony that makes the defenders panic, unable to mount an organised defense.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The attackers have nothing to gain from intense and to uncombatte other than immense casualties.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: What's more, they actually want their victims to survive so that they can be rated again in a few weeks.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: As the raid unfolds, the attackers breach deep into the colony, looking for their most valuable possession, the colonist babies.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: They grab the pupae and larvae that will make up the next generation of formica and carry them out of the nest.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Hundreds are abducted and brought back to the polyergus colony in this raid alone.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Well, most of them, a few unlucky ones are eaten as a sort of snack.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The surviving victims will be turned into slaves.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: After about an hour, the raid is over, and the formica can begin to recover.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: It seems their only strategy is to make even more ants.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: A decent sized colony can form fit thousands of pupae in a single raiding season and still survive.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Although in this case, while the raid was going on, something even more sinister happened.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Hold that thought, though, because how are polyergus turning ants into slaves?

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: How to brainwash ants slaves?

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Ants conquered almost the entire planet over 100 million years ago.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: They owe their success to being social animals that perfected chemical communication.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Chemical signals and cues let ants know what their colony needs and what each individual should do.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: And most importantly, in this case, who is a friend or foe.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Slave making ants are much less social than other ant species.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Some species miss a lot of the genes other ants have to make communication possible.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: In a sense, they are bad at talking to each other.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: So it may be that as polyergus ants have started to abduct other ants, they lost the ability to collaborate and work together productively.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Soon after the stodin four-micar offspring have been brought to the Slave of Colony, they are progressively covered in polyergus' pharaohs.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: They are chemically imprinted, similar to a duckling, who imprints on its mother after birth.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: When the new slaves hatched, they behave as though they are part of the polyergus colony and begin to work for them unconditionally, keeping the nest clean, caring for the next generation of slaves and masters, hunting for food and feeding their enslave as mouth to mouth.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: This sort of brainwashing goes so far that if they encounter free formic ants in the world, they will treat them as animals.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: In a sense, they are not true slaves as they serve willingly and show no interest in freedom.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: It's more like violent, abduction and adoption, which doesn't make things that much better.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: And as the four-micar only live for a few months, a constant new supply of victims is necessary.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Two survive, polyergus can never stop in Slavey.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: How to make new slave colonies?

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: How are new polyergus colonies created?

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: After all, polyergus workers are so useless that a queen can't start a new colony without slaves.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: But how does she make slaves without warriors?

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: It turns out there are two main strategies.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The more dangerous one might unfold during a raid like the one we witnessed before.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: A young polyergus queen silently follows the raiding party.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Using the chaos of the invasion, she's able to find her way to the four-micar queen and kill her, taking over the second colony.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Although, such a victory may be very short-nifths.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Polyergus do not tolerate other slave colonies within their hunting ground.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: They raided each other firstly too, and can destroy the competing colonies nearby.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: So while those tactics sometimes works, it is pretty dangerous.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Another young queen is going for a different strategy.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: She's looking for a four-micar colony that is further from her birthplace, attacking a whole colony on her own.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: She bolts through an entrance, pushing aside confused ants that try to stop her, releasing a powerful appeasement ceremony that drives defenders away.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: She has only a short time window to find the four-micar queen deep in the hostile nest.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Once she finds her target, both queens engage in a fight to the death.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The polyergus queen is well equipped with her sharp mandibles.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: She bites and rips into her victim for about half an hour before she finally comes down.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Between her bite, she licks the chemical surface of the dead four-micar queen, covering herself in her fair modes.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: When she's done with this macarbra ritual, four-micar workers approach her.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Subdued by her intense smells, they start grooming and feeding her as though pledging their allegiance to their new ruler.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: She still might not be done though.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: For macar colonies often have multiple queens who all need to be defeated, which is not guaranteed.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Often, attacking queens will be stopped by a phallence of workers that rip her apart or are defeated in raw battle.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: But if she does manage to kill all the queens, the colony has been taken over and the enslaved brood will begin to serve a new queen.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: The Eusepper.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: She now begins laying eggs that are cared for by her new slaves until new polyergus ants hatched, that will soon start new raids on neighbouring colonies.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: No matter what we humans do, quietly below our feet, the world war of the ants is raging, with wild and horrible strategies fought by billions of individuals every single day.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: Polyergus will continue to hunt for slaves as to stop raiding would be their demise.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: And in the war of the ants, there is no giving up.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: We want to explore even more ant species in videos to come, but not just ants, our planet has so many more wonders to marvel at and learn about.

Title: The Horror of the Slaver Ant
Sentence: That is, if we manage to preserve their habitat and turn the tide on climate change, something we're very passionate about at Cotskazart and have covered extensively in past videos.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Supernovae are the most powerful explosions in the universe, unleashing enough energy to outshine galaxies.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: We have no real metaphor for their power.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: If the Sun were to magically go supernova, it would feel like you were being hit by the energy of a nuclear explosion every second for weeks.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: While Supernovae are the engines of creation, forging the elements that enable life, they also burn sterile whole regions of galaxies.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: So what would happen if one hit Earth?

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: There are roughly speaking two ways to make a supernova.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Either the core of a massive star implodes or less common, a white dwarf gains mass to the point where it ignites explosive nuclear fusion.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: The outcome is the same, a supernova explosion.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: When we think of an explosion on Earth, we think of something that happens fast and ends, but a supernova is more like a volcanic eruption followed by a tsunami.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: At first, there's a colorful ball of hot expanding gas, creating a spectacular cloud that will shine for about a month, but then it doesn't stop.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Hot-and-dangerous gas rushes outwards at speeds of 10,000 kilometers a second through the near vacuum of space, sweeping up the sparse gas of the galaxy.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: This wall of gas expands for tens of thousands of years and will eventually span up to dozens of light years until it finally cools off and disperses its substance back into the galaxy.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: So what if this starts a tsunami hits us?

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Well, the damage depends on how far away it is.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Stage 1, thousands of light years away.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: They are paired as new stars, some outshining the moon, twinkling for a few weeks, and disappearing.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Aside from looking very pretty at this distance, they don't do much to us.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Stage 2, 300 light years away.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Things begin to get a bit picky once a supernova occurs around 300 light years away.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: We can expect one this close to us every few million years.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: A single star giving the night sky an eerie glow like twilight, and while this is far enough away and dim enough to not do harm to us, they can affect the earth.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: At these distances, it's like being hit by the last week waves of the star tsunami.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Not strong enough to do real damage, but still noticeable.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: In fact, we know that over the past 10 million years, multiple supernovae have struck Earth from these distances because we can find radioactive isotopes of iron deep in the rocks and sediments at the bottom of the ocean.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Amazingly, these supernovae around the solar system have cleared a 1000 light year wide pocket of space that's called the local bubble.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: They blew away the interstellar gas and dust creating a lumpy wall of gas that's now a cradle for star formation.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Stage 3, 150 light years away.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Once the supernova happens much closer than 300 light years, we're approaching the zone where it does a real damage.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Stars have extremely powerful magnetic fields, when they die, the tsunami of dead star actually retains a lot of this magnetic energy woven through the shockwave that expands outwards.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: In this highly magnetized cloud, we get conditions like in a huge particle accelerator that's accelerating charged particles like protons, nuclei and electrons to immense speeds, which means we have an expanding cloud that is shooting deadly radiation in all directions long after the bright light from the initial explosion has faded away.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: If a supernova happens too close by, waves of these cosmic rays will wash over the solar system for thousands of years.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: While we're mostly protected on Earth's surface by the atmosphere and ozone layer, the influx of extra radiation will still increase cancer and mutation rates.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Not enough to cause a mass extinction, but it will be noticeable.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Spaceflight would become impossible in the solar system as astronauts wouldn't survive the waves of radiation for long.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: We don't know exactly how bad this would be, but a supernova that it's close enough may trap our species on Earth for generations, maybe thousands of years.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: It only gets worse from here.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Stage 4, close to them 100 light years.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Within 100 light years, things get bad as a supernova disrupts our climate in ways that we don't fully understand yet.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: There are a few unpleasant things happening all one after another.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: First, the high energy photons arrive from the explosion followed by many decades of radiation from the radioactive tsunami, both at which seriously damaged the ozone layer, Earth's shield against harmful radiation.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: The ozone layer absorbs ultraviolet radiation by breaking apart ozone, O3, into O2 and a free oxygen atom which later reforms back into another ozone molecule.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: But the supernova radiation breaks up nitrogen molecules that gobble up the free oxygen, breaking the cycle, and depletting the ozone layer quickly.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Without a radiation shield, everybody living on the surface is exposed to very high levels of UV radiation from our sun.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Cancer rates would skyrocket and just going outside during the day could be life threatening.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: The extra radiation would also kill a lot if not most of the plankton in the oceans that live near the surface and are the basis for the marine food chains, leading to a mass extinction.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Worst still, supernova radiation would ionize gas in the atmosphere, which means that it would punch through molecules and knock electrons off nuclei leaving them charged.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: These charged nuclei then act as seats for water vapor together and form massive global clouds.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: In the worst case, they would reflect enough sunlight to trigger an ice-age.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: In fact, it's thought that the ice-age 2.5 million years ago was caused by a supernova.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Some scientists even think that a supernova about 60 light years away might have been the cause of the Devonian mass extinction 350 million years ago.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: But wait, there's more.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: The electrons punched free by the radiation form enormous electric avalanches, or in other words, lightning.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Earth is hit by some of the worst thunderstorms in millions of years.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: The intense lightning causes global wildfires that consume forests and crops, devastate cities, disrupt our electrical grids, and global supply chains.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: All while a decimated ozone layer leaks deadly radiation.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: While in the past, the ecosystem may have bounced back from a nearby supernova after a few thousand or million years, there's no guarantee modern civilization can take a hit at this magnitude.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: We would face food shortages, skyrocketing prices, and wars, as nations struggle to not be consumed by chaos.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: So a supernova this close would at the very least do significant damage for hundreds or thousands of years if not end our modern civilization and with its millions or even billions of lives.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Still, humanity would likely survive and could recover.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Stage 5, closer than 25 light years.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: A supernova closer than 25 light years means that we're in its kill radius where a mass extinction is or but guaranteed.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Probably about half of the ozone layer would be destroyed and massive climactic disruption on the scale we've never witnessed would ravage Earth.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Entire ecosystems would swiftly be wiped out by radiation as global wildfires envelop the panis.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: All the things described before happen but way more intensely and much faster.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: A few people might survive for years in bunkers if they have food supplies but the what they return to will be devastated and hostile to life for hundreds of thousands of years.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Human extinction is extremely likely.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Final stage, four light years.

Title: The Most Extreme Explosion in the Universe
Sentence: Being any closer to a supernova is very unlikely because space is big but the effects would be extreme.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe

Sentence: But as enormous as the Universe seems looking up, it seems to get even larger when you start looking down.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: You are towering over worlds within worlds, within worlds.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Each and plain site and yet hidden from your experience.

Sentence: Let's go on a journey.

Sentence: We'll start in a park about a thousand meters long, enough for a 15-minute walk.

Sentence: Please slip into this magic science suit, so you don't die and can still see.

Sentence: Ready?

Sentence: You are the size of a grain of sand just two millimeters high, standing on a blade of grass that seems as tall as an eight-story building to you.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: A square meter of lawn is now a dense metropolitan area with 100,000 blades or two man-hatons worth of grass towers.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: From your new tiny perspective, the part that you could quickly stroll through before is now the size of France.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Crossing it would take at least a week.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Humans sized humans, loom over you, four times taller than the Empire State Building, their steps falling from horizon to horizon.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: A be the size of a helicopter land near you, making the ground shake as its hairy carapace vibrates with each wingbeat.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: You try to escape, but a belly able to move because the air is so gooey.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Before you click the button, air resistance was belly noticeable, but as your now a thousand times smaller, it's as if the air has become a thousand times denser.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: It feels like you're moving through honey.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Flying insects like bees use this to their advantage.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Their wings are not made for gliding, but like paddles that row through the air.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Scale up to human size, the be would outrun a concord jet, except it couldn't even take off because it would be too heavy for its wings.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The microscopic realm.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: You've entered the microscopic realm and are now less than two micrometers tall about the size of an e-coli bacteria.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: From your new tiny perspective, the part you started in is now a million kilometres wide to you.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: If you walked nonstop, it would take some 25 years to cross it.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: It's hard to grasp just how huge the microscopic world is to its tiny inhabitants.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The giant bee that was close a moment ago is now the size of Mount Everest, towering high into the sky, but alive, humming and vibrating.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The air here feels almost solid to you.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: On the human scale, it would be as viscous as lava, extremely hard to push through.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The blade of grass now expands so far you can't see it's edges, stretching as wide as Paris would to a regular sized human.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: You see valleys that look like dried up riverbeds, dead patches like deserts, and giant craters left behind by veracious aphids.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: But if you look closely, this is not terrain.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: These are rows of individual cells, each the size of a house with hard exterior like glass shells.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Every few cells there are huge openings called stometer, like mouths, sucking in air and blowing out oxygen.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Suddenly the gigantic bee begins to move.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: A construct made of rigid pieces that slide against each other like a suit of armor.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: It takes off to escape a drop of water the size of an asteroid that fell for another blade of grass and is now rushing at you at breathtaking speeds.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: You brace for impact, but instead of feeling a strong punch, you just get satin.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: You try to swim with the water feels thick and sticky and holds onto your limbs like glue.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Air molecules are free spirits, while water molecules act more like social creatures that group together whenever possible.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: They put on each other and create a relatively strong cohesive force that traps you.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: You can't help it, but you're still moving, tumbling in all directions, helplessly dragged along by an invisible current.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Floating in this miniature lake are tens of thousands of microorganisms.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: They take on many forms, viruses the size of tennis balls float around you aimlessly.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Others like you glina oxyure cells pass you like freight trains.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: But most look like oily jellyfish the size of a car, sporting long tentacles that act like supercharged propellers.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: To spite the water holding onto them like glue, some move hundreds of body lengths per second.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: A equivalent to a person shuffling through mud at over 600 kilometers now.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: However, bacteria weigh so little and water is so viscous that they basically have no inertia.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: There is no gliding on this scale.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The result is a weird jerky motion that's hard to keep track of.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Maybe we can learn more about this strange motion if we go even deeper.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The molecule realm.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: You've become the size of a molecule, just under two nanometers wide.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: At your new tiny scale, the droplet now seems as big as the moon to a regular human.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The blade of grass it rests on could reach from the tip of Alaska to the end of Australia.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: And the park is now almost the size of the solar system.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: But instead of mostly empty space, it is filled with stuff.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Everywhere you look, there are innumerable amounts of molecules and atoms.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The rigid walls of the grass cells beneath you are clearly vibrating, Ripling with waves of energy.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The water droplet contains nearly a six-dillion water molecules that are all in motion.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Water is actually a store of age to own molecules smashing into each other hundreds of trillions of times a second.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Each of them is moving its beads of around 2,300 kilometers now, and bombard their surroundings muslously, sending small objects hurtling in all directions.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: This is the source of the invisible current that you noticed when you were a thousand times larger.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Scaling this speed up to the shielding scale is impossible as a shielding sized molecule would be 2,000 times faster than the speed of light.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: All this furious motion comes from heat.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Heat is a bit abstract at our human scale, where you touch something and get a vague sense of whether it's hot or cold.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: But down here, you really feel what heat is.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The motion of molecules vibrating, twisting and colliding as if they're inside a furious ball pit.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: When these molecules lose heat, they move more slowly and collide less often.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: When they gain heat, they speed up and smash together with renewed further.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Temperature is basically the measure of the average speed of these fantastic dances performing all day.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Suddenly, a molecule hits you especially hard, and your catapulted out of the water droplet into the air again.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: And here, you see something unexpected.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: The stuff between the air molecules, nothing.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: Between the molecules that make up the air, there is a vacuum.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: On average, a molecule in the air travels for about 60 nanometers, which is about the length of a hockey rink if it were the size of a human.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: If we were to compress all the molecules and atoms buzzing around in the room you're watching this in, they would only fill about 0.1% of its volume.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: 99.9% of the space around you is a vacuum.

Title: Let’s Travel to The Most Extreme Place in The Universe
Sentence: You just don't notice it.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Friends, make life good.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: They provide the scaffolding that makes it not just bearable, but fun.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: They give us a sense of meaning and purpose and a source of security, self-esteem, and happiness.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Almost nothing predicts how happy you will be as how connected you feel and a lack of social connection is associated with a number of diseases and a shorter life.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: But maybe you have scrolled through your phone, unsure who to call to go to a movie with, to celebrate with or ask for comfort.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: You may realize that you don't have enough friends and feel lonely, and it's not just you.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Disconnectedness and loneliness are widespread.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Many people want more close friends, but don't know how to get them.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Surprisingly nowadays, loneliness is highest among young people, whose relationships were also hit especially hard by the global pandemic.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Social distancing stopped teens and young adults from mingling in classrooms, clubs, or dorms.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Millions of friendships may be lifelong friendships that might have blossomed will never exist, with profound long-term consequences for our collective happiness.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: The good news is that it's not too late and there are lots of friends to be found.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: We'll mix scientific information with actionable advice in this video, but we can't address every individual situation.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: People, cultures and schedules are different.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: If you suffer from chronic loneliness, you can also watch the video we made about it.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Okay, as with all important things in life, making friends is infuriatingly simple, but not necessarily easy, but it works through a few pretty straightforward mechanisms.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: The most important thing about making friends.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: People make friends with other people when they spend casual time together.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: This is how our ancestors formed their relationships because humans lived in small, close-knit communities in which options for making friends were limited so we just formed good relationships with the people who were around us.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: This is why it's so easy to form new friendships in school and university.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Society locks you and your peers in a building for several years.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: You share similar activities, but more importantly, similar schedules.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Overlapping and fluctuating social circles form naturally giving you regular face time and shared experiences with many different people.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Time to find others with similar worldviews or senses of humour.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Proximity could be more important than similar interests.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: One study found that in student dormitories, the distance between rooms was the strongest friendship predictor.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Living closer together, meant a higher chance of becoming friends.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Another study showed that being physically present in a class a lot without saying a word makes others more sympathetic to you.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: To the most important principle of making friends is to regularly spend time with people in the real world.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: This alone can make it happen automatically and trumps all other advice.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: But don't forget that making friends is not a numbers game or a competition, don't compare yourself to others.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Everyone has a social calibrator that can change as you go through life.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Maybe you are more introverted as a teen, but you are in for connection in your 20s.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Maybe you were part of sprawling social circles but prefer fewer friends in your 30s.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: There is no right or wrong, only right for you.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Why we don't have enough friends?

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: The main reason for lack of friendships is the simple fact that most people don't prioritize friendships nearly enough.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: They don't realize until it's too late that retaining friendships demands a regular energy and attention.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Although they are so important for happiness, friends often take a back seat to other life decisions.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Work, commuting, romance or kids take up so much time and energy that it's so much easier to crash on your couch and lose yourself in mind the sanctivities.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Especially as an adult, going for a bike ride, getting dinner or visiting a hobby store takes much more mental effort and commitment than it did after school when time ran slower and energy and curiosity were abandoned.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: But it's not just adults who are too busy for friends.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: The average American teenager spends more time on TikTok every day than socializing at parties, events or on the phone with friends combined.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Established friendships don't require the same time investment as early friendships to keep up but they do require some commitment.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: As life distracts you, it's easy to skip out on checking in when a friend goes through exciting or depressing times.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: And so many friendships fade for lack of attention often by accident, which is extra tragic because there is never only one person losing a friend, it's always at least two.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Another thing that makes many people vulnerable is the way friendship networks are structured.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: The friendship paradox is the phenomenon that on average most people have fewer friends than their friends, which makes sense since you're more likely to be friends with someone who has many friends than with someone who has few.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Rather than being densely interconnected, friend networks are often built around central hubs.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: So if central people disappear from your life, this can deprive you of many connections at once, and it can lead to a distorted self-perception that you are less popular than others although you are perfectly average.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: It can get worse quickly with big life events, maybe you move for school, work or love, and are left without social networks.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Or you had a breakup that left you with a smaller part of the formerly shared social pie.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: The reasons why you find yourself with less connection than you want are as diverse as people, but the underlying cause is almost always time.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: There is no shortcut.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: To make new friends and retain friendships, you have to prioritize relationships, spend time with people in real life, and make them feel that you care.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: So take a look at yourself and rebalance what you spend your life doing.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: How to make new friends.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Studies have shown that new friendships can develop quite quickly weeks after you meet someone.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: But it takes a few months for a casual friendship to become a close relationship, with the biggest impediment being time invested and the quality of your interactions.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: To make friends it helps if you intentionally look for people you have things in common with and who are open to new relationships.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: You want to make it easy for yourself so examine what kind of person you are.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Generally speaking, extraverts tend to crave sensory stimulation, spicier foods, loud music, or the excitement of engaging the crowd.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Extraverts often confuse with shy people tend to be more sensitive to sensory stimulants and prefer quieter surroundings, fewer people, and even less spicy food.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Different places attract different people.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Not everybody can easily make friends at a bar or a football game, not everybody finds a stroll through a park or a bookstore stimulating.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Men especially form friendships around shared activities, but in general it's a good idea to go to places that feel comfortable, whether a people you might like who do things you find interesting.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Look for local clubs or opportunities to volunteer.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Check out what hobby stores are around and dust off your space marines or see if there are new D&D groups in your city and ask if you could join one.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Check Meet Up Apps for Gaming Nights or Wine Tasting, join a sports club or look for people who go hiking or want to cook together.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Another obvious avenue is your professional life.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: It helps if you work and a job that attracts people like you so you might consider this when you choose a career.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Depending on your relationship with colleagues can lead to great friendships, especially if you look for peers and there is no parent balance.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: And of course there are friends you've lost touch with.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: You may be able to revive some of these relationships.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: In some cases all it needs is a call or an invitation.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Research shows that more often than not the other person will appreciate that you've reached out.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: There are likely way more opportunities to spend time with others than you are aware of.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: And if there aren't you can take the initiative and create them.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Invitations are signals to start friendships.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: So bring people together by having a dinner party, organizing a football game after work or starting a board game group.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Everybody appreciates people who organize fun things and the simple act of reaching out can kick start a self-propelling upward spiral of well-being, fun and connectedness that can seriously improve the life of everyone around you in meaningful ways.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: If you meet someone you vibe with it's pretty scary to make the first move but they may feel the same way.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Equally interested in a friendship but also blocked by fear of rejection.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: So it's worth going for it.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Worst case they're not interested which will sting for a few hours but the best case could be a lifelong friendship.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: A risk will worth the reward.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Once you've formed early connections check in whether they have important things happening in their life.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Of course it's important not to be overbearing but the more time you invest the more opportunity you have to engage in meaningful banter or city jokes.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: The fact that friendships take time also means that you need to be patient and kind with yourself especially if you're out of practice.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Things will not improve overnight but slowly step by step if you keep up.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Open up, care and share.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Many people don't have an issue being around others but struggle to turn acquaintances into friends.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: So let's talk about two important principles that make it more likely that you're connected.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Caring and sharing.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: In general our favourite topic is ourselves and the things we care about because we are literally at the centre of our own universe.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: So people tend to like people who are genuinely interested in them.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: So if you want to make friends your goal should be trying to learn what makes them take.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Just as important as caring about others is reciprocity and openness.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: The connect you need to share the experiences that made you, you.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Now you don't want to overwhelm the other person and immediately spill out your deepest secrets but open up a little and reveal personal things because this also signals to others that it's okay to do the same.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: The best case is that you find shared experiences.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Maybe you both had a hard time in school, maybe you share a passion for weird movies.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Learning about others and sharing personal stories in a balanced way and not overdoing it is not an exact science.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Noticing the line between opening up and oversharing requires practice and depends on the vibe of the conversation.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: In general it's good to be laid back, have fun and enjoy yourself.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Do things for yourself without expectations but also be open to social opportunities and accept invitations if they show up.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: And that's basically it.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Give friendships more priority in your life.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: Check in with friends and regularly go to things to have fun.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: So genuine interest in others and give them the opportunity to know you without selling yourself too hard.

Title: Why You Are Lonely and How to Make Friends
Sentence: If you do this, you're on track.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: At its height, the Roman Empire was home to about 30% of the world's population.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: And in many ways, it was the pinnacle of human advancement.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: It citizens enjoyed the benefits of central heating, concrete, double glazing, banking, international trade, and upward social mobility.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Rome became the first city in history with 1 million inhabitants, and was a centre of technological, legal and economic progress.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: An empire impossible to topple, stable and rich and powerful.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Until it wasn't anymore.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: First, slowly, then suddenly the most powerful civilization on earth collapsed.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: By civilization, we mean a complex society where labor is specialised and social classes emerge, and which is ruled by institutions.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Civilisation, share a dominant mutual language and culture, and domesticate plants and animals to feed and sustain large cities, where they often construct impressive monuments.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Civilisation lets us become efficient on large scales, collect vast amounts of knowledge, and put human ingenuity and the natural resources of the world to work.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Without civilization, most people would never have been born.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Which makes it a bit concerning that collapse is the role, not the exception.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Virtually all civilizations end, on average after 340 years.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Collapses rarely nice for individuals.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Their shared cultural identity is shattered as institutions lose the power to organise people.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Knowledge is lost, living standards fall, violence increases, and often the population declines.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: The civilization either completely disappears is absorbed by stronger neighbours or something new emerges, sometimes with more primitive technology than before.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: If this is how it's been over the ages, what about us today?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Just as Europeans forgot how to build indoor plumbing and make cement, will we lose our industrial technology and with that our greatest achievements from one dollar pizza to smartphones or laser eye surgery?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: We'll all this go away too.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Today, our city's stretch for thousands of square kilometers.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: We travel the skies.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Our communication is instant.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Industrial agriculture with engineered high-yield plants, efficient machinery and high-potency fertilizer, feeds billions of people.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Modern medicine gives us the longest lifespan we've ever had, while industrial technology gives us an unprecedented level of comfort and abundance.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Even though we haven't yet learned to attain them without destroying our ecosystem.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: There are arguably still different civilizations around today that compete and coexist with each other, but together they also form a singular global civilization.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: But this modern globalized civilization is even more vulnerable in some ways than past empires because we are much more deeply interconnected.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: A collapse of the industrialized world literally means that the majority of people alive today would perish since without industrial agriculture we would no longer be able to feed them.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: And there's an even greater risk.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: What if a collapse was so deeply destructive that we were unable to re-industrialise again?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: What if it ruined our chances of enjoying a flourishing future as a malty planetary species?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: A global civilization or collapse could be an existential catastrophe, something that ruins not just the lives of everyone alive today, but all the future generations that could have come into being.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: All the knowledge we might have discovered, the art we might have created, the joys we might have experienced, would be lost.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: So how likely is all of this?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Let's start with some good news.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: While civilization collapses have happened regularly, none have ever derailed the course of global civilization.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Rome collapsed, but the X might empire or the Tier Tierquans, and of course the Byzantine Empire, Caradon.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: What about sudden population crashes?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: So far, we've not seen a catastrophe that has killed much more than 10% of the global population.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: No pandemic, no natural disaster, no war.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: The last clear example of a rapid global population decrease was the black death, a pandemic of the bubonic plague in the 14th century that spread across the Middle East and Europe, and killed a third of all Europeans and about one tenth of the global population.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: If any event was going to cause the collapse of civilization, that should have been it.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: But even the black death demonstrates humanity's resilience more than its fragility.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: While the old societies were massively disrupted in the short term, the intense loss of human lives and suffering did little too negatively impact European economic and technological development in the long run.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Population size recovered within two centuries, and just two centuries later, the industrial revolution began.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: History is full of incredible recoveries from horrible tragedies.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Take the atomic bombing of Hiroshima during World War II.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: 140,000 people were killed, and 90% of the city was at least partially incinerated or reduced to rubble.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: But against all odds, they made a remarkable recovery.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Hiroshima's population recovered within a decade, and today, it's a thriving city of 1.2 million people.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: None of this made these horrible events any less horrible for those who live through them.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: But for us, as the species, these signs of resilience are good news.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Why recovery is likely, even in the worst case?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: One thing that's different from historic collapses is that humanity now has unprecedented destructive power.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Today's nuclear arsenal is a so powerful that all out global war could cause a nuclear winter and billions of deaths.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Our knowledge of our own biology and how to manipulate it is getting so advanced that it's becoming possible to engineer viruses as contagious as the coronavirus and as deadly as Ebola.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Increasingly, the risk of global pandemics is much higher than in the past.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: So we may cause a collapse ourselves, and it might be much worse than the things nature has thrown at us so far.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: But if say 99% of the population died, would global civilization collapse forever?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Could we recover from such a tragedy?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: We have some reasons to be optimistic.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Let's start with food.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: There are 1 billion agricultural workers today, so even if the global population fell to just 80 million, it's virtually guaranteed that many survivors would know how to reduce food.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: And we don't need to start at square one, because we could still use modern high-year crops.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Maze is 10 times bigger than its wild ancestor.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Ancient tomatoes were the size of today's peas.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: After agriculture, the next step towards recovery would be rebuilding industrial capacity, like power grids and automated manufacturing.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: A huge problem is that our economies of scale make it impossible to just pick up where we left off.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Many of our high-tech industries are only functional because of huge demand and intensely interconnected supply chains across different continents.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Even if our infrastructure were left unharmed, we would make huge steps backwards technologically.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: But then again, we are thinking in larger timeframes.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Industrialization originally happened 12,000 years after the agricultural revolution.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: So if we need to start over our frame massive collapse, it shouldn't be that hard to re-industrialise at least on evolutionary timescales.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: There's a hitch though.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: The industrial revolution was fueled literally by burning easily accessible coal, and we are still very much reliant on it.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: If we used it all up today, aside from making rapid climate change much worse, we could hinder our ability to recover from a huge crisis.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: So we should stop using easy-to-access coal, so it can surface a civilization insurance in case something bad happens.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Another thing that makes recovery likely is that we'd probably have most of the information we need to rebuild civilization.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: We would certainly lose a lot of crucial institutional knowledge, especially on hard drives that nobody could read or operate anymore.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: But a lot of the technological scientific and cultural knowledge stored in the world's 2.6 million libraries would survive the catastrophe.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: The post-collapsus survivors would know what used to be possible, and they could reverse engineers some of the tools and machines they'd find.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: In conclusion, despite the bleak prospect of catastrophic threats, natural or created by ourselves, there is reason for optimism.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Human kind is remarkably resilient, and even in the case of a global civilization or collapse, it seems likely that we would be able to recover.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Even if many people were to perish or suffer immense hardship.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Even if we lost cultural and technological achievements in the process.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: But given the stakes, the risks are still unnervingly high.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Nuclear war and dangerous pandemics threaten the amazing global civilization we have built.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: Humanity is like a teenager, speeding around blind corners, drunk without a seat belt.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: The good news is that it's still early enough to prepare for and to mitigate these risks.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?
Sentence: We just need to actually do it.

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?

Title: Is Civilization on the Brink of Collapse?

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: The future of humanity seems insecure.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: Rapid climate change, political division, our greed and failings, make it hard to look at our species with a lot of optimism and so many people think our end is in sight.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: But humans have always thought they lived in the end times.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: Every generation assumes they're important enough to witness the apocalypse and their life just goes on.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: This is a problem because it leads to short-term thinking and prevents us from creating the best world for ourselves and our descendants.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: What makes this worse is that we may actually be living at an extremely critical moment in human history.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: To understand why, let's look at the temporal window of humanity and ask, when will the last human be born and how many people will there ever be?

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: These sorts of estimates come with a lot of uncertainties, so please take them with a gigantic grain of salt.

Sentence: To get a sense of how many people there will be, let's see how many people have already lived.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: Modern humans arose some 200,000 years ago.

Sentence: They were uniquely good at making tools, telling stories, thinking abstractly, planning and working together in large groups beyond their close family.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future

Sentence: It took us 150,000 years to grow to a population of 2 million.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: This was when our numbers really started growing.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: It took 10,000 more years to get to 300 million, but that increase was dwarfed by the Industrial Revolution.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future
Sentence: In 1800, there were a billion of us.

Title: The Last Human – A Glimpse Into The Far Future

Sentence: Today we number around 8 billion.
