Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: If you are like most people, there is a gap between the person you are and the person you wish to be.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: There are little things you think you should do and bit things you ought to achieve.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: From working out regularly, eating healthy, learning a language, working on your novel, reading more or simply actually doing your hobby instead of browsing Reddit.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: But it sometimes feels that to achieve your goals, you have to become a different person.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Someone who is consistent, puts in more effort, has discipline and willpower.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Maybe you've tried your hardest to be like that, and it worked for a while.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Until you find yourself slipping back into your old ways.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: In the end, you always seem to fail, and with every failed attempt, you become more and more frustrated and annoyed with yourself.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: If you believe success and hustle internet, it's all your own fault.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: If you don't succeed, you just didn't want it enough, and the failure is all you.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: But change is actually hard, and as with most things in life, understanding why makes things easier.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: The Jungle Imagine your brain as a lush and dense jungle.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Moving through it, say to make a decision to do something, is like moving through an actual jungle.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: It's hard and it costs energy.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Your brain hates expanding energy, so it came out with a trick.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: All your actions and behaviors leave paths in the jungle of your brain.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: As you start doing something, you tremble down some plants and make rough and provides trails through the undergrowth.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: The more often you do the thing, the more pronounced the trail becomes.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Over time it turns into a path that is easier to trace, so you take it more often, and it turns into a street.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: As you repeat doing the thing over and over for years, the street turns into a highway.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Traversing it becomes effortless, familiar, and comfortable.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: The more pronounced your brain highways, the more you get used to their comfort, so we continue to use them, which means we tend to do what we've always done.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: This is why changes hard, especially as an adult, when your jungle is criss-crossed by lots of established streets and highways.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: To understand how those highways are built, we need to distinguish between two things.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Rootines and habits.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: The things you do, routines and habits.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: A routine is a sequence of actions that you carry out the same way every time because they've worked out well for you.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: For example, you get the same ingredients for your favorite dish and cook them in a certain order because you like the taste of the result.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Or before going to bed, you've sat in a line at 630 because this is when you want to get up.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Imagine routines as being executed by a wise panor.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: It's slow and analytical, responsible for strategizing and mental calculations.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: The planet is aware of the future and carefully considers what kinds of result you want.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Based on that, it chooses actions to achieve specific outcomes, even if they are uncomfortable, like taking a shower after getting up.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Rootines can eventually turn into habits which feel much easier because they're basically a sequence of actions carried out without thinking about them.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: You've done them so often before that your brain considers them rewarding and a great response to a situation.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: So a habit can feel like you're on autopilot.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: You don't have to convince yourself to do something that's a habit, you just do it.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: The important thing about habits is that they are set in motion by triggers.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Context cues that can be single things or entire situations that give your brain the signal to start the behavior or action.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: You already have a lot of triggers in your life, like when you see your phone.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: You almost always unlock the screen.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Or you reach for the seat belt when you sit in a car.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Or when you buy your coffee before work, you also get a cookie, even though you aren't actually hungry.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Habits are executed by an impulsive toddler.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: It responds to your immediate desires based on what's around you.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Without considering any longer term goals.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: For the toddler, the future doesn't exist and it hates hard work.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: So when it notices a trigger, it steers you to take this easy road inside your brain that leads to a familiar rewarding result.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: If you get coffee, the toddler also wants the cookie just because that's what you do every morning.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: This rewarding feeling is also how most of your bad habits started.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Chocolate is tasty, browsing reddish is occasionally mildly entertaining.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: This is why you repeat these actions even if they're bad for you.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Rewarding feelings associated with an action demand to be repeated and so a bad habit is born.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: While the toddler sounds like a built in sabotage mechanism, it is as important as the wise planner and actually they work together most of the time.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: You need your wise planner for thinking big thoughts and parallel parking and doing your taxes.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: But letting your wise planner do everything would cost too much energy.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Out sourcing mundane and repetitive tasks to habits, managed by the toddler, allows your brain to easily manage your daily life while dealing with more complex mental challenges at the same time.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: So if we want to change and introduce a new behavior into our lives, we can actually use these energy-saving mechanisms to make it easier.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: We'll focus on small things, not big ones.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Improving your life a little is so much better than aiming high and changing nothing, especially because small changes can do a lot over months and years.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: How to build a habit?

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: If you want to make change easier, the best way may not be to force it with a willpower, but to convince your brain that it's not that big of a deal.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: By creating new routines and then turning them into habits, you want your wise planner to construct that first trail and then use your toddler to help initiate the action evilously.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Let's say you want to work out to be fitter, a very common goal.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: The first thing to do is to break down this pretty vague goal into clear separate actions, because the idea is to make the action itself as easy a threshold as possible.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: So small, it's manageable and so specific that you don't have to think about it a lot.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: For example, a tangible, controllable action might be doing 10 squats every morning.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: So you can start by trying to create a routine, but already include clear triggers that the toddler can pick out later on.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Remember, a trigger is nothing more than a signal that you always associate with the action.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: They can be visual pointers like seeing a particular object, like your training outfit.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Or a certain time of day, or a designated place like a nearby park, or even better, all of these things combined.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: The important thing is that you always start doing your action in a specific context.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: This trigger is the start button that will eventually set off the action automatically.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: So to establish a home workout habit with 10 squats to begin with, you could make sure to always do them with your exercise gear on at the same place and time like in your living room at ATM.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Once you have your trigger and action, all you need to do is repeat them regularly, ideally every day.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: If you keep going, they will change from a routine to a habit, from a trail to a highway.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Don't get this wrong, the squats will still take you energy to do.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: But the decision to do them will feel much less like a chore, and more like a regular part of your day.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: While this is simple, it's not easy.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Many things you want to turn into habit don't offer as much instant gratification as wasting time on Reddit.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: To make your new action easier to repeat, and more likely to be picked up by the toddler, try to make it pleasurable.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Not necessarily by rewarding yourself after you've done it, but by making the action more behaviour itself more enjoyable.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Like only listening to your favourite podcast while working out, or chipping away your taxes, while you wait for civilization to load the next round.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: You need to figure out what works for you.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: In principle, that's it.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Frustratingly simple, like most things you can do to make your life better.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: How long it takes for your toddler to take over and establish a habit varies widely.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: It depends on the behaviour you're trying to get used to, what kind of person you are, your stress levels, and many more things.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: It takes anything between 15 and 250 days until a new habit is kicked off automatically by its trigger.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: You won't know how long it will take for you.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Starting is the easy part, especially in the first week or two.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Continuing to do it every day is the heart part, but it does get easier as you keep going.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: There are no silver bullets for change, but the science of habits is a reminder that it is possible no matter how old or young you are.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Even if you only end up doing a little more good stuff or a few new things, that's still a success.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Being a little bit more healthier knowledgeable is a million times better than being unhappy about a thing and changing nothing.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: In the end, change is a direction, not a destination.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: So now, hoping we've given you a bit of insight and motivation, here is a thing we made to make this progress easier with design and science.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Please bear in mind you don't need to buy anything to work on yourself.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: This is optional.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Having said that, we struggle with changes much as anyone else, so we've created our own habit journal as much for ourselves as for you.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Before we printed out a thing, we tested it on ourselves and got feedback from the courts' exact team and experts.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: The idea is for you to track your habit progress for your desired behaviour.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: There's a tutorial part which guides you through the hardest part of the process step by step.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: You'll get helpful pointers, reflect on your progress and how you could make things easier for yourself.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Once you get through the tutorial part, the habit journal starts regularly into woven with examples, science breaks and reflections that we hope will help keep the journey interesting.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Like our gratitude journal, it's cloth bound with an embossed hardcover and printed on high-quality paper.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: Nice to the touch and with lots of beautiful illustrations, this book is a companion on your personal change journey.

Title: Change Your Life – One Tiny Step at a Time
Sentence: However small or big, it may be.

Sentence: Getting things from our shop is the best way to support courts' results and what we try to do here on the channel.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Look around you.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Where are you?

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Where is this place you're occupying?

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Somewhere in a room maybe in a city on a continent on a planet orbiting a star in a galaxy among billions.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: But, where is all of that?

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: While this may feel like a laughed question, it turns out that the concept of an absolute position is something humans made up.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: In a nutshell, the universe is a big bag of space that has things in it.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: If someone removed all these things, the stars and planets and black holes and dust, there would just be empty space left.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: In empty space, the concept of having a position loses all meaning.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Empty space is uniform, the same everywhere.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: The space we occupy is not like a stage under our feet.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: We can't mark specific points or staple something to space time as an anchor.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Without things, there is no position.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: We are really ever only at a position in relation to something else, which also means that things we take for granted like up and down are actually relative to.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Okay, let's fill the universe up with things again and try to find out where you are right now, relative to everything else.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Let's start this video at a familiar place and then get increasingly weird.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: From your perspective, the world is seemingly flat and you can move in three dimensions.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: It's what physicists call a frame of reference the perspective you have of the universe and how you see things moving around you, where you're up and down is.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Your frame of reference is correct for you, but not for the rest of the universe.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Around five kilometres from you, whether horizon begins, the ground noticeably curves away from you.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: If you could see through the ground, you'd see people from below or sideways, but they don't fall down off the planet because gravity doesn't actually pull them down.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Down is an illusion of your reference frame.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Two Earth's reference frame, gravity just pulls in.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: But for humans, there is an up and down because within our frame of reference, that just makes sense, which is also why we think that the planet itself has an up and down, north and south, and we made our maps accordingly.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: But an observer looking at the solar system might disagree.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Our maps make sense to us because we're used to them, not because they are correct.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Okay, so this is step one.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Your position on what feels like a flat surface, but is actually a sphere.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: But this sphere is always moving, never staying in one position.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Earth is orbiting a star, the sun at the centre of the solar system.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: While we usually imagine this is pretty orderly, someone looking at us from the outside would see something pretty messy.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: To see this more clearly, we'll exaggerate all these movements.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: This is not to scale.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: The first of all, Arorbit Rely is an ellipse, so we spend half the year sinking a little bit closer to the sun, speeding up, and half the year rising up a bit and slowing down.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: And the ellipse itself changes its shape every 100,000 years too.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: And in another cycle of 112,000 years, the ellipse itself is drifting, which at least creates a beautiful shape.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: In the end, we get an orbital path that looks like a wobbly circle with wave edges.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: And it gets worse as the moon now starts to mess things up too.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: As the moon is a pretty massive thing, it pulls on Earth.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Both objects are with their common centre of gravity that lies around 4,700 kilometres off to the side of Earth's core.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: In practice, this means that as the moon orbits Earth, it's jerking Earth around a bit, enough to make it jiggle.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Okay, so you're standing on the surface of a rotating panis that is jiggling around the sun in an elliptical orbit that changes a bit every year.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: But who's to say the Earth is right?

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: From the perspective of the sun, the plane of the solar system is arbitrary.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: It's defined as the plane, the Earth orbits in, because that is convenient for us.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: In reality, the other planets are just a little bit inclined with respect to our plane.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: From their point of view, with the ones with a slightly bent orbit.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: But this isn't it, far from it.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: The solar system as a hole is orbiting the centre of the Milky Way galaxy.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: If we look at the Milky Way, we can clearly make out a galactic plane in which the solar system orbits the centre every 230 million years.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: But of course, it's not that simple.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: First of all, the plane of the solar system is not aligned with the plane of the galaxy.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Nothing really is, just like the planets in the solar system orbit the sun on their own planes, so to all the stars orbiting the galactic centre.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: The solar system as a hole is tilted about 60 degrees towards the galactic plane, speeding through space at almost a million kilometers per hour.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Someone in the centre of the galaxy would see the orbits of the planet's moving through space in a helix shape, which you can imagine as a corkscrew motion on the tilted plane of the solar system relative to the plane of the galaxy.

Sentence: This orientation in space means that sometimes the planets are sort of in front of the sun as it orbits around the galactic core.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Let's just look at this for a moment.

Sentence: There is a strange and eerie beauty about how our planets and the sun move through space.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: We haven't met this motion out completely as it takes the solar system tens of millions of years to go up and back once and well humanity is not that old.

Title: You Are Not Where You Think You Are
Sentence: Let's look at your relative position again.

Sentence: On a planet tilted towards the sun, jiggled around by the moon, in a solar system tilted towards the galactic plane moving forward in a helical shape diving up and down through the plane.

Sentence: At this point the frame of reference becomes a bit arbitrary and pointless because of the nature of the universe at this scale.

Sentence: The Milky Way is part of a galaxy group that appears to be part of greatest structures like the Lennia Care Supergluster which itself is part of the gigantic Pisces, Cetus Supergluster Complex and finally a galactic filament that spans hundreds of millions of like years in all directions and orientations.

Sentence: Someone looking right at us from that far away will only see the end of greatness.

Sentence: All staff appears homogeneous the same everywhere.

Sentence: Just like with empty space when everything looks the same, who's to say anyone's view is better than anyone else's.

Sentence: If this is all a bit much, don't feel bad.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Our home is burning.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Rabbit climate change is destabilizing our world.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: It seems our emissions will not fall quickly enough to avoid runaway warming, and we may soon hit tipping points that will lead to the collapse of ecosystems and our civilization.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: While scientists, activists and much of the younger generation urge action, it appears most politicians are not committed to doing anything meaningful, while the fossil fuel industry still works actively against change.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: It seems humanity can't overcome its greed and obsession with short-term profit and personal gain to save itself.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: And so for many, the future looks grim and hopeless.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Young people feel particularly anxious and depressed.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Instead of looking ahead to a lifetime of opportunity, they wonder if they will even have a future, or if they should bring kids into this world.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: It's an age of doom and hopelessness, and giving up seems the only sensible thing to do.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: But that's not true.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: You are not doomed.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Humanity is not doomed.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Despite the seriousness of the situation, for years, positive trends have accumulated, and there is finally some good news and a clear path towards our collective climate goals.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Welcome to our TED Talk.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Please watch this video to the end.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Check out our detailed sources afterwards to learn more.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Okay, let's start with the scariest things.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Canceling the apocalypse.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Some of the most widely shared stories about climate change are that it is an existential threat, the end of human civilization, and maybe even our own extinction event, and that it's basically unavoidable now.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: But what does science actually say?

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: As of 2022, the global average temperature has risen 1.2 degrees Celsius compared to pre-industrial times.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Limiting warming to 1.5 degrees was the most ambitious goal of the Paris Agreement, but we are not likely to meet it.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Already with the warming we have today, hot places will get hotter, web places wetter, and the risk and strength of extreme weather events increase significantly.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Warming beyond two degrees makes all of these extremes more extreme.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Extreme weather events more common with more ecosystems under major pressure.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Some will not survive.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: At three degrees, significant parts of Earth especially in developing countries might become unable to feed their populations.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Heatways will become a major global issue.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Large scale natural systems will break down.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The scale and frequency of hurricanes fires and droughts will further increase, and cause trillions in damage.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Poor regions and subsistence farmers will be hit the hardest.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Hundreds of millions of people will need to leave their homes.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: In the 48 degree range, the apocalypse begins.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The hot house Earth, where things change so quickly, that it may become unable to support our large human population, and billions may perish, leaving the rest on a hostile alien planet.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: A decade ago, for lack of action and perspective, many scientists assumed a four-plus degree world was our future, and a lot of public communication focused on exactly this future path.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Luckily, it's much less likely that this version of the apocalypse will come to pass.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: If current climate policies stagnate, we're likely to end up with warming of around 3 degrees Celsius by 2100.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Which is scary and tragic and far from acceptable.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: But this is actually good news.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: How?

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: In the last decade, we've seen enough progress that most scientists now think that we have likely avoided a apocalypse to climate change.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Although substantial risk still remains, we can pretty confidently say that humanity isn't going anywhere.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Civilisation might have to change, but it will endure.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Which begs the question, what has changed over the last 10 years, and is this really good news?

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The Invisible Shift.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: You probably know this story.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The last decade has been an immense failure for climate policies around the world.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Instead of passing comprehensive binding bills that would meaningfully reduce emissions, we mostly did nothing.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: A last decade, with one negative record after another.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: And this story is true, and it's one reason why so many people are giving up.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: But it is not the whole picture.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Despite the lack of climate policies and ongoing lobbying and misinformation campaigns from the fossil fuel industries, there was a lot of progress.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Let's go back 20 years to see why today is so different.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Between 2000 and 2010, greenhouse gas emissions had grown by 24 percent, three times as much as the increase in the previous decade.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The subsidies for fossil fuels aimed at promoting economic growth caused a colossal increase in their consumption.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: For developing countries like China and India, coals the cheapest fuel for growth, while rich countries showed little interest in changing their ways.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: In 2010, many people expected these trends to continue.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Instead of decreasing fossil fuel use, its consumption would rise.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The next decade turned out to be very different though.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: First of all, coal burning in developing countries like India has slowed down or leveled off like in China, and it's plummeted in rich countries like the UK and US.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Since 2015, three quarters of planned coal plants have been cancelled, and 44 countries have committed to stop building them.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: 10 years ago, that would have seemed like wishful thinking, but today we can say with confidence, coal is dying.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: It's just not competitive anymore.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Because technologies we thought would remain expensive, matured rapidly instead.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Renewable electricity has shown explosive progress.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: In a mere decade, wind energy got three times cheaper.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Solar electricity is now 10 times cheaper.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Cheaper than coal or any other fossil fuel burning power plant, despite the massive subsidies and global infrastructure propping up fossil fuels.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: 25 times more solar and nearly five times more wind electricity is produced today compared with 10 years ago, which is of course not nearly enough.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: One of the biggest obstacles is the variability of their power output.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Renewables need a lot of energy storage to be a reliable power source, like expensive batteries.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Amazingly, battery prices have decreased by 97% in the past 30 years.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: 60% in the last decade alone, which will serve all kinds of green technology like electric cars.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: You might say, well that's great, but didn't cut results last climate video, say that while wind and solar are nice, we need nothing less than a fundamental transition of our global industrial system.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Yes, but luckily the shift goes beyond just the energy sector.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Throughout the economy, people are working on improving current technology to lower emissions.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: We're rapidly replacing old incandescent light bulbs with LEDs that are 10 times more efficient.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: In 2020, about 7 out of 10 new cars in Norway were electric or hybrid, in 2021, it was already 8 out of 10.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: And the list goes on from electric heating and better insulation to ships travelling at half speed to save fuel.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Wherever you look, you find scientists, engineers and entrepreneurs trying to solve some aspect of climate change.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: In enormous amounts of human ingenuity are being brought to bear on this problem, with more and more people deciding to prioritize preventing rapid climate change.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Solutions for low-carbon production of cement, electronics and steel, and innovations like artificial meat and carbon capture are in the works.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The more of these technologies we deploy, the cheaper new and better technology gets.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The cheaper they get, the more people use them, and so on.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: We can see the impact already.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The domestic CO2 output of rich countries is falling without a major recession.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Since the year 2000, the EU as a whole shows a 21% decrease, Italy 28%, the UK 35%, Denmark 43%.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: But the best news may be that emissions are no longer necessary coupled with the economic growth.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: In the past, this was an inconvenient truth to get richer, you had to emit more, which led to fierce arguments between developing and developed countries about the fairness of reducing emissions while their populations were still poor.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: But in the last decade we've seen that it is possible to increase prosperity without increasing emissions, emissions in the Czech Republic dropped 13%, while their GDP grew by 27%.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: France reduced their CO2 emissions by 14%, while increasing GDP by 15%.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Romania saw an 8% decrease and 35% growth.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: And even the largest economy on Earth, the USA, decreased emissions by 4%, while growing their GDP by 26%.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Some of you may call this a numbers trick, that rich countries are just exporting emissions to poor nations by moving the dirty parts of their economies like manufacturing.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: But if it will let me account for all of our imported goods, the numbers still look positive.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: It's no longer a matter of having to choose between prosperity and the climate as it seemed to be a decade ago.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Developing countries will profit from that, because as rich countries pay for the expensive development of green technologies, they can adopt them more cheaply.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: They can skip most of the higher-mission phase that today's rich countries went through.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: We are at the point where not decarbonizing is a bad business decision.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: And we haven't even really talked about solutions like carbon capture.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: In 2000 it didn't really exist.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: In 2022 that technology does exist and costs around $600 to remove one ton of CO2 from the atmosphere.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: As investment pours in and the technology matures and begins to scale, it's likely that these costs will plummet over the next few decades.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: So everything's fine then, well let's not get carried away.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: All of these processes are great but not nearly fast enough.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: We're still doing way too little and technology will not magically solve everything.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: We need to use fewer resources and use them longer, design consumicates that are repairable and durable and decrease our energy requirements.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: We need much better infrastructure, agriculture and cities.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: It will still be hard work especially to get the right policies past and in at it.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: But for the first time ever, there are a few trend lines pointing solidly in the right direction.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: And now imagine, if all of this was achieved without proper financial and political support and despite fossil fuel lobbying, just think what humanity can do when climate change finally gets the political attention and funding it needs.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: So is it okay to feel hopeful again?

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The situation is still dire and serious, so what's the point of focusing on this side of the story?

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The trap of hopelessness.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Climate change can feel overwhelming and make your future seem bleak.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: The sadness and hopelessness that many people feel is real and very destructive because it causes apathy.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!
Sentence: Apathy that is only serving the fossil fuel industry that is still delaying change however it can.

Title: We WILL Fix Climate Change!

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: What if the moon crashes into Earth?

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: It's more interesting and weird than you probably think.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: Let's start with the basics.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: Why isn't the moon on its way to crash into us already?

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: We know that Earth's gravity pulls everything towards it, including the moon, but somehow it stays up, as if suspended by some opposite force.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: But there is no other force countering gravity, instead the trip to staying up is a sideways motion that we call an orbit.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: You see orbits every day, when you throw a ball it makes a tiny little orbit.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: The only difference between the balls orbit and the moon is that the ball eventually hits the ground.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: Basically, the reason is speed.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: If you could throw your ball fast enough, it would bend around the world and combat you.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: If there were no air slowing it down, it could orbit forever.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: And this is what the moon does.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: Falling sideways around Earth, very fast with no air slowing it down, orbiting Earth every 27 days and 3,600 kilometres now.

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: So, for the moon to just stop in its orbit and plummet to the Earth, would break more laws of physics than we have time to explain.

Sentence: So, how do we crash it into Earth?

Title: What Happens if the Moon Crashes into Earth?
Sentence: In a nutshell, to change an object's orbit, you need to change its speed, which changes where gravity takes it.

Sentence: But even small changes require enormous forces, which is why all the large objects in the solar system are so stable nowadays.

Sentence: Tides exist because while Earth pulls on the moon, the moon's gravity pulls back on the Earth.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Cautica's art is lying to you.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: In every video, even in this one, because our videos distill very complex subjects into flashy, ten minute pieces and unfortunately, re-adulted years well, complicated.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: The question of how we deal with that is central to what we do on this channel and something we think about a lot.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: What we mean by lying is the concept of lies to children.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: The idea that on the path to explaining something complicated you start off with a little lie, a useful over-simplification that makes it easier to grasp a concept.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: For example, as a kid you learn that the earth is a sphere, orbiting the sun with planet bodies, but it's not actually a sphere, and the bodies are super different in size, and not close to each other at all.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: By beginning at a place of oversimplification, you're building a framework, a foundation that you can then build upon and add nuance and complexity later on.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Step by step, you're getting towards the real gist of the complicated subjects.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Science communication has to use lies to children to some degree or it turns into science education.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: And getting a proper education in all of the scientific fields would take years of intense study to become fluent in them.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: As a species we have a major interest in summarizing science and its advancement, and educating as many people about it as possible, because we all benefit if more people have a fact-based scientific worldview.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: We will discuss what science is and how it works in different videos in more detail, but for now let's just say it's a process to advance, organize, predict, and test our knowledge about the universe.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: If you understand the current state of scientific knowledge, then you can make better decisions based on facts and testable ideas, rather than outdated belief systems or our intuition that evolved to protect our ancestors from lions, but is no longer suited for the complexity of our modern world.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Our brains are comically ill-prepared to navigate the fast-moving world we happen to live in today.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: A world I've radically created by science.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: A few hundred years ago, it was possible to be knowledgeable at an expert level in pretty much every field of study.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: In the information age, this is a futile endeavor since knowledge and data are increasing exponentially.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: So to even have a chance of grasping the world we live in, we need some reason that give us if not a true understanding of all the details a solid overview.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Expanding science to many people is not about enlightening the ignorant, but necessary for the progress of our species at large.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: To make this possible, we need to find metaphors and stories that capture the true nature of things as much as possible while using a language that our brains can deal with.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: A great example here is physics.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Quarks are often depicted as blue, red, and green with different spins.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: But just saying spin and using colours, force our brain to imagine colourful spinning balls, which is great to visualize the different types and the relationships between Quarks, but also creates a very wrong image of reality in our heads.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Modicules are nothing like the neat diagrams that we're taught in school, but buzzing and vibrating entities help together by something we call charge that describes how certain things want to be close or escape each other for some unknown reason.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: We're describing phenomena that we are pretty sure exist in some form or another, because the maths works out and we can do real world experiments and predict their results before we do them.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: In reality, these are models, tricks to summarize what we know, a make-up-a-co-here-and-story, and prepare the ground for more in-depth explanations.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Don't confuse the description of a thing for the thing itself.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Simplifications like these are not just meant to dumb things down, they're actually useful for experts themselves.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: For example, chemists who use wrong electron shell models to work out chemical bonds or scientists using simplified models as the basis for discussion with colleagues across different scientific fields.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: But the simplification of science can also be problematic for a bunch of reasons.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Finding the true nature of reality is super hard, because our brains did not evolve for this job, and the universe doesn't care if we understand it.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Science is a process to work towards gaining knowledge and not an absolute truth generator.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: The answers it provides are modulated and nuance, and that complexity can get lost when it's simplified, especially when it's done so for headlines.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: An interesting cancer study turns into a potential cure, a healthy food becomes the basis for a new diet.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Such simplifications give a misleading, deafness to science, which goes against its process like nature.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: When cures don't materialize, and diets don't turn out to be magical, we lose confidence in science, and starts a think of all science communication as misleading.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Then there's the opposite effect.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: If a simplification is too engaging, if a story it tells is too good, it can distort the true complexity of a subject and give you a full sense of security and an illusion of deep knowledge.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: A gut feeling that you understand the science better than you actually do, which can lead people to ignore actual experts over their dangerous, superficial knowledge and gut feeling.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: And this can have negative consequences for all of us, because in the worst case, overconfidence in your own understanding of science, can lead to bad decisions made with confidence.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Just think of the search of people that confidently disavow vaccines or climate change without truly understanding the subject matter.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: So considering all of this and the fact that we have cuts because I've reached millions of people with our videos, how do we handle this?

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Well, it has Billy Jelly, especially the research.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: When we start it, we just read articles, then moved on to books, peer-reviewed papers, then to conversations with experts.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: We began to collect our sources.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: With every step, we realized that we were still not doing enough.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: Nowadays, we try to read as many primary sources as possible, talk to multiple experts and document our simplifications, and give further reading in our sources, dog.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: But this doesn't make our process flawless.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: What do you do if experts disagree with each other?

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: What do you do if you find an amazing fact that perfectly fits a narrative, but just can't find its primary source?

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: How do you deal with the reality that many scientific results have huge error bars or maybe is attached to them?

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: How do you handle complex systems that defy easy answers?

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: In the end, we make 10 minute videos, so we need to make decisions about what details and explanations can fit, which aspects need to be simplified and which parts to cut.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: There is no single best answer for how to do this, and so we weigh the different options every single time.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: It can be painful for experts to see their fields simplified, somehow happy with us, while others don't like it.

Title: ...And We'll Do it Again
Sentence: This is fair, but also impossible to avoid.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Sentence: We cut down forests to make room for pastures and crops.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: And we emit nitrous oxide when we use fertilizers and manure.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: Worldwide food production is responsible for about 26% of all human-made greenhouse gas emissions, which is unfortunate since food is not optional.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: While 26% doesn't sound that bad, it means that even if we extinguish all other sources of emissions today, the emissions from food alone would still use a bar entire carbon budget by 2100.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: So, no matter how we twist and turn it, food is a real driver of climate change.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: Still, emissions from different food items vary a lot.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: How do things look when we compare their footprints separately?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: Food's climate impact is most often based on life-cycl assessments, an analysis that looks at all the emissions of a product throughout its existence from production to transportation, packaging, use and waste management.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: In the most detailed metronaticists of life-cycl assessments to date, beef emissions stand out at the top.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: On average, a kilogram of beef emits 71 kilograms of CO2 equivalence.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: Lairm is also high at 40 kilograms.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: Poor commits 12 and poultry 10 kilograms.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: At the bottom we have lots of plant-based foods.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: The most important aspect of food is the weight though, its nutrient density.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: The regional travel on the road supplying the markets and shops in your area.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: While 1 kilogram of beef from your local butcher will come in at 18 kilograms in CO2 equivalents at least.

Sentence: So even when shipped grade distances, emissions from almost all plant-based foods cause lower emissions than locally produced animal products.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: Okay, so if transport doesn't play a big role, what causes the vast amounts of emissions from beef then?

Sentence: By far the largest share of beef emissions consists of methane released directly by the animals.

Sentence: While CO2 hangs around for centuries, methane only stays in the atmosphere for decades.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: But in the short periods, it is very powerful.

Sentence: But the way things stand any kinds of extra emissions are not great.

Sentence: Still, all cows burn and fart to similar degrees, what explains the spectrum of beef emissions?

Sentence: It makes a difference if the beef comes from a dairy herd or one dedicated to beef production.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: This aspect accounts for much of the range of emissions in beef.

Sentence: There is a sinister truth hidden here.

Sentence: They use less land and their food is brought right to them and so they grow faster and don't expand energy on things like walking.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: Catalan a factory farm that never get to roam pastures can sometimes be less destructive for the climate than cattle grazing peacefully on a formerly lush piece of rainforest.

Sentence: But isn't it a bit out of touch with reality to demonize cows so much?

Sentence: Some of the land these animals are grazing on isn't suitable for crops anyway.

Sentence: By grazing on pastures they can turn things we can't digest into food.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: So pasturing animals is actually a very efficient way to use those areas since we can't grow human food there anyway.

Sentence: Even though it is so massive, pasturing land alone can't support the human and living on it.

Sentence: So if we would switch to 100% grass fed, we'd simply have to eat much less beef.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: But only 19% of global soy production goes towards products for humans.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: We could use this land to grow forests or restore wild grasslands, basically anything that could suck carbon out of the atmosphere.

Sentence: If we spared 3 billion hectares of land, it could remove about 8 billion tonnes of CO2 from the air per year.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: By comparison, we are met about 50 billion tonnes of CO2 equivalents per year at the moment.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: That means we could save 16% of emissions by eating a vegan diet.

Title: Is Meat Really that Bad?
Sentence: Okay, to summarise, food is a huge driver of emissions.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: You're not a person, you're a planet made of roughly 40 trillion cells.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: There is so much of you that if your cells were human-sized, you'd be as big as 20 Mount Everest.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: For your creepy, crawly inhabitants, this makes your body an ecosystem, rich in resources and warmth and space.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: A perfect place to move into and have a family.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: While some of these guests are welcome, most are not.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Your immune system is the guardian of this planet, the force tasked with protecting yourself against the constant danger of invasion.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Unfortunately, your enemies in the tiny world have a huge advantage.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Consider the effort it takes to make a single copy of yourself and your trillions of cells.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: First, you need to find someone who thinks you're cute, date and be awkward and if things work out in a complicated dance, two of your cells merge together.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Then you need to wait for months while the cell multiplies over and over until it's released into the world as a human being.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: And even then, you only have a mini copy that needs years to become remotely useful.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: A bacterium consists of one cell.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: It can make a fully grown copy in about half an hour.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: A virus can turn it to hundreds within hours and billions within days.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Your enemies multiply orders of magnitude faster than you.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Even worse, for a bacterium or virus, your body is a hostile ecosystem, applying selective pressure.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Because they go through so many generations so quickly, eventually, by pure chance, there will be an individual that mutates and adapts in just the right way to resist your defenses and then multiply quickly again.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: In other words, you're facing a sheer endless variety of different enemies and you're too slow to keep up with their evolution.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: This is bad.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Luckily, your immune system is just about the most amazing thing ever.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: The second most complex biological system known to us after the human brain and so sophisticated that we still haven't discovered all its secrets.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Since it's so complicated, we have to simplify and focus on one thing at a time.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: If you want the full story, wait for the announcement at the end of the video.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Okay, so why are we not all killed by some new bacteria or virus?

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: In a nutshell, you actually have two immune systems, the innate and the adaptive immune system.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: The innate immune system was ready when you were born.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: It mostly consists of general purpose soldiers, we introduced them in the last immune video.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: The adaptive immune system carries two types of cells, T-cells and B-cells that are your superweapons and are incredibly effective and deadly for your enemies.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: These cells complicated to produce and take a lot of time to deploy, but once they're ready, they pack a real punch.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: What makes your adaptive immune system so powerful is that it has the largest library in the universe.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: It has an answer to everything.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: You have at least one of these superweapons cells inside you to fight the Black Death, the coronavirus, and the first deadly bacteria that will emerge in a city on Mars in 100 years.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: This makes it possible for you to counter the ability of bacteria and viruses to change so rapidly.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: How is this possible?

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: To understand what's going on here, we need to take one step back.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: All organisms on Earth are made from the same basic parts, mostly proteins.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Proteins are the building blocks of life and can have billions of different shapes.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: You can imagine them as 3D puzzle pieces.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: There are billions of different puzzle pieces your enemies can use to construct their bodies.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Why is this important?

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Because proteins are in a way, the language of the micro world.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Cells don't have eyes or ears, so to tell a friend from foe, they have to touch them and recognize if their protein is part of a friend or part of an enemy.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Recognizing means that cells have countless tiny devices called receptors that are able to connect with a specific protein puzzle piece.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: So your cells have tiny puzzle pieces on their outside, but are able to click together or recognize other protein puzzle pieces.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: When a cell connects together with a protein and recognizes it as enemy, it knows that it has to attack.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Only if your cells can make this distinction between friend or foe is your immune system able to fight it in Vader.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: But since there are billions of possible protein puzzle pieces, this means there are billions of possible enemy puzzle pieces.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: This is also one of the reasons we still have to deal with diseases like the flu each year.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: The influenza virus mutates very rapidly, and so the proteins that make up its hull constantly change a tiny bit.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: The soldiers of your innate immune system have a large number of the puzzle pieces for common bacteria and viruses memorized.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: That's why they are your all-purpose weapons.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: But they are ineffective against many billions of mutations and adaptations that your enemies can develop.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: So the reason you are still alive is that your adaptive immune system is able to recognize between 1 billion and 10 billion different enemy protein puzzle pieces, which is enough to be prepared for every possible enemy.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: But how is this possible?

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: How could your immune system possibly have this much of a variety to be prepared for every possible protein puzzle piece?

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Well, the cells of your adaptive immune system found a cheat code, mixing and matching their own genetic code to create this stunning variety of receptors.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: The details are way too complicated for this video, but in a nutshell, your adaptive immune cells have official permission to take a tiny part of their own genetic code and mix it in random ways to create billions of different receptors.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: A good way to explain this is by asking you to imagine an army of cocks with each of them wanting their own special recipe.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: They have 100 different ingredients to choose from.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: Each ingredient stands for one tiny piece of genetic code in this metaphor.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
Sentence: So each cook takes a few random ingredients and randomly mixes them together.

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease

Title: You Are Immune Against Every Disease
