Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: The past is a vast and mysterious land, the begins at the Big Bang and ends in the present, expanding with each passing moment.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: It's the home of everything that came before, the key to understanding our present.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Here we find the most amazing creatures to ever roam our planet.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Hundreds of millions of species so diverse that our imagination cannot do them justice.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Unfortunately, the past carefully guards its secrets.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: While there are a lot of things about the past we know, there are way more things we know we don't know.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: And worse, there are probably even more things we don't even know that we don't know about.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Think of the wonder of life.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: We now recognise about 1.5 million new carryout species, but there may be as many as 10 million alive today.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: And although we are adding some 50,000 new species to our collective knowledge each year, the vast majority of life on Earth is still undiscovered.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: This is just what is around today.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: An estimated 4 billion species emerged on our planet in past yons.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: But at least 99% of them died out, wait before humans spoke the first words.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: The vast majority of all the different species that ever existed are so utterly deleted that they have become part of the unknown part of the past lost to us forever.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Or are they?

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Could we use science and imagination to glimpse the shadow of the unreachable past?

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Let's start with what we do know.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: To learn about creatures of the past we need fossils.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Any sort of remains preserved from past geological ages, bones or shells, impressions or imprints, things preserved in amber.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: The totality of all fossils on Earth is called the fossil record, and if the most important window on the past will ever have.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: For a dead animal to fossilize, a number of things must go just right.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: The right environment, timing and conditions.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: And then the fossil needs to survive for millions or hundreds of millions of years, and then get back to the surface, and then be discovered before natural processes dissolve it.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: So it is kind of a miracle that we have, what we have, and know what we know.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Take the dinosaurs, since they were one of the largest and most successful groups of animals for some 165 million years, and are also a lot of fun to animate.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: What were they really like and what are we missing?

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: In the last 200 years, we've found tens of thousands of fossils from over 1,000 dinosaur species.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: And lately, we've entered a golden era of discovery and about 15 new dinosaur species are discovered each year, expanding what we know and what we know that we don't know about them, which is amazing, but it also makes us aware of all the things lost to the past forever.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Imagine if we took all the animals that lived in the last 50 million years and randomly chose 10,000 individuals from 1,000 species to fossilize.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Think about all the things that would be missed, or that seem too weird to be true.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Like the giraffe, a yellow animal with brown patterns that looks like a horse and an antelope had a baby with a long neck and two tiny hairy horns.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: How many dinosaur giraffes were there?

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Animals so weird and selected for ecological niches, so specific, that evolution molded their bodies very absurdly.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Today they might seem made up to us.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: We know a lot of species are lost forever, just because of the environment they lived in.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: For example, lush jungles basically prevent fossilization as the chances that an animal will be buried here are low.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Countless scavengers of all sizes break down freshly deceased animals extremely quickly and the soil is often so acidic that bones are dissolved.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: And so fossils of dinosaurs from jungles are practically non-existent.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Today half of all known species live in the few remaining rainforests that only cover 2% of Earth's landmass.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Millions of years ago when dinosaurs roamed Earth, jungles covered much more of the planet.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: So, besides some insects and other small animals trapped in amber, there should be millions of species that emerged and vanished without leaving any trace.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Trapped deep inside the unknown unknown.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: But just in general biology trips us out.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Look at your body.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: It's mainly squishy gooey soft stuff, which does not preserve well.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: What remains the longest are the crystallized parts of your bones, and so most dinosaur fossils are bones or teeth.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Usually fragments not entire skeletons.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: This means that almost all boneless or shellless animals are practically wiped from the fossil record.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: If we take a look at the stunning diversity of weird animals like worms, jellyfish and slugs alive today, we can only speculate what we are missing.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Although thankfully, many mostly soft and gooey species also left us an incredible diversity of shells that tell us an amazing amount about our past, so at least we have that.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Still, when we think about all the bonus species that may have existed in the last half billion years, even our best attempt at imagining them full-shaught.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: But it's not like reimagining something based on its bones is straightforward, and so the way we envisage what dinosaurs actually look like has changed a lot in the last few years.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: In the past, many illustrations had a bony minimalistic look with a toothy grin to signify fissness and danger.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: But if we draw today's animals in a similar way, based on their skeletons, just for the fun of it, we get the most bizarre creatures.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Elephants, swans and baboons that look like monsters right out of nightmares.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: So similar to animals today, we should imagine dinosaurs with much more soft tissue, fatbelles or chests, weird soft parts like skin flaps, lips and gums, and just more pronounced features that would make them seem like much more pleasant fellows.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Some soft features actually leave distinctive traces on bones that we can look for in the skeletons of extinct animals, which is where today's animals with similar features are really helpful.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: It's a similar story with colors.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Because we know what the feathers of living birds look like, modern technology combined with the exceedingly rare fossils with preserved remains of fuzzy feathers, give us a glimpse of the real colors of extinct dinosaurs.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: We know that tiny sinus or objects had a striped tail, and its tiny dyno-body anchion is huxly, was white and black, with gorgeous red feathers around its head.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Still, for the vast majority of any ancient extinct species, we have no real clue what color they were.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: But we know what modern dinosaurs birds look like, and here we find the most amazing variety.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: So some dinosaurs will have tried to blend into the background, while others might have fielded aggressive color schemes to attract mates or to appear dangerous.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Some might have had impressive decorations or colorful beaks.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Some may have been striped or patent.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Similarly, we don't know that much about dinosaur behaviour, although once again we control conclusions from existing animals.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: For example, even apex predators like lions spend a lot of their time lying around and cuddling and digging each other and playing.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Why would dinosaurs be so different?

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: When we first found the skull of T-rex with its mighty teeth, and probably the strongest bite of any land animal ever, we imagined a fierce and stupid beast.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: But modern scanning technology has revealed that T-rex had a larger brain to body ratio than some earlier giant meat eaters, and it probably had very sharp hearing, vision and a sense of smell, and was in all likelihood not a stupid animal.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: So maybe T-rex was a cuddly fellow that spent a lot of time playing around or impressing potential mates when it was not hungry.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Likewise, while their horns and shields might have made serotoncits appear to be natural worn fighters, they were probably much more than that.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Based on the behaviour of modern animals, and the complex dances some have to go through to mate, maybe their shields were amazingly colorful, maybe it does for its mates like many birds do today.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: How intensely amazing these creatures must have been, and what a lot it is to us that we don't get to experience them first hand.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: What an even greater loss that there is so much we will never know about them and even more tragic, all the absurd and beautiful beings that disappeared without a trace.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: But such is life.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Time marches on without any concern for our feelings and the past expands with every moment that passes.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Most wild animals alive today will in all likelihood not leave fossils behind and also just disappear forever.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: We can do something about that, though.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Instead of accelerating the extinction we are witnessing, we could become the guardians of life and preserve it where we find it.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: If possible in the world, if not then in museums, movies and in our minds.

Title: What Dinosaurs ACTUALLY Looked Like?
Sentence: Because as amazing as our imagination is and as fascinating to think about the animals that are part of the unknown unknown, it is even better to witness them in the present.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Hello everybody!

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Today we're doing something different.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: An exclusive preview.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: We'll listen to the introduction and a chapter from the Kotzkazant book, Immune, a journey into the mysterious system that keeps your life.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Reason by Kotzkazant founder and headwriter Philip Devmer.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: It's about the epic story of the immune system.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: The most important thing you don't know enough about, and will forever change how you think about your body.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Immune will be released on November the 2nd and you can pre-order it right now.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Links in the description.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: So now get comfy for a rare audio-only experience.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Introduction Imagine waking up tomorrow feeling a bit under the weather.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: And annoying pain in your throat, your nose is runny, you cough a bit.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Not bad enough to skip work if it because you step into the shower, pretty annoyed about how hard your life is.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: While you are totally not being a whining little baby, your immune system is not complaining.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: It is busy keeping you alive so you can live to whine another day.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: And so what intruders roam your body killing hundreds of thousands of yourselves, your immune system is organizing complex defenses.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Communicating over vast distances, activating intricate defense networks and dishing out a swift death to millions if not billions of enemies.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: All while you are standing in the shower, mildly, and night.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: But this complexity is largely hidden, which is a real shame because there are not many things that have such a crucial impact on the quality of your life as your immune system.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: It is all embracing and all encompassing, protecting you from bothersome nuisances like the common cold, scratches and cuts, to life threatening stuff from cancer and pneumonia to deadly infections like COVID-19.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Your immune system is as indispensable as your heart or your lungs, and actually it is one of the largest and most widespread organ systems throughout your body, although we don't tend to think about it in these terms.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: For most of us, the immune system is a vague and cloud-like entity that follows strange and untransparent rules, and which seems to sometimes work and sometimes not.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: It is a bit like the weather, extremely hard to predict and subject to endless speculations and opinions, resulting in actions that feel random to us.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Unfortunately, many people speak about the immune system with confidence, but without actually understanding it, it can be hard to know which information to trust and why.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: But what even is the immune system, and how does it actually work?

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Understanding the mechanisms that are keeping you alive as you read this is not just a nice exercise in intellectual curiosity, it is desperately needed knowledge.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: If you know how the immune system works, you can understand and appreciate vaccines and how they can save your life or the lives of your children, and approach disease and sickness with a very different mindset and far less fear.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: You become less susceptible to snake or salesmen who offer wonder drugs that are entirely devoid of logic.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: You get a better grasp on the kinds of medication that might actually help you when you are sick.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: You get to know what you can do to boost your immune system.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: You can protect your kids from dangerous microbes, while also not being too stressed out if they get dirty playing outside.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: And in the very unlikely case of say, a global pandemic, knowing what a virus does to you and how your body fights it might help you understand what the public health experts say.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Besides all these practical and useful things, the immune system is also simply beautiful, a wonder of nature like no other.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: The immune system is not a mere tool to make your cough go away, it is an extricably tied into almost all other processes in your body.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: And while it is centrally important to keeping you alive, it is likely that it may also be the part of your body that causes your untimely death either by failing or by being too active.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: I have been fascinated and obsessed by the incredible complexity of the human immune system for the better part of a decade now.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: It began in university where I was studying information design and was looking for a semester project and the immune system seemed like a good idea.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: So I got a large pile of books about immunology and began digging in, but no matter how much I read, things just did not get less complicated.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: The more I learned, the more impossible it seemed to simplify the immune system as every layer revealed more mechanisms, more exceptions, more complexity.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: And so a project that was supposed to last the spring took the summer and then the fall and the winter.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: The interactions of the parts of the immune system were too elegant and the dance they danced was too beautiful to stop learning about them.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: This progress fundamentally changed how I experienced and felt about my body.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: When I got the flu, I could no longer just complain, but had to look at my body, touch my swollen lymph nodes, and visualize what my immune cells were doing right then, which part of the network was activated, and how T cells killed millions of intruders to protect me.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: When I cut myself while being cat-ass in the forest, I felt gratitude for my macrophages, large immune cells, hunting scared bacteria, and ripping them into pieces to protect the open wound from infection.

Sentence: After taking a bite of the wrong granola bar and suffering and allergic shock while being rushed to the hospital, I thought about mass cells and IGE antibodies and how they had almost killed me in a misguided attempt to protect me from scary foodstuffs.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: When I was diagnosed with cancer at the age of 32 and had to undergo a couple of operations and then chemotherapy, my obsession with immunology became even more intense.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: One of the jobs of my immune system is to kill cancer, in this case it had failed.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: But I somehow could not be angry or too upset as I had learned how hard of a job this was for my immune cells and how hard cancer had to work to keep them in check.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: And as the chemo melted the cancer, my thoughts again went to my immune cells, invading the dying tumors and eating them up one cell after another.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Disease and sickness are scary and unsettling, and I've had plenty of that in my life.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: But knowing how my cells, my immune system, this integral and personal part of myself defended the entity that is me, how it fought and died and healed and restored this body, I and habit, always gave me a lot of comfort.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Learning about the immune system made my life better and more interesting and it alleviated a lot of the anxiety that comes with being sick.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: Knowing about the immune system always put things in perspective.

Title: Two Chapters From Our New Book – Exclusive Preview!
Sentence: So, because of this positive effect and just because of the fun of learning and reading about the immune system, it became an ongoing hobby, as I eventually became a science communicator and explaining complex things became my purpose in life.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: Never before in human history have we been richer, more advanced, or powerful.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: And yet, we feel overwhelmed in the face of rapid climate change.

Sentence: It seems simple on the surface.

Sentence: Greenhouse gas is trap energy from the sun and transfer it to our atmosphere.

Sentence: Vis leads to Warwick Winter's harsh arsonas.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: Dry places become drier and wet places wetter.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: Countless ecosystems will die while the rising oceans swallow coasts and the cities we build on them.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: So why don't we just like, prevent all of that?

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: The public debate about stopping rapid climate change often focuses on a few key features, like coal plants, cars, or burping cows.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: And so the solutions are often simplistic.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: Rows of solar panels, biking to work, something something sustainability.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: And a huge talking point is personal responsibility.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: This is one of those videos where we want to encourage you to watch to the end, because to discuss real, durable solutions, we first need to understand the problem.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: A full of picture.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: Modern industrial society as we constructed it in the last 150 years is inherently destructive to the planet.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: Basically, everything we do to make our lives easier, safer and more comfortable, is making things worse for the biosphere.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: The food we eat, the streets we walk on, the clothes we wear, the gadgets we use, the way we move around and the pleasant temperatures we artificially create around us.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?
Sentence: While most people know about the series impact of energy, beef, cars and planes, many major polluters are barely ever talked about.

Title: Can YOU Fix Climate Change?

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The human immune system is the most complex biological system we know after the human rain and yet most of us never learn how it works or what it is.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Your immune system consists of hundreds of tiny and too large organs.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: It has its own transport network spread throughout your body.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Every day it makes hundreds of billions of fresh cells organized like an army with soldiers, captains, intelligence officers, heavy weapons, and crazy suicide bombers.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: It's not some sort of abstract entity.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Your immune system is you.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Your biology protecting you from the billions of microorganisms that want to consume you and from your own perverted cells that turn into cancer.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: It's so manifold that it's impossible to cover in one video, so we'll make a series looking at different aspects of it.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Today what happens when your body is invaded and your first lines of defenses are engaged in a fight for life and death.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: It's been a normal day when suddenly the world explodes and an asteroid rips the sky open.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Countless alien life forms invade ready to destroy cities and infrastructure and eat civilians.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Or this is what your sounds experience.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: You look at your bleeding thumb that you just cut on a dirty twig in the park.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: How annoying.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: But inside the wound a horrible catastrophe has happened.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: There are dead cells and blood and dirt everywhere.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Even worse, countless bacteria invade the warm caverns between your helpless cells to explore their new home, steal your resources and poop everywhere.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Immediately the first stage of your defense kicks in.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The cells that survived the impact or are hurt or dying, scream in panic, releasing an onslaught of chemical alarm signals that awaken your immune system.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The first cells to show up are macrophages.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: If an average cell with the size of a human, a macrophage will be the size of a black rhino, a stoic cell in principle, but you wouldn't want to annoy it.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Bacteria do annoy them.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: In seconds the large cells attack and begin killing them without mercy.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: They stretch out parts like the arms of octopus and grabbed bacteria to swallow them whole and digest them alive.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: A macrophage can eat 100 bacteria before it's exhausted.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: But there are too many enemies, so the macrophages call for reinforcements.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: In your blood hundreds of thousands of neutrophils pick up their signals and move to the battlefield.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: neutrophils are intense suicide warriors that only live to kill.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: They're so enthusiastic about killing that they kill themselves a few days after birth, so they don't have time to accidentally destroy your body from the inside.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: As soon as neutrophils arrive, they begin vomiting deadly chemicals at bacteria or devour them.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: They are so careless in their attacks that they are causing real damage to your own cells, but collateral damage is not there concern now.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: However, some neutrophils go so far to push their suicide button and explode, casting wide and toxic net made from their own DNA filled with deadly chemicals that trap and kill bacteria.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Sometimes they can continue fighting after that, even though they're sort of dead already, this is how much fun they have killing.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: While the battle rages, your blood vessels let fluid stream into the battlefield like a dam opening up towards a valley.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: You notice this as inflammation, your thumb swells up a little and gets red and warm.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The fluid brings the silent killer into the battle zone millions of compliment proteins, a sort of automated liquid weapon that stuns and kills bacteria by ripping holes into them.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: We made a whole video explaining them in detail.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: We're reaching a crossroad now.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: If things go well, your first line of defense kills the invaders quickly.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: But sometimes the enemies are too strong and would overwhelm your defenses eventually, which means certain death for you, the human.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: This is the hour of the Dendritic Cell.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Your immune systems in intelligent software, while your soldiers were bashing in heads, it was collecting samples by ripping bacteria into tiny parts and covering itself in it.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Like a soldier decorating itself in the gut-suffered dead enemy.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The cell leaves the battlefield and enters the superhighway of your immune system that connects all your tissues with your immune headquarters, your lymph nodes.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The Dendritic Cell coming from the battlefield is looking for a help that T-cell, which is a sort of all purpose commandous cell within your immune army.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: But not any help that T-cell, one that happens to have just the right weapon for the bacteria that infected your wound.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: So it goes around and robs itself, still covered in bacteria parts, against every helper T-cell it meets.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Most T-cells are a bit disgusted and not interested, but after a few hours, something clicks.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: A helper T-cell recognizes the bacteria parts.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: This cell is the weapon that's needed right now.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The Dendritic Cell is overjoyed and activates the helper T-cell.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Okay, wait, how come your immune system has a cell that has a weapon against the specific bacteria that infected you?

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Well, your immune system has a perfect weapon against every possible disease in the universe, against the black death, the coronavirus, or an infection that will emerge in 100 years on Mars.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: We'll talk about this a bit more in the next video because it's very complex, so for now, we'll just know that you have billions of unique helper T-cells that each have weapons against every possible enemy.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: After the right T-cell is activated, your second line of defense awaits and rises like a teenager that needs to get up on a school day.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Very slowly.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Your heavy weapons are incredibly effective, but they're not fast.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The activated helper T-cell begins to clone itself over and over again.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: One becomes two, two become four until there are thousands of them.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Now they split into two groups.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The first group quickly moves to help out your soldiers.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: At the battlefield, things are getting out of hand.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: A tired macrophage is ready to give up.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: After fighting for days, it just wants to go to sleep, like many of its buddies have done already.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: But now the helper T-cells arrive.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: One of them comes to the tired macrophage and whispers something using special chemical signals.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: In a heartbeat, the demoralized soldier feels fresh again.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: But there's something else.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: A hot, white anger.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The macrophage knows what it needs to do.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Kill.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Invigorated, it throws itself against the enemies once again.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: All over the battlefield, this begins to happen.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Meanwhile, the second group of helper T-cells was working on activating another line of defense, B-cells, your antibody factories.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Antibodies are protein superweapons that not like tiny crabs with two pinzers to grab enemies.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Just like the helper T-cells, there are B-cells in your body that are able to make just the right antibodies for every possible enemy.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: And the helper T-cell is looking for exactly these B-cells.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: After a day or two, the right B-cell is found and begins to clone itself.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: As soon as enough clones have been made, each B-cell begins pumping out up to 2000 antibodies per second.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: About a week after you injured yourself and bacteria invaded, your second line of defense finally arrives in full force.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The tiny army begins to saturate the battlefield, pinching and stunning desperate bacteria.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The antibodies clump them together and make them unable to move or fight, while your soldiers massacre the defenseless victims.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: The tight is turning fast.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: As the last enemies are cleaned up, your soldiers realize they are no longer needed and begin to kill themselves to save resources.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: But not all of them.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: A few helper T-cells remain and turn into memory cells.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: They will guard the tissue for years, making sure the same bacteria will never again gain a foothold here.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: Similarly, a few B-cells will stay alive and keep producing a low amount of antibodies, making you immune against the bacteria maybe for the rest of your life.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: One day you wake up and notice that the wound has grown over and left nothing but a faint red mark.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: You were completely unaware of the drama yourselves had to deal with.

Title: How The Immune System ACTUALLY Works – IMMUNE
Sentence: For you, the whole ordeal was a slight annoyance, while for millions of cells, it was a desperate fight for life and death.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The largest things in the universe are black holes.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: In contrast to things like planets or stars, they have no physical size limit and can literally grow endlessly.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Although in reality, specific things need to have and create different kinds of black holes from really tiny ones to the largest single things in the universe.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: So how do black holes grow?

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: And how large is the largest of them all?

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: This video will not discuss how black holes work or how they form since we've looked at that in detail in our black hole and neutron star series.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: You can check them out afterwards.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: For now, we're interested in finding the largest thing in the universe.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Let's start really, really small.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Primordial black holes.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The smallest kind of black holes may or may not exist.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: If they do, they're probably the oldest objects in the universe older even than atoms.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: They were formed just after the big bang.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: When the universe was so dense with violent energy, that any tiny pocket that was just slightly more dense than its neighbors could produce a black hole.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The smallest primordial black hole that could still be around would be a trillion kilograms or so, a mass of a big mountain.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: And yet they would be no bigger than a proton.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: A primordial black hole with a mass of earth would barely be larger than a coin.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: This makes them very hard to find, so we haven't actually observed any yet.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: If they exist, they may even be the mysterious dark matter that holds galaxies together.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Let's move on to the kinds of black holes that we know for sure are out there.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Stella black holes.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: To make a black hole, we need to compress enough matter so that it collapses into itself.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: After that, the more mass we throw at it, the large rip becomes.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: In today's universe, only the most violent cosmic events can create the necessary conditions, such as the merger of neutron stars, or when the core of a very massive star collapses in a supernova.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: To have a unit to work with here, we'll use the mass of our sun, about 2 million trillion kilograms.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The smallest known black hole has 2.7 times the mass of the sun, which works out as a sphere around 16 kilometers in diameter, large enough to cover Paris.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Another lightweight black hole is the companion to the V723 Mont-Red Giant star.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: This star is 24 times larger than our sun, 30 million kilometers in diameter.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: And yet, it's thrown around by a tiny black hole just 17.2 kilometers wide.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: This tiny thing, bullying the star, is so much smaller that we can barely even show them in comparison.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: One of the largest known Stella black holes is M33X7.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: It currently spends its time eating a 70 solar mass blue giant bit my bit.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: As all that stoned in matter circles towards the black hole, like water going down a drain, friction heated up to temperatures high enough to shine 500,000 times brighter than our sun.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: And yet, X7 is only 15.65 solar masses and 92 kilometers wide, just big enough to cast a shadow on Corsica.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: To grow much larger, black holes have to either devour a lot of stars or better, merge with one another.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The instruments that make it possible to detect these merges are very new, so we're currently discovering a lot of exciting things.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Like two massive black holes that we detected in a galaxy 17 billion light years away.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: As they spun around each other violently, they released more energy in the form of gravitational waves than the combined light from all the stars in the Milky Way in 4,400 years.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The new black hole they formed is about the size of Germany and is 142 solar masses.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: And here, we hit a curious gap in scale.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: There are lots of black holes up to 150 solar masses, and then there's nothing for a long time.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Until we suddenly hit black holes that are millions of times more massive, which is a bit confusing because we had this idea that black holes are consistently growing and growing.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: But for the most massive black holes, this process is not fast enough to explain their existence today.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The universe is simply not old enough for these supermassive black holes to have formed by eating stars and merging with each other.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Something else must have happened.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: To explain how we got the largest black holes in the universe, we might need the largest stars that ever existed.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Quasize stars.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Together sense of scale, we can compare them to the largest stars that exist today.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Our Sun is like a grain of sand next to them.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: We don't know if Quasize stars actually existed, but they're an interesting concept when it comes to supercharging black hole development.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The idea is that the matter in the early universe was so dense that Quasize stars could grow to thousands of times the mass of our Sun.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The cause of these stars might have been crushed by their own weight so much to actually collapse into black holes while the star was still forming.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: In contrast to stars today that were destroyed themselves in the process, inside Quasize stars, a deadly balance could emerge.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Gravity pressed the supermassive star together, feeding the black hole and eating the material falling in to such a degree that the radiation pressure kept the star stable.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: And so these quickly growing black holes might have been able to consume the Quasize star for millions of years and grow far bigger than any modern stellar black hole.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Black holes several thousand times the mass of the Sun and wider than the entire Earth.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: These black holes might have become the seeds for supermassive black holes.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: So now we arrive at the kings of our universe, the largest single bodies in existence.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The centers of most galaxies contain a supermassive black hole and they are monstrous.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: In the Milky Way we have Sagittarius A star, a supermassive black hole with about 4 million solar masses that is calm and collected and just as it's thing.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: We know it sits there because we can see a number of stars being thrown around by a seemingly empty spot.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: And despite its incredible mass, its radius is still only 17 times our Sun.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Smaller than most giant stars, the millions of times more massive.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Because supermassive black holes are so massive and located at the center of galaxies, many people imagine them as being a bit like the Sun in the solar system.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: An anchor that glues everything else together and forces it into an orbit, but this is a misconception.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: While the Sun makes up 99.86% of all the mass in the solar system, supermassive black holes usually only have 0.001% of the mass of their galaxy.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The billions of stars in galaxies are not gravitationally bound to them.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Instead, it's the gravitational effect of dark matter which holds them together.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Many supermassive black holes aren't gentle giants, especially when they're feeding on the clouds of mass in their galaxy.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The one at the center of the BL-30 galaxy is devouring so much material that it produces jets of plasma, accelerated to nearly the speed of light.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: If Earth were orbiting this huge body, it would seem 115 times larger than our Sun in the sky, and we'd be burnt to a crisp in seconds by its glowing hot accretion disk.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: At this point, black holes become so large that stars seem ridiculously tiny compared to them.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: The galaxy's sickness A has a supermassive black hole with 2.5 billion solar masses and 14.7 billion kilometers wide, which would mean that if it took the place of our Sun, it would swallow all the planets and stretch halfway to the edge of our solar system.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: It's devouring so much mass and material that it turns its disk into a kind of magnetic funnel, spewing gas out, making tremendous radio lobes towering over the galaxy half a million light years in diameter.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: That's 2.5 milky waves wide.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Another pretty large supermassive black hole sits in the galaxy Messia 87.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: It has 6.5 billion solar masses and was the first black hole we got an actual photo of, or rather, of the glowing gas around the edge of a menacing shadow.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: This fair of darkness is so large that it covers our entire solar system.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: And yet, there is a scale even above these kinds of objects.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Ultramative black holes.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: Now, we reach the most massive black holes, perhaps the largest single bodies that will ever exist.

Title: The Largest Black Hole in the Universe - Size Comparison
Sentence: These black holes have eaten so much that they've grown to tens of billions of solar masses, their gravity, the engine, for a quasar, an accretion disk shining brighter than thousands of galaxies, full of stars.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Leaving Earth to find new homes in space is an old dream of humanity and will sooner or later be necessary for our survival.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: The planet that gets the most attention is Mars, a small, toxic and energy poor planet that just about seems good enough for a colony of depressed humans, huddled in underground cities.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: But what do we think bigger?

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: What if we take Venus, one of the most hostile and deadly places in the solar system and turn it into a colony?

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Not by building lofty cloud cities, but by creating a proper second Earth.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: It might be easier than you think.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Venus is by far the hottest planet in the solar system with the surface temperature of 460°C.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Hot enough to melt lead.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: This heat is due to the most extreme greenhouse effect in the solar system.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: CO2 is greater trapping heat, even a rise from 0.03% to 0.04% in Earth's atmosphere is heating up our planet right now.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Venus's atmosphere is 97% CO2.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Also, Venus's atmosphere is 93 times denser than Earth's.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Standing on Venus's surface would feel like taking a dive about 900 meters deep into the ocean.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: The pressure would kill you instantly.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: It's a truly horrible place, so why should we even bother?

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: First and foremost, Venus is almost as big as Earth and has 90% of its surface gravity.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Surface gravity is a big problem when colonizing the solar system because it's very likely that long stays in low gravity places will have negative health effects.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Venus's size means it could be the second largest habitat in the solar system.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: A new home for billions of humans and trillions of animals with oceans, lush forests and a beautiful blue sky.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: A properly terraformed Venus may be the most pleasant place to live outside of Earth.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: While we can't exactly terraformed Venus today, a slightly more ambitious future version of us could take this project on.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: It will take a few generations to complete and be a huge challenge like building the Great Pyramids was for our ancestors.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: But then, it's not like humans have never started projects that took more than a lifetime to complete.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Okay, let's do it.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Before anything else, we need to cool Venus down and remove the gas that makes up the extremely heavy atmosphere.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: As mentioned, there's a lot of it, around 465 million tons.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: How do we do that?

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: There are a few options.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: We could create giant solar collectors, powering a huge array of laser beams that heat up the atmosphere so much that it's blasted into space.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Although we would need thousands of times the entire power generating capacity of humanity and it would still take thousands of years to remove the atmosphere.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Another way is to sequester the atmosphere, binding the CO2 in different compounds through chemical reactions.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: We could mine elements like calcium or magnesium on mercury and shoot them at Venus via mass driver systems, electric rails that make rockets unnecessary on smaller paddocks.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: The metals would combine to bind the CO2 into different carbonates basically forever, but the scale makes the whole thing impractical.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: We would need several hundred billion tons of material to sequester the CO2 this way.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Seems like a waste of material, it might take too long.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: An equally ridiculous idea that could actually work is to put Venus in the shade.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Literally, by constructing a huge mirror to blot out the sun to just freeze the atmosphere.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: The mirror doesn't need to be complex or massive, just a very thin foil with a little structural support.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Building such a large flat surface so close to the sun will turn it effectively into a solar sail and push it out of position.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: So instead of one giant circular object, our mirror will consist of many different pieces.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Anunous slats of angled mirrors can reflect sunlight from one set of mirrors to the next.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Mirrors would be angled, reflecting light from one to another until the light is redirected to the back, balancing the force on the front and holding them in position.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: After a few years of getting the infrastructure in place, things start slowly and then escalate.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: For the first few decades, the atmosphere slowly cools down but stays dense and deadly.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Until after some 60 years, it reaches the critical temperature of 31 degrees Celsius.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Suddenly, the great flood begins on Venus as CO2 turns to liquid at this pressure and begins to rain down.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: A constant global rainstorm of unbelievable proportions lasting 30 years.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: The pressure and temperature suddenly begin to drop in unison.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: For almost a century, puddles turn into lakes and oceans.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: The surface temperature is now minus 56 degrees Celsius and the pressure has dropped to only 7 times the pressure on Earth.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Finally, at a ready unpleasant minus 81 degrees Celsius, the CO2 oceans begin to freeze and the rain turns into snow.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: This leaves us with a frozen Venus covered in oceans as hard as rock and gigantic CO2 glaciers.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: What remains of the atmosphere is mostly nitrogen at about 3 times Earth's surface pressure.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: If you don't mind freezing and suffocating, you can now take a stroll over Venus's surface.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Another obvious solution is to shoot it all out into space and collect it into a small moon for storage and future use.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: We can make this more efficient by using mass drivers instead of rockets, but moving all that mass will still be a pretty intense challenge that will take some time to solve.

Title: How To Terraform Venus (Quickly)
Sentence: Whatever we end up doing with the atmosphere, to move forward we need water, which we could get from ice moons.

Sentence: We can remove excess nitrogen using this same method to further lower our atmospheric pressure.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Is there a border we will never cross?

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Are there places we will never reach?

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: No matter how hard we try, it turns out, there are.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Even with sci-fi technology, we are trapped in a limited pocket of the universe and the finite stuff within it.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: How much universe is there for us and how far can we go?

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: If you look at the night sky, you might assume it will be there forever.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Stars, born and die again in a cycle that feels endless.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: But it's not.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Take the Milky Way.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Up to 200,000 light-years in diameter, containing some 100 to 400 billion stars.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: How many stars do you think are born here each year?

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Thousands?

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Millions?

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: The answer is around 3.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: 3 new stars per year.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: 95% of all the stars that will ever exist in the universe have already been born and we live at the tail end of the age of star formation.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: We are at the beginning of the end of the universe as we know it.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: The formation of new stars will continue to slow down.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: But there's more.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: It turns out that the universe is rushing away from us.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: The Milky Way is not alone.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Together with the Andromeda galaxy, and more than 50 dwarf galaxies, it forms the local group, a region of space about 10 million light-years in diameter, our galactic neighborhood.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Hundreds of galaxy groups like the local group make up the Lannier Chaos Supercluster, which itself is only one of a myriad of superclusters.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: In total, there are around 2 trillion galaxies that make up the current observable universe.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Unfortunately, even if we could travel at light speed, around 94% of the galaxies we can see are already unreachable for us forever.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Let this number sink in for a moment.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: The simple fact that there's a limit for us, and that there is so much universe that a human will never be able to touch is kind of frightening.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Why are all of these galaxies out of reach already?

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Well, it all has to do with why there are galaxies in the first place, the Big Bang.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: We're simplifying here, but in a nutshell, about 10 to the power of minus 36 seconds after the Big Bang, the young universe was a very small bubble of energy.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: It wasn't completely uniform, though.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Some parts of it were a tiny, tiny bit denser than others, which had massive consequences.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: In a process called cosmic inflation, the observable universe expanded rapidly from the science of a marble to trillions of kilometers in a trillionth of a second.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: That was so fast that all those tiny differences in density were stretched from subatomic distances into galactic distances, which is why the whole universe consists of more and less dense regions.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Pockets of the universe filled with a bit more stuff than the space around them.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: After that short but powerful inflation ended, gravity began trying to pull everything back together.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: Inside the dense apocates, gravity emerged victorious, and so over time, they grew into groups of galaxies like the one we live in today.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: The local group is our pocket of the universe.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: But at larger scales, outside the dense apocates, the expansion of space never stopped.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross
Sentence: This means that our local group is surrounded by a lot of stuff, but none of those structures and galaxies are gravitationally bound to us.

Title: TRUE Limits Of Humanity – The Final Border We Will Never Cross

Sentence: It's mass, spin and electric charge.

Sentence: Everything else is lost.
