Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Do we need nuclear energy to stop climate change?

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: More and more voices from science, environmental activists, and the press have been saying so in recent years.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: But this comes as a shock to those who are fighting against nuclear energy and the problems that come with it.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: So who's right?

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Well, it's complicated.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: To slow rapid climate change, the world needs to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to net zero.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: In 2018, three quarters of global emissions were released through energy production, namely by burning fossil fuels.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Energy is a broad term that describes all sorts of stuff from moving things and people around to putting things big and small together or heating our homes.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Currently, 84% of the world's primary energy comes from fossil fuels.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: 33% from oil, 27% from coal, and 24% from gas.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Around 10% of the global all supply is just used to burn in boilers to make our homes cozyant war.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Only about 16% of global energy is from lower emission sources.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Almost 7% from hydroelectric, 5% from solar, wind, bioenergy, wave, tidal, and geothermal combined and about 4% from nuclear.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: So we pretty much rely on coal, oil and gas to keep our civilization going, which means it's actually very hard to transition away from them.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: To have a chance of escaping fossil fuels without throwing humanity back into the Stone Age, one of the most impactful things we can do is to electrify as many sectors as possible.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Electricity is the stuff that appears like magic when you plug something into a socket so you can watch YouTube.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Every industry that can switch from burning fossil fuels to electricity needs to do so from electric cars to electric heaters.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Why do we need to bet so hard on electricity?

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Because we can produce electricity with lower emission technologies like solar, wind or nuclear.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: So electricity is a real lever for a radical transition, but there are a few problems making this transition really hard.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: First of all, in most places in the world, electricity is still generated mostly by burning fossil fuels.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: And not only that, in the last 20 years, the world's electricity usage increased 73% in absolute terms.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: While we are installing renewables at record speeds at the same time, the amount of fossil fuel we're burning for electricity still keeps rising year by year.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Renewables have so far not been able to catch up with the demand for new electricity and so despite our progress, emissions from electricity are still rising worldwide.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: The other alternative to fossil fuels is nuclear, and even though it's not renewable, its greenhouse gas emissions are tiny compared to burning stuff.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: But in the last 20 years, nuclear has basically stagnated.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Countries like China, India and South Korea built new reactors, while Germany and Japan have been actively taking their nuclear plants off line.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Which seems a bit weird if we look at the countries with the most low carbon electricity in the world, the get most of their juice, mainly from two sources, nuclear or hydropower.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Take France and Sweden.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: In France, only around 10% comes from fossil fuels, while 67% comes from nuclear and 23% from renewables, primarily hydro.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: In Sweden, almost 30% comes from nuclear power and about 45% from hydro.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: So we know that nuclear energy can work at scale.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: On the technical side, because of the lack of investment and innovation in the last few decades, the majority of the world's nuclear reactors are pretty old technology that's very costly to replace.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: In most Western countries, building nuclear reactors has become very expensive for a variety of reasons, like a lot of know-how in constructing them.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Policy changes and increased regulatory constraints, so it can take a decade or longer just to finish a power plant.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: In contrast, countries like South Korea, China, India and Russia are able to build new nuclear reactors comparatively quickly, and at a competitive cost.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Still, generally in the West, the current generation of nuclear power plants are more expensive to build and maintain the most fossil fuel alternatives.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: There are also the concerns about nuclear waste and the fear of accidents, but we cover those in other videos in more detail.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: We have designs for nuclear reactors that solve many of their problems, namely small reactors that take less time and money to get started.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: There are also next-generation technologies that can already turn radioactive waste into new fuel, but so far, these have not been deployed at a scale where they can have a significant impact on the nuclear sector.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Considering these uncertainties, some argue that nuclear power is a dangerous relic of the past, and that we should just let it go and focus on renewables.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: But while renewables undoubtedly are the future of electricity, they still have their own huge challenges to overcome before they can take over the vast majority of the electricity grid.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: The main problem is reliability and consistency.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: It's not always windy, and the sun doesn't always shine, especially in the mornings and evenings when humans need the most electricity.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: The variations between seasons don't make this issue easier.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: To make renewables reliable and not risk blackouts, we need massive storage capacities where we can save energy collected when the sun or wind are at their peak, and release it later when we actually need it.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Until this is possible, other sources of electricity need to provide a controllable load that creates the reliability of supply that our civilization needs to run properly.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Eventually, we will be able to do this with renewables, but we need a lot of batteries or storage power plants.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Right now, we simply don't have the tech and the capacities to make this transition fast enough to replace fossil fuels.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: But even if we could, there's another aspect we have to take into account.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: We're not just trying to kick fossil fuels out of electricity, we're trying to replace energy with electricity.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: If we're going to electrify sectors that currently use fossil fuels like cars or heating, we will need significantly more electricity than we currently using everywhere around the world.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: And if the electricity needs the world population continue to grow as they have over the last 20 years, we'll need even more.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: It all comes down to one thing.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: No energy source is perfect, all have their own unique problems, both renewables and nuclear energy require time, investment and technological innovation.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: On their own, neither is ready to remove fossil fuels from our electricity grid, although activists on both sides claim that they are.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: In the end, the question is how we want to deal with all these challenges.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Should we give up nuclear immediately, and at least temporarily, accept higher emissions?

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Will we try to extend the life of current nuclear reactors and shut them down afterwards while solving the shortcomings of renewables?

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Or will we invest in new nuclear technology to get new nuclear reactor types that are cheaper and safer?

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Or will we maybe do both?

Sentence: A PINYUM part starts here.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Considering the risks the climate change poses for the biosphere and humanity, any technology that has a chance of contributing to a solution should be pursued.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: That's just good risk management and strategy.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: If preventing rapid climate change as quickly as possible as our goal, it might be a good idea to see nuclear and renewables not as opponents but as partners.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: We know there's no time to waste, so we should keep all of our lower mission players on the field.

Sentence: As things are both nuclear and renewables need innovation and investment, but if we don't know yet which technology will be ready how quickly, why not just invest in both and see what happens.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: And on the topic of current capacities, if we take nuclear energy offline right now, then that missing capacity will be replaced at least partially by fossil fuels.

Title: Do we Need Nuclear Energy to Stop Climate Change?
Sentence: Even if new nuclear power plants in the West are expensive, in the long run, it may be cheaper to build them as long as they prevent more fossil fuel capacity being added and paying for the consequences of rapid climate change.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: Continuing this Proud tradition let's explore the scientific mystery of what would happen to you if Earth suddenly turned into gold.

Sentence: The Midas Pogleps based on the ancient tale of King Midas who was cursed so everything he touched turned into gold.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: Before we can explore this scenario with science we'll first define the prowess.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: Midas' curse is a very special phenomenon called magic which allows us to modify physics.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: So what happens when Midas touches something and it turns to gold?

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: An atom of gold has 79 protons and 118 neutrons in its nucleus.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: The electric force of the protons on the electrons around them shapes the atom and gives gold its chemical properties like that it doesn't rust and that it's kind of shiny and bending.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: So to make not gold into gold we have to change atoms.

Sentence: Let's say Midas touches a duck.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: All the light elements like hydrogen, carbon and oxygen, gain electrons and protons and neutrons to become gold.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: Not only is the duck suddenly 33 times more massive it's also much too dense.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: The gold atoms are far closer together than they like and repeat each other violently causing the golden duck to explode with the energy of half a ton of TNT leaving only gold dust and a very dead Midas.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: This is clearly not a very good way for Midas' power to work.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: So what if instead Midas' power uses the atom that are already present and simply rearranges all particles in the matter he touches into gold?

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: No matter is created or destroyed instead atoms dissolve and the protons, neutrons and electrons are reassembled to make gold.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: However gold is very dense about 20 times denser than a duck.

Sentence: This is only the start of our problems though since earth imploded superpsonically.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: The kinetic energy of the implosion is basically equivalent to detonating a planet made of TNT.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse
Sentence: Crush together under incredible forces Earth's core reaches a million degrees Celsius, a temperature closer to the core of a star than anything we're used to finding on earth.

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse

Title: What if the World turned to Gold? - The Gold Apocalypse

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Nuclear energy creates an uneasy feeling of danger for many people.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Ancient and dangerous minerals are concentrated to awaken seemingly unnatural powers, creating horribly toxic elements that if they escape, can and have killed people in horrible ways.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: How many people has nuclear energy killed and how?

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Nuclear energy has been a thing since 1951, and since then, there have been around 30 reported accidents globally.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Most of them were pretty minor compared to the two disasters everybody is familiar with, Fukushima and Chernobyl.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Chernobyl is undoubtedly the worst nuclear accident in history for a number of reasons.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: The reactor technology was old and ill-prepared for emergencies, and the government response was slow and more concerned about image than damage control.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Still, only 31 people died directly in the accident.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: But what makes nuclear energy scary is not react to blowing up, but the radiation they release.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: So the real question is how many deaths through cancer and other diseases will Chernobyl cause?

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Here things get really complicated because you dip right into controversy, and just discussing the different estimates and how they will calculate is deserves a video of its own.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: The most pessimistic estimate comes from a study commissioned by the European Green Party and projects up to 60,000 premature deaths by the year 2065.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Most scientific studies come up with numbers much lower than this.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: The WHO has estimated that in total, the long-term death toll will be around 4,000.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: While the UN scientific committee on the effects of atomic radiation concluded that even this figure could be too high.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: For more details on this, check our research document.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: The second big nuclear accident was Fukushima Day-T-2011.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Fukushima did not only operate with much better technology, that was less dangerous in the first place, much better security measures were in place, and the official response was fast and decisive.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: And so the current death toll is only 573.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: The major difference here is that these deaths were not a consequence of radiation.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: They were indirect deaths from the stress of the evacuation of the areas around the reactors, and occurred almost entirely in older populations.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Estimates of the possible long-term deaths from radiation vary widely, from not at all to about 1,000.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: In terms of the other long-term consequences, an increase in thyroid cancer in children has been observed, but according to the WHO, this is related to the increased screening rates.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: By 2018, there had been only one confirmed death among workers as a result of radiation induced lung cancer.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Now, let's compare this to renewable energy.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Solar-wind and geothermal energy basically only cause deaths as a result of construction and maintenance accidents.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Unfortunately, their current share of global energy is pretty low.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: The major player in renewable energy is hydropower, which mostly means building dams and letting water flow through turbines from higher elevation to a lower elevation.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: In total, hydro has been the most fatal in terms of accidents, with hundreds of thousands of deaths in the last half century.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: One accident clearly stands out.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: The 1975 Bancao Hydroelectric Dam failure in China, which has striking similarities to Chernobyl.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Old technology, poor designer and poor management by authoritarian governments, concerned about appearances.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: In a nutshell, a massive typhoon triggered intense flooding, that destroyed the dam, and subsequently, a number of smaller dams in a chain reaction, unleashing a flood of over 15 billion cubic metres of water in total.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Colometer-wide waves as high as buildings devastated thousands of square kilometers of countryside and countless communities.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: All in all, the death toll from just this one accident and its direct consequences is estimated to lie between 85,000 to 240,000.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: But all of these deaths caused by nuclear and renewable energy are actually negligible in comparison to the real killer energy source.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Fossil fuel, the most widely used source of energy and electricity.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: When we burn fossil fuels to heat up water and make turbine spin, or to cause many explosions to move cars within turtle combustion engines, gases like ozone, suffered outside, carbon monoxide and nitrogen dioxide are released into the atmosphere.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: Breathing in these gases disrupt lung function, which aggravates chronic conditions like asthma and bronchitis, and causes a wide range of respiratory and cardiovascular diseases.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: But even more dangerous is the fine particle pollution burning fossil fuels causes.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: A mixture of solid and liquid droplets of poister substances, a sword as 2.5 microns in diameter.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: They easily find their way deep into your lungs and increase the risk of deadly diseases like lung cancer, stroke, and heart disease.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: The fossil fuel-related air pollution is the number one cause of environmental-related deaths in the world.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History
Sentence: According to the WHO, it accounts for 29% of all cases of lung cancer.

Title: Worst Nuclear Accidents in History

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The desire to be free from the limits of the human experience is as old as our first stories.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: We exist in an endless universe, only bound by the laws of physics and yet our consciousness is trapped in mortal machines made of meat.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: With the breathtaking explosion of innovation and progress for the first time the concept of leaving our flesh piles behind and uploading our minds into a digital utopia seems possible, even like the logical next step on our evolutionary latter.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Mind uploading and digital immortality are some of the core themes of the game's Cyberpunk 2077.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: It plays in a grim dystopian future where humanity has progressed far beyond today's technology and explores what this could mean for humanity.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: About a year ago, CD Projekt Red asked us if we would like to make a video about some of these ideas and we were immediately on board.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: So let's explore this topic together.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Is it possible to upload your mind into a computer?

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Well, it's complicated.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Let's do this.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Upload what exactly?

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Mind is one of those words that are really hard to define.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: It's thought to be the collective abilities of your consciousness and intelligence, the thing that lets you imagine, recognize and dream.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Mind uploading is the hypothetical concept of making a copy of this in a world and transferring it into a computer to run a simulation of your consciousness.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: But even defining the premise gets really hard, really fast.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The possibility of mind uploading is based on three assumptions.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: A assumption one, your mind is in your brain's structure, arrangement and biochemistry.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The idea that everything about the mind can be found in the brain is called physicalism and it keeps our discussion within the domain of natural law.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Assumption two.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: At some point, we will understand the brain well enough and possess the technology to simulate all of its aspects to make a digital mind copy.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Assumption three.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Computer software can host your mind, which means the mind is computable.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: There is no physical property in the brain, including consciousness that cannot be simulated accurately even if it requires a lot of code.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: All of these assumptions have been proposed and challenged by scientists and philosophers and they remain the subject of passionate debate.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: With so many fundamental questions still unanswered, it's hard to discuss the topic without annoying someone.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: What ever your position, every discussion of mind upload has to begin with the brain.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The brain in a nutshell.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The brain is the most complex biological structure known and deserves its own entire video, so let's just take a brief look at it.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Around 100 billion neurons are communicating via 1 million billion connections that are sending signals up to 1,000 times each second, which is one quadrilion events every second of your waking life.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: And it's not just neurons, there are billions of supporting and immune cells of various types performing different jobs.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: On a macro level, the brain can be divided into sections with different roles from breathing and heart rate to coordinating movement and involuntary reflexes.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The most developed part, the Neo-Cortex or the Outermost layer of the brain, hold memories, our ability to plan, think, and imagine, hope and dream.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Where exactly the you part of the brain is situated is not entirely clear.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: We know that areas like the Pre-Cunious Cortex have the greatest influence on our consciousness, but also that several areas can network together to share tasks none of them can do alone.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The brain's building blocks are not exactly simple either.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Neurons are not just wires, they alter and process information.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Signaps is where signals are hand over from one neuron to the next, contain receptors for hundreds of chemical signals, opening them up to outside influence.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: We have a basic understanding of how these work, and we can accurately predict their behavior at small scales, but there's a lot more to the brain than just nerve signals.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Hortmoans play a huge role, like serotonin, which affects our mood, or histamine, which helps us learn.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The brain is influenced by our other parts, too, from heart nerves to gut bacteria.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: What seemed like a very complicated system to begin with, gets even more complicated than more we learn about it.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: To get this wildly interconnected mess of cells and meat and chemicals into a computer, we need a model that we can simulate an our digital world, some sort of scam.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Unfortunately, our scanning technology, like FMRIM machines, is not nearly good enough to attempt such a thing.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: But there is a different method that seems very promising.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Cutting a brain into tiny slices and scanning them with a high-resolution electron microscope to create an accurate map of all the cells and connections.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: In 2019, scientists successfully mapped a cubic millimeter of mousebrain, roughed the size of a big grain of sand.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: It contained 100,000 neurons with a billion synapses and four kilometers of nerve fibers.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: This grain of brain was cut into 25,000 slices.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: 5 electron microscopes ran continuously for five months, collecting more than 100 billion images.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: It took three months to assemble the images into a 3D model.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The completed data set fills up two million gigabytes of cloud storage.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: To scan a whole human brain, we would have to repeat this effort a million times, which is much easier said than done.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Even worse, to correctly simulate a brain, we might even have to map out much smaller building blocks to include the billions of underlying proteins or even individual molecules that cause all the behaviors we see at the cellular level.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Which might produce more data than the capacity of all data storage on Earth.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Brain water to consciousness wine.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: While all of these issues are annoying, the real question is how we turn the static blueprint of the brain into an active thing.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Even if we have a scan, down to the level of synapses, we need laws and rules that animate the wiring diagram.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: To end out this static structure with life, update it with the various laws of chemical binding of electro dynamics to animate the simulation.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: So it becomes a dynamic active thing like a brain that exists from one microsecond to the next that could evolve in time, think, see and act.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The reality is that we just don't know if this is possible to achieve.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: If our technology can give rise to real minds, it all hinges on the nature of the problem.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Are the brain and mind just complicated and a lot of work to figure out, or are they complex in a way that we can't solve?

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: In the worst case, consciousness is more than the sum of the parts of the brain in a way that we don't realize yet.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Complex in a way that we can't solve by getting better scans.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Just having a list of the ingredients might not be enough to get a good consciousness cake.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Right now we have a great starting point with tangible scientific results and an end goal, but the road to true simulation is unclear and requires a lot of innovation and research.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Shubans have historically been horrible at predicting the pace of progress.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: In the best case, it's just a matter of doing the work and finding the right solutions.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: It might not be necessary to simulate every last cell down to the last atom.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Instead, it may be possible to simplify elements into probabilistic models that could match the behaviour of the brain using a more manageable number of simpler systems.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: So we really don't know if we will ever understand our brain and consciousness well enough to upload human minds, but the science is real and worth pursuing.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: At the very least, we will just learn a lot about ourselves and develop a bunch of new technologies.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: If we succeed, this might put mind uploading well within the capabilities of our rapidly progressing computer technology.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The consequences for humanity and our future in this universe are vast, creepy and amazing.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The copy.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Successful mind uploading is functional immortality.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Unless damaged or deleted, you will continue to exist as long as a copy is stored somewhere.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: Of course, if the scan is corrupted in any of a myriad of ways, your mind might get corrupted too.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: You might be in an eternity of pain or paranoia or having an endless psychotic breakdown.

Title: Can You Upload Your Mind & Live Forever?
Sentence: The question if this digital mind is you, opens another whole can of worms, for now, will just assume that your digital mind at least feels like it's you.

Sentence: How would mind uploading change your outlook on life?

Sentence: Will you feel safer knowing that death is not necessarily the end?

Sentence: In and out.

Sentence: In and out.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Staying alive is about doing things.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: This very second your cells are combusting glucose molecules with oxygen to make energy available which keeps your life for another precious moment.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: To get the oxygen to your cells, you're breathing.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Breathing is an answer to a very hard problem.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: How do you get the resources that your cells need to survive from the outside to the inside of your cells?

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Every living thing has to solve this problem and the solution is surprisingly different depending on what the most important regulators of life have.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Size.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: As we've discussed in other videos, at different scales, the physical laws that the universe have different consequences for its inhabitants.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Simple things like temperature, microgravity or surface tension might not matter to you or be a deadly danger depending on how big you are.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Living things need a lot of different materials to keep the cells going and they somehow need to transport them from the outside to the inside.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: This was a huge problem for the first things on the verge of being alive because doing anything in our universe requires energy and the first living beings on earth did not have the abundance of tools and techniques available that life has today after billions of years of evolution.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: So at the very beginning, life needed to find a way to get good stuff inside and bad stuff outside itself without using energy.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Luckily, the very first forms of life were very very small and because they were so small, they were able to use a free form of transport that was based on a physical law called diffusion.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Diffusion is the rule of the universe that molecules, especially in liquids or gases are constantly moving around in all directions and because they move around and bump into each other and other molecules they tend to spread.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: For example, if you drop a sugar cube into water, then there is a lot of sugar in one place and in another place there's none.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: As sugar molecules dissolve in the water, they will start randomly bumping against the water molecules and other sugar molecules.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Slowly, all the sugar molecules will spread out and form multiple phases of different concentrations.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: These random movements continue endlessly until at some point the sugar will be spread evenly in the water.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: The great thing about diffusion is that life can use it for free.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: It doesn't require energy and life loves free things.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: So all life on earth relies on diffusion.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Let's look at the smallest living being on earth a bacterium.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Specifically, it's surfaces.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Selman brains allow for diffusion of certain molecules.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: This specific bacterium consumes oxygen to live while carbon dioxide is produced inside as a waste product.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: So inside the bacterium there isn't a lot of oxygen but a lot of carbon dioxide.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Because of diffusion these molecules will eventually spread evenly so the carbon dioxide diffuses out while oxygen is constantly replenished from the outside.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: But this kind of breathing only works for the very small world.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: For bacteria, omoeber or yourselves and a few very small animals.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Insects, for example, have a fine network of trachea tunnels with a pressure gradient where air very slowly can diffuse in and exchange gases with the insect cells.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: But even insects seem to be able to contract their trachea and at least some even have specialized breathing organs like spiracles and air sacks.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: At certain scales diffusion is just too slow to keep cells alive.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: The fundamental problem is that the exchange with the environment can only happen at the surface and diffusion of materials can only sustain a certain amount of inside.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Tiny living things have only a little bit of inside or volume and a lot of outside or surface area.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: But what if we wanted to create a bacteria the size of a blue whale and had a very convenient enlargement machine?

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: We would sadly be messed up by the square cube law.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: In a nutshell it means that if you make something ten times larger its outside or surface would grow by 100 but its inside or volume grows by 1000 times.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: If we compare the bacterium suit of murder syringe no so with a blue whale we see that the bacterium has 10 million times more surface in relation to its volume than the whale.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: The bacterium has a lot of outside while the whale has a lot of insights.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: If we make a bacterium the size of a whale our giant bacteria now has too much insight and most of its inside is now very far from its surface.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: The oxygenabacterium needs would never reach the inside before it would run out of oxygen.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Our giant bacterium would just die.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Still being bigger has many upside.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: From making it harder to be eaten to making it easier to eat others.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: But the size of cells is limited by the distance oxygen and nutrients can effectively diffuse to provide the inside with enough resources.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: So life avoided this problem by forming multi-cellular structures.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Being composed of many cells instead of one because diffusion works better if you have many small units instead of one much bigger one.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Over time the cell buddies began to share work and specialise.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Some cells concentrated on sensing the environment others on digestion others on movement but that still wasn't enough.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: The problem of diffusion and surface and energy production remained limiting the size these first multi-cellular forms of life could attain.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: So in order to become even bigger life solved the diffusion problem by having holes and caves and tunnels and by folding in on itself.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: So diffusion could happen easily in each one of the cells.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Take yourself.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: What you consider your outside your skin has a surface area of about two square meters but your lungs have a surface area of about 70 square meters.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: They aren't like balloons.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: They're more like sponges filled with many tiny, packed tiny balloons surrounded by blood vessels.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: When you breathe in all these tiny balloons fill up with fresh air.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Blood filled up with CO2 is pumped around the balloons and then the magic of diffusion happens.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: The oxygen diffuses into the blood where it's picked up by red blood cells and the CO2 diffuses out of the blood and into your lungs where it can be breathed out again.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Your blood then carries oxygen-rich blood into the furthest corners of your body and picks up the CO2 waste.

Title: How Large Can a Bacteria get? Life & Size 3
Sentence: Diffusion in the body is effective at about one millimeter so every cell in your body is a most one millimeter away from a blood vessel.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: By the end of the 21st century, humanity is becoming desperate.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Decades of heat waves and drought have led to unusually poor harvest while the warming oceans yield fewer fish each year.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: In the tropical zones, millions suffer from famine and resource wars have made millions more flee to the north.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: As things quickly get worse, in an active desperation, the world's governments decide to enact an emergency plan.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: It's far from certain that a grim scenario like this will play out, but the failure of world leaders to effectively address climate change makes it far from impossible.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: So, in the near future, it might become necessary to try something radical to slow down rapid climate change.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Geoengineering Interventions so massive in scale that they might undo centuries of human behaviour, or they care about things much worse.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: What is geoengineering?

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Is it really an option and what if it goes wrong?

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Geoengineering methods vary from fantastic ones like constructing giant light sails in space, to seeding clouds with salt or wilder ones like fertilizing the oceans with iron to speed up the growth of trillions of algae cells.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: In this video, we'll focus on an intervention we could see during our lifetime.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Stratospheric aerosol injection A clunky term that means spraying stuff very high up in the atmosphere to keep the sun away.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Keeping the sun away CO2 doesn't heat up the planet on its own, or most all of the energy on Earth comes from the sun in the form of electromagnetic radiation.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: About 71% of this energy is absorbed by the Earth's surface and atmosphere.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: This absorbed energy is emitted again as infrared radiation, and CO2 is able to trap this infrared radiation and keep it in the atmosphere for a while.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: You can compare this effect with snuggling under a blanket in the morning.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Even in a really cold room, your body emits infrared radiation and the air between your body and the blanket traps it and creates a warm and comfy feeling.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: So one way to cool down the planet would be to prevent energy from getting trapped under our planet blanket, which is already happening naturally.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: About 29% of the solar radiation hitting Earth is reflected back to space by bright surfaces like ice, deserts, snow, or clouds.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: More reflection, less energy, less warming.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: We can look at nature for inspiration.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Specifically, the 1991 Mount Pinnotuba eruption, the second largest volcanic eruption of the 20th century.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Aside from massive devastation and almost 900 dead scientists noted its strong impact on the global climate.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: The explosion ejected millions of tons of particles and gas as high as the stratosphere, which hung around there for a while.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: The stuff that's interesting for geoengineering is sulphur dioxide, a nasty smelling and invisible gas.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: High in the atmosphere, it produced a haze of sulfuric acid droplet that mix with water and created giant veils.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: These veils reduced the sunlight reaching Earth's surface by roughly 1%.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Global average temperatures dropped by 0.5 degrees Celsius.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: It took three years until this cooling effect had stopped.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Humans could imitate this process by injecting sulfur particles directly into the stratosphere.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: According to some scientists, this might be surprisingly easy to do and we don't even need a lot of new technology for it.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: According to one study, it also might be pretty cheap compared with the costs of rapid climate change.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: A small fleet of specialized aircraft could ascend once a year and distribute aerosols along the equator from where they would be spread around the world.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Projections assume that injecting between five and eight megatons of material per year would reflect enough sunlight to slow down or even stop global warming, giving us precious time to transition the way from fossil fuels.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Unfortunately, there might be a few unhappy side effects.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: There are a number of potential issues with aerosol injections.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Rainfall patterns could change which could negatively affect agriculture and cause famine.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Billions of people could be affected in the worst case.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Also, after the 1991 Mount Pinnotuba eruption, the acid water veils not only cool down the surface, they also heated up the stratosphere.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: As it turns out, acid is bad for the ozone layer and the ozone hole over Antarctica was the largest it has ever been.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Injecting self-aparticles over decades could have a similar effect.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Scientists have already suggested using a combination of different minerals that might have much less harmful effects on the ozone layer, but more research and experiments need to be done to make sure this could work.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: But even if we don't damage the ozone layer, there are other risks.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Politicians and industry might use the cooling effect as an excuse to delay the switch to a carbon neutral economy.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Even if geoengineering slows down global warming, humanity is still adding extra CO2 to the atmosphere.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: More CO2 in the air means that the oceans absorb more CO2 which makes them more acidic.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: This is already beginning to be deadly to huge ecosystems like coral reefs and the longer this continues, the more severe the effects will be.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: But it gets worse.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Once we start pumping particles into the atmosphere on a massive scale, we might be forced to do so for a long time or we could risk a termination shock.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: What that means is that if humanity continues to enrich the atmosphere with CO2, but at the same time prevents the planet from heating up by blocking solar radiation, we're sitting on a time bomb.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Once we stop geoengineering, the natural cycle will take over again and Earth would heat up.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: But after a few decades of keeping the planet artificially cold, while still releasing massive amounts of CO2, it would heat up much much quicker.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: An increase in temperature that would take 50 years today could happen in just 10 years.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Such a temperature shock in such a short time would disrupt every major system on Earth so much that it would be impossible to adapt in time.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: The worst case scenario could be dramatic fowmins and the rapid destruction of ecosystems.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Humanity might survive, but the survivors would inhabit an unfamiliar and hostile world.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: The best case scenario is that once the world has finally fully understood the existential danger of rapid climate change, geoengineering can bias a crucial decade or two.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Time to transition our economies and maybe even pull CO2 out of the atmosphere, maybe with technologies that we'll discuss in a future video.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Conclusion geoengineering is a scary concept.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: It's not a solution to climate change and it might even be a welcome excuse for the fossil fuel industry to delay the end of the fossil fuel age.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Over the last few decades, geoengineering has been so controversial that it stopped many scientists from doing the experiments necessary to understand it better.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: But blankly opposing geoengineering is short sighted.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: The sad truth is we are already running a geoengineering experiment.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: We're testing how fast the world changes if we add about 40 billion tons of CO2 each year.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: This experiment is about to get really exciting.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Hopefully we'll never have to use geoengineering, but if we need to in the future we better have done the science.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: We better be prepared, or a panicking humanity might accidentally press the self-destruct button.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: You probably won't have to do any of that yourself, but who knows better brush up on your science knowledge just in case?

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: And our friends at Brilliant can help you with that.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Brilliant is a problem-solving website and app that makes science accessible in a practical way.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: More than 60 interactive courses give you the tools to crack problems in maths, logic and engineering all by yourself.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Instead of a classic lecture format, Brilliant uses storytelling, code writing and hands-on problems to keep you entertained and engaged.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: This way a small daily challenge can build up to real long-term understanding of science and achieving your STEM goals.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: In a nutshell Brilliant surprises you and keeps you on your toes, all while sneaking some knowledge into your head without you really noticing.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: Right up are ready, really?

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: To get a fresh perspective on science, go to brilliant.org slash nutshell and sign up for free.

Title: Geoengineering: A Horrible Idea We Might Have to Do
Sentence: And there's an extra perk for Kotkzart viewers, the first 200 people to use the link get 20 percent off that annual membership, which lets you view all the daily problems in the archives and unlock every course.

Sentence: Brilliant helps you end your day a little smarter.

Sentence: Still the best preparation for the future we can think of.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Imagine someone coming into your kitchen and taking a few tools, a pan and your garbage, then they bury everything in the woods.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: 12,000 years later, an archaeologist is trying to figure out who you were.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: What was important to you?

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: What video games you played, what you believed in and what informed your decisions.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Because you happened to live during a remarkable time in human history.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: The planetary revolution, when humanity transitioned, becoming a multi-planetary species.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: In that time, our numbers would explode by orders of magnitude.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Our technology and standard of living would improve to levels previously thought impossible, and our self-conception would change forever.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: And all the future archaeologist has to learn about is your junk in the woods.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: While we can only hope that this will be someone's problem in 12,000 years, we have the same problem today.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: We're trying to reconstruct a revolution that took place 12,000 years ago.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Today, only shadows remain of the people who experienced our distant past as their present.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: What remains from our past?

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: We can look at our present in crispy 4K in colour and sound.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Three generations ago, the world was just black and white.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: One more generation and we see the world through blurred photographs.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Further back, paintings and texts become our main way of experiencing the past.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: A mere 20 generations before us today, every written word had to be copied by hand and reports became more scarce and less reliable.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: The first historian lived a mere 100 generations ago.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Before him, there are only epics and legends and dead kings bragging on pieces of stone.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: 250 generations ago, there are only fragments left in the ground and images stripped to their original meaning.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Eventually humanity becomes basically invisible.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Still, we do know some things about our ancestors.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Let's try to tell their story and what it means for us today.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: The greatest transition in human history.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: For some 2 million years or roughly 80,000 generations, the life of our ancestors was basically the same.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: It was around 20,000 years or 800 generations ago that the behaviourally modern humans began a process that would change our lifestyle forever.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: At first, gradually, for some of us, then faster for more of us and then suddenly for almost all of us.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Back then, there were about 1 million modern humans on earth.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Most other human species had died out, probably with a little help from us.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Our ancestors biology had given them the necessary tools.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: A general intelligence to understand things, a social intelligence to understand each other, and language to express abstract ideas and create new concepts.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: These were people just like you.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: They suffered and experienced joy, were bored, cried and laughed.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: They lived in communities of a few dozen people.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: They controlled fire and had tools made from wood, stone and bone, told stories, worn bare dead, and created art.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: They traded with other tribes from Obsidian to shellfish.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Some hunted big game and were very mobile, others relied more on plants they collected, and others mostly stayed in one area with an abundance of seafood.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: This was the common state of humanity for most of our history.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Until a slow transition, step by step, turned into a revolution.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Step by step.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: The first solid evidence for this stems from the Jordan Valley where our ancestors collected wild wheat more than 20,000 years ago.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: They noticed that seeds in the ground made more plants the next year.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: If they put good ones in one place, the next year they had more of the good ones.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: This was a great supplement to hunting and gathering.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: You could prepare some crops, return next year, build a temporary settlement, and have a secure food supply.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Our ancestors used these bonus crops to bait the first bread and brew the first beer.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: With every generation, they gathered deeper knowledge about the plants and animals around them, and how to manipulate them to their advantage.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: But there was a lot to learn.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Very slowly from generation to generation, pockets of knowledge expanded, and were passed along to be expanded again.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: This early agriculture started to drastically reduce the space our ancestors needed to feed one individual, which made it possible to stay in one place longer.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Around 12,000 years ago, these little pieces of progress had reached a critical mass.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Most of the canarots we consume today stem from about 15 different founder crops that humans began to domesticate in earnest in the next few thousand years.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: What we call the agricultural revolution was not a thing that began suddenly one day.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: It was a slow process driven by small groups over many generations.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Eventually, gradual change gave rise to a new era.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: The human era.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: During the next few thousand years, progress would speed up and turn hunter-gatherers into farmers who lived in villages, towns and then cities.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: When farmers moved into new areas, they replaced the nomadic tribes or turned them into farmers too.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: This was neither easy nor painless.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: In the early days, people had a diverse diet made up of up to 250 different plants and animals.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: For some of the groups transitioning to agriculture, the variation in their diets declined drastically and some even seemed to have been undernourished.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: And living close together and with animals created a breeding ground for disease.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Virtually every infectious disease caused by microorganisms that have adapted to humans arose in the last 10,000 years.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Colourer, smallpox, measles, influenza, chickenpox and malaria.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Mortality, especially among children, rose drastically.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Still, loud numbers grew because living in the same place enabled women to bear far more children than before and for a farmer more kids mean more hands to work the fields.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Even with more people dying younger, villages and towns grew, the number of humans on earth exploded.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: About 100 generations after the beginning of the human era, there were already 4 million of us.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: This increased the need for food and forced people to come up with ever more efficient ways of producing calories, solidifying our new lifestyle.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Going back to hunting and gathering would have just meant death by starvation for most.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: One question remains unanswered.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Why?

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Why would people exchange the freedom of living off nature with a huge variety in food for the grind of agriculture and often more limited diets?

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Nobody knows for sure.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Climate change seems to have made the transition possible and some scientists argue that it was caused by external factors like undernourishment or overpopulation both highly contested.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Today, the most widely accepted idea is that it was a deliberate choice made by countless communities around the globe.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Maybe it's also connected with what makes us human.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: The ability to come together, develop shared identities and exchange stories and knowledge.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: Some archaeologists think the groups of hunter-gatherers traveled long and far to celebrate, to hold feasts and rituals.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: They would have used these occasions to talk about their version of innovation, better hunting and toolmaking techniques, how to catch and read animals and which plants could be collected and multiplied, maybe they even exchanged seeds.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era
Sentence: It's not unlikely that these gatherings were the catalysts that spread the knowledge of agriculture through the many isolated groups of humanity.

Title: When Time Became History - The Human Era

Sentence: The richer and water-veloped we are, the more emissions our lifestyle produces.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: A programmer in the US has a higher CO2 footprint than 50 farmers in Uganda.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: The world's wealth is growing almost everywhere.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: And although it's far from even the distributed, economic growth has led to the highest standards of living and the largest reduction in extreme poverty in human history.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: Energy intensity describes how efficiently we use energy.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: The latter is way more efficient.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: Be it powering a metropolitan area or grilling a cabat.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: So making our technology more efficient and coming up with more efficient ways to organize our societies is one of the most important ways to reduce the modern worlds CO2 dependency.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: This can mean everything from reducing power consumption with AI, the electrification of the transportation and industrial sectors or sustainable country production.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: The opportunities for improvement are almost limitless and human ingenuity can run wild.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: But we know that increasing efficiency alone will not be enough, mostly for three reasons.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: One, direct rebound effects.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: This means that once something becomes more efficient, it's used more, and so overall the increased efficiency does not lead to a reduction as impressive as you would first think.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: Or worse, sometimes more efficiency makes humans not use less of a resource, but more of it.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: When planes became more fuel efficient, ticket prices decreased and more people started to travel by plane.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: So making things more efficient does not automatically mean less energy use in total.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: It might have the opposite effects.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: Two, indirect rebound effects.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: Sometimes when you save money on a thing that's become more efficient, you might spend it elsewhere.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: So in the end, you might actually emit more CO2, despite getting a more efficient car.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: Three, and lastly, the more you optimize for efficiency, the harder and more expensive it becomes to get more efficient.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: So over time, the return on investment slows down.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: But regardless of how efficient we make our economies, as long as we need at least some energy, we will have emissions.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: The efficiency alone won't create a zero carbon world.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.

Sentence: Number four, CO2 emissions per energy unit used or our global carbon footprint.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: She manages global carbon footprint is the CO2 released per energy unit generated.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.

Sentence: We need to do two things to speed the transition away from fossil fuels.

Sentence: First, we need to use the real leverage we have today with today's technology.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: We can phase out fossil fuel vehicles.

Sentence: Next, we also need to invent new and better technology.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: Without new technologies and innovation, it will be impossible to achieve a zero CO2 emission world, be it from technologies like carbon capture or a new generation of nuclear power plants to new batteries that revolutionize the energy storage from renewables.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: But innovation takes time.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: Years and decades.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: And we don't have this time.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: Every year, we keep adding more carbon to the atmosphere.

Title: Is It Too Late To Stop Climate Change? Well, it's Complicated.
Sentence: This means we can't keep relying on innovation alone.
