Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Deep in tropical jungles, life-floating kingdoms ruled by beautiful and deadly masters.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: They're sort of the high elves of the Ant Kingdoms, talented architects that create carcels and city-states.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: But they are also fierce and expansionist warriors and their kingdoms are in snowed in another ending war for survival, O'ercofflo weaver ants.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: O'ercofflo weavers at warcon long legs have slender bodies and large eyes which make them look pretty cute.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Although their strong mandibles and the ability to shoot acid also make them pretty good at killing, but more on that later.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Their colonies usually have two to three worker classes that vary dramatically in size.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Mages, miners, and sometimes even tiny minimum workers.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Depending on location and species, they vary in colour from dark brown to emerald grain.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Other than their fancy looks, what makes weaver special is that they're in the kingdom building business.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: They like to build at pretty much all heights, starting in shrubs a few centimeters above the ground and up to 10 meters in the tree canopy.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: But they're not satisfied with ruling just one plot.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Weavers will look for twigs or lianas that bridge the gap to other trees and expand to every plant they can reach.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: This way, Coffnes spread upwards and sideways through the tree tops.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The largest weaver and kingdoms we know of occupy up to 1,600 square meters around four basketball courts.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: A lot of ground to cover four tiny ants and impossibly hard to control.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: So weaver ants construct dozens of nests scattered all over their territory, outposts to defend the kingdom.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Chubs or balls made from leaves and ghostly silk sheets.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: These masterpieces of high-end architecture are created by the weaver majors, the larger worker ants, which are responsible for the more dangerous jobs like fighting, foraging, and nest construction.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: To start a new nest, a major tries to bend different leaves in her surroundings into a tube.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: If one of the leaves is flexible enough, more workers will arrive to help.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Chains of workers pull the leafs edges together or reach across gaps and grab distant leaves to add them to the construction.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: While the bending and pulling is going on, other workers carry larvae from the closest nest to the construction site.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Usually ant larvae spin themselves a cocoon to protect themselves, but the weaver ant larvae give all of their silk to the colony as building material.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: So when the workers tap the larvae's heads on the leaf, they release their sticky thread like tiny, cute glue guns.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: This way, the workers sow the bent leaf onto itself so it won't unfold anymore.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: This creates a central chamber that's used as the bases for up to 300 more leaves that are round around it.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Together, they form little pockets and act as additional rooms for the new outpost.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: To make it even more cozy, minor workers use the larvae to weave additional floors and chambers.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Nests are usually constructed as barracks on the territory's borders or a storage for brewed and food supplies.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: This way, the ants don't need to cross vast distances to the headquarters, but have soldiers close to any potential point of conflict.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The part from one special nest in the middle of the network, which is reserved for the queen and her guards.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Here, she produces hundreds of eggs a day which get transferred to suitable nests with brood chambers.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: So a colony is a network of little carcels and motes connected by suspension bridges made from leaves, leanas and twigs.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: An established colony easily has half a million individuals that need to be fed.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Unfortunately, we've an ants evolved to have very close and beneficial relationships with their hosts, shrubs and trees.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The tree gives the ants a home and access to sweet saptedryk, but maybe even more importantly, it allows them to cultivate cattle like aphids or cataceters that produce honeydew for them.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: This would usually hurt a tree, but these insects belong to a small group of VIPs.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Many a few selected neighbors and the ants cattle are allowed on the fruit tree, many other insects and even larger herbivores are scared of, or even killed and eaten.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: So in most cases, the tree only has to tolerate acceptable levels of damage while being protected from more dangerous pests.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The weaver ant kingdom could be an ant paradise if there wasn't competition.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Mostly from other kingdoms, just like medieval humans, every queen seeks to conquer others and make their land their own.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Controlling fertile land is the key to survive in the jungle, and if a kingdom loses too much of it, it shrinks and is overrun or starts to death.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: So expanding and defending their borders is critical to keep the colony alive.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: When a kingdom invade another, it first gathers an army of a few thousand mages who make their way towards the opposing colony.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The goal is to steal a bit of territory and take it over.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Defending weaver patrols quickly spot the invaders and immediately release an alarm ferrimone.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Some rush to the front to defend while others rush to the closest outposts for help marking their route with ferrimones.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Whenever they meet other sisters, they jerk their bodies as if in a fight to signal them to follow the ferrimone trail to the front line.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The site of battle, mages from both parties raise their bodies, circle each other with mandibles wide open and try to seize their opponents.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: If an ant gets a hold of her opponent, the victim is pulled into a group of allied mages and pinned down.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The ants then rip the victim apart, clipping off antennae and legs and slicing open their aftermones.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: To slow down the advance of the attackers, the defending mages squirt formic acid over the battlefield to chemically burn their targets.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: This is soon answered in the same way by the attackers.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: In the chaotic battle, both parties lose countless fighters on the increasingly acidic battlefield.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: After a few minutes, the backup from the outposts arrive and the time window for a successful attack slowly closes.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: This is when the battle turns.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The defenders slowly push back the attack party.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: In the end, the attackers can't keep up and have to retreat.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: For both parties, it was a costly battle.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Thousands of corpses lie piled up on the ground under the battlefield and many ants are severely injured.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The defending colonists' nests and brood are safe, though.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: The attackers attempt to steal new, valuable territory has failed.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: For today, they'll try again soon.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: But the kingdom will be ready.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: For the high ants of the floating kingdoms, war is nothing special, it's just a fact of life.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: Because as we know, empires never ever have enough.

Title: The Warrior Kingdoms of the Weaver Ant
Sentence: And the weaver ants are ready to fight.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Oh, casually watching a video on YouTube on a computer more powerful than anything humanity could build a few decades ago.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: This progress and all the wonderful machines you take for granted are built on a few rare and precious materials with names like Turbium, Neodimium or Tantulum.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Getting these rare materials from the ground into your devices is ugly.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The mining industry is responsible for air and water pollution and the destruction of entire landscapes.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The dangerous chemicals like cyanide, sulfuric acid or chlorine are used to extract the resources, harming, biodiversity, workers and locals and rare resources are also political tools when countries restrict access to them to get their way.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: But what if we could replace the mining industry on Earth with a clean process that can't harm anyone?

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Well, we can.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: All we need to do is look up.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Astroids are millions of trillions of tons of rocks, metals and ice, leftovers from the cloud that became the planet 4.5 billion years ago.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: They can be a smaller diameter or protoplanets the size of entire countries.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Most of them are concentrated in the asteroid belt and the type about while hundreds of thousands more do their own thing between the planet.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: As space travel is becoming more feasible, scientists and economists have begun looking at the resources found in these asteroids.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Even relatively small metallic asteroids may contain trillions worth of industrial and precious metals like platinum.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: And bigger asteroids like 16-cyccy could contain enough iron nickel to cover the world's metal needs for millions of years.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: At current market prices, the rare or materials alone would be worth quadrillions of dollars.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Well, not really, but technically.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: For example, there are more than 20 million tons of gold in the ocean's water worth roughly 750 trillion US dollars, but filtering out the gold would be so expensive that you'd lose money selling it.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Right now, asteroid mining has exactly this problem.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: It's too expensive to replace mining on Earth.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The ends of dollars worth of valuable resources in space are worthless if it costs trillions to get them.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: What makes it so hard?

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The principles behind mining an asteroid are simple.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The basic idea is to choose an asteroid move it to a place where it's easy to process and then take it apart to turn into useful products.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Unfortunately, all of this collides with fundamental problems humans have yet to solve.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Going to space is expensive.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: It costs thousands of dollars in rocket fuel for each kilogram just to reach a low earth orbit.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Going further out into deep space costs thousands more.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: We need cheaper space travel to make asteroid mining profitable.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: One solution is to switch from classical rocket to electric space ships.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: We already use electrical rocket engines for many of the space probes on science missions.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: In principle, we only need to build bigger ones.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: While electrical engines are not powerful enough to fly to space, they require only a tiny amount of fuel to go very far once they're in space.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: This means we don't need to spend a lot of money on fuel only to transport fuel into space.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: This doesn't solve the whole cost problem, but it makes it easier to start our first mission.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Now that we have an electric asteroid mining spaceship, we need to find the right asteroid and get it there.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: We've already successfully visited asteroids with space probes and even collected samples.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Still to make it easier and cheaper, our first targets will probably be near Earth asteroids, asteroids that orbit well, near Earth.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: After a few months of travel, our spaceship finally arrives at our asteroid.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Weirdly formed, littered with small impact craters, it hasn't changed much for billions of years.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The first thing that needs to be done is to secure the asteroid and stop it from spinning.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: There are multiple ways to do this, like vaporizing material with a laser or stopping the rotation with thrusters.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Once we have a stable asteroid, we need to wait.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Orbital mechanics are complicated, but if you push something in the right direction at exactly the right moment, you can move very big things with very little force.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: So we wait for exactly the right moment.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Our ship fires its thrusters and nudges the asteroid into a trajectory that takes it near our moon.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The moon is useful because we can borrow its gravitational pull to put the asteroid in a stable orbit around Earth which saves even more fuel.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Again, the trip takes months.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: But all the time since our ship was launched has not been wasted.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The first space mining and processing equipment has been installed in orbit and is now carefully moving toward the asteroid.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The processor works very differently than on Earth.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Giant mirrors focus sunlight and heat up asteroid rock to boil out the gases.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The giant mirrors break up the dried rocks into gravel and dust and centrifuges separate dense from lightenements.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Even if we only extract 0.01% of the asteroid's mass in precious metals, this is still several times more than you get from the same amount of ore on the ground.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: But what now?

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: How do we get our precious metals safely banked to ground?

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: There are a few ways, like loading it into reusable rockets that return to Earth from space.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Or if our processor contains 3D printers, we can print a faster and cheaper delivery system.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Heat shielded capsules filled with gas bubbles.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: These can just be dropped into the oceans where ships tow them away.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: This could be the starting point of humanity's first real steps towards colonizing the solar system.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: As our infrastructure and experience grows, our missions get more and more sophisticated.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Parts and fuel produced on asteroids don't have to be launched from Earth at all.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: The first mining operation makes the second one easier and so on.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: While the space industry grows and precious materials become cheaper, eventually we could stop mining on Earth.

Title: Unlimited Resources From Space – Asteroid Mining
Sentence: Even the idea of toxic mining down here might become something weird and anacronistic like having an open fire in your living room.

Sentence: Landscapes ravaged by pollution will heal while the technological wonders where used to get cheaper and less toxic to make.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: The observable universe is a big place that's been around for more than 13 billion years.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Up to two trillion galaxies made up of something like 20,000 billion billion stars surround our home galaxy.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: In the Milky Way alone, scientists assume there are some 40 billion earth-like planets in the habitable zone of their stars.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: When we look at these numbers, it's hard to imagine that there is nobody else out there.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: It would change our perception of ourselves forever if we found others.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Just knowing that this vast place is not dead would shift our perspective outwards and could help us get over our irrelevant quarrels.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: But before looking for our new best friends or worst enemies, we have a problem to solve.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: What are we actually looking for?

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: In a universe that big and old, we have to assume that civilizations start millions of years apart from each other and develop in different directions and speeds.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: So not only are we looking over distances of dozens to hundreds of thousands of light years, we're looking for a civilization ranging from cavemen to super advanced.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: So we need a conceptual framework to enable us to think better thoughts that make us able to search better.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Are they universal rules that intelligent species follow?

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Currently our civilization sample size is only one, so we may make incorrect assumptions based solely on ourselves.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Still, better than nothing.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: We know that humans started out with nothing but minds and hands that could build tools.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: We know that humans are curious, competitive, greedy for resources and expansionist.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: The more of these qualities our ancestors had, the more successful they were in the civilization building game.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Being one with nature is nice, but it's not the path to irrigation systems or gunpowder or cities.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: So it's reasonable to assume that aliens are able to take over their home planet also have these qualities.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: And if aliens have to follow the same laws of physics, then there is a measurable metric for progress energy use.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Human progress can be measured very precisely by how much energy we extracted from our environment and how we made it usable to do things.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: We started with muscles until we learned to control fire.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Then we made machines that used kinetic energy from water and wind.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: As our machines got better and our knowledge of materials expanded, we began to harness the concentrated energy from dead plants we dug up from the ground.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: As our energy consumption grew exponentially, so did the abilities of our civilization.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Between 1800 and 2015, population size had increased sevenfold while humanity was consuming 25 times more energy.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: It's likely that this process will continue into the far future.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Based on these facts, scientists nicknamed Kodashev developed a method of categorizing civilizations from cave dwellers to gods ruling over galaxies.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: The Kodashev scale, a method of ranking civilizations by their energy use.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: The scale has been refined and expanded on over the decades, but in general it puts civilizations into four different categories.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: A-type one civilization is able to use the available energy of their home planet.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: A-type 2 civilization is able to use the available energy of their stard and planetary system.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: A-type 3 civilization is able to use the available energy of their galaxy.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: A-type 4 civilization is able to use the available energy of multiple galaxies.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: These levels differ by orders of magnitude.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: It's like comparing an ant colony to a human metropolitan area.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: To ant, we are so complex and powerful, we might as well be gods.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: So to make the scale more useful, we need sub-categories.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: On the low end of the spectrum, there are type 0 to type 1 civilizations.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Anything from hunter-gatherers to something we could achieve in the next few hundred years.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: These might actually be abundant in the Milky Way.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: But a civilization that is not actively transmitting radio signals into space might be as close as our nearest stellar neighbor, the Alpha Centauri system and we would have no way of realizing they exist.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: But even if they transmitted radio signals like we do, it might not be very helpful.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: On an interstellar scale, humanity is practically invisible.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Our signals may extend over an impressive 200 light years, but this is only a tiny fraction of the Milky Way.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: And even if someone were listening, after a few light years, our signals decay into noise, impossible to identify as the source of an intelligent species.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Today, humanity ranks at about level 0.75.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: We have altered our planet.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: We've created huge structures, mind and stripped mountains, removed rainforests and drain swamps.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: We've created rivers and lakes and changed the composition and temperature of the atmosphere.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: If progress continues and we don't make Earth uninhabitable, we will become a full-type one civilization in the next few hundred years.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Any civilization that becomes a type one is bound to look outside because it's likely that it's still curious, competitive, greedy and expansionist.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: The next reasonable step towards transitioning to type 2 is trying to alter and mine other planets and bodies.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: This might start with our post in space, transition to infrastructure and industries near the home planet, move on to colonies and end with terraforming other planets by changing their atmosphere, their rotation or position.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: As a civilization expands and uses more and more staff and space, its energy consumption scales with them.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: So, at some point, they may embark on the largest project to lower type 2 civilization can take on.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Harder seeing the energy of their star by building a Dyson swarm.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Once this mega structure is finished, energy has become practically unlimited for moulding the home system, however they see fit.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: If they are still curious, competitive, greedy and expansionist, and now have complete control over their home system, the stellar infrastructure in place and the energy output of a star, the next frontier moves to other stars light years away.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: For a time 2 civilization, the distance to other stars might feel like the distance between Earth and Pluto does to us today.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Technically, within reach, but only with immense investments in terms of time, ingenuity and resources.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: This begins their transition towards type 3.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: This step is so far beyond us that it becomes hard to imagine what exactly these challenges will look like and how they'll be solved.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Will they be able to find a solution to the vast distances and travel times of hundreds or thousands of years?

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Will they be able to communicate and keep a shared culture and biology between colonies like years apart?

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Or will they split into separate type 2 civilizations?

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Maybe even different species?

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Are there deadly challenges between the stars?

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: So the closer a species gets to type 3, the harder it becomes to further what it might actually look like.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: They might discover new physics, may understand and control dark matter and energy, or be able to travel faster than night.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: We might be unable to grasp their motives, technology and actions.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Humans are the ants, trying to understand the galactic metropolitan area.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: A high type 2 civilization might already consider humanity too primitive to even talk to.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: A type 3 civilization might feel about us like we feel about the bacteria living on the ant hill.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Maybe they wouldn't even consider us conscious or our survival relevant.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: We could only pray that they're nice gods.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: But the scale doesn't necessarily end here.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Some scientists suggest they might be type 4 and type 5 civilizations whose influence stretches over galaxy clusters or super clusters, structures comprising thousands of galaxies and trillions of stars.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Ultimately, there might be a type Omega civilization.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Able to manipulate the entire universe and possibly others.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Type Omega civilizations might be the actual creators of our universe for reasons beyond our comprehension.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Maybe they were just bored.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: As thought as this classification may be, this thought experiment is already telling us interesting things.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: If our ideas about the nature of species that form interstellar civilizations is sort of correct, then we can be pretty sure that there are no civilizations of type 3 and beyond near the Milky Way.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Their influence would have all likely heard be so all encompassing and their technology so far above our own, the week and miss them.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: The galaxies should flash with their activity in thousands of star systems.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: We should be able to see or detect that artifacts or movements between different parts of their empire.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Even if a type 3 civilization did exist in the past and died a mysterious death, we should be able to detect some of the remnants of their empire.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: But when scientists looked, they didn't find remnants of harvested stars, decaying mega structures or scars of great interstellar wars.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: So they're very likely not out there and never were.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: In a sense, this is very sad but also very reassuring.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: It leaves the galaxy to us and others similar to us.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: So the most promising civilizations to look for may be somewhere in the spectrum from type 1.5 to type 2.5.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: They wouldn't be too advanced to understand them and their motives.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: They may have finished their first mega structures and they might be in the process of moving staff between stars and transmitting enormous amounts of information into space by accident or on purpose.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: They would probably also look to the stars and look for others.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Then again, maybe we've got it all wrong.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Maybe progress to type 2 does not mean expanding outwards and humanity is still too immature to imagine otherwise.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: For now, all we really know is that we haven't seen anybody yet, but we've only just started looking.

Title: What Do Alien Civilizations Look Like? The Kardashev Scale
Sentence: Until we find find friendly super aliens and can ask them to explain the rules of the universe to us, most of us have to make do with learning stuff ourselves.

Sentence: Lots and lots of posters to turn your door more room into an inspiring oasis of knowledge.

Sentence: We have new shirts and for the first time 8-codes-cazant to Earth Sweater.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Humans are proud of a lot of things, from particle accelerators to poetry to Pokemon.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: All of them made possible because of something humans value extremely highly, intelligence.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: We think of intelligence as a trait like height or strength, but when we try to define it, things get fuzzy.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: In a nutshell, intelligence is a mechanism to solve problems, especially the problem of staying alive, which involves finding food and shelter, fighting sexual competitors or fleeing from predators.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Intelligence is not a single thing, it includes the ability to gather knowledge, to learn, be creative, form strategies, or engage in critical thinking.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: It manifests itself in a huge variety of behaviours, from hard-wired or instinct-like reactions to different degrees of learning to some sort of awareness.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: But not all scientists agree where it begins or what even should count as intelligence.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: To make this even more complicated, intelligence is also connected to consciousness since awareness is helpful for problem solving.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: But we're exploring consciousness in other videos, so today we'll leave it aside.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Okay, intelligence isn't exactly clear cut, so maybe we can think of it as more like a flexible set of skills, a toolbox.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Basic tools.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: The most basic tools in the intelligence toolbox are the ability to gather information to save it and to use it to learn.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Information about the world is gathered through senses such as vision, sound, smell, touch or taste, and helps us navigate and react to the external world appropriately.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: But living things also need to keep track of the state of their own bodies, monitoring things like hunger and fatigue.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Information is the basis of action for all living things, and without it you're at the mercy of your surroundings, unable to react appropriately or flexibly.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Information is much more powerful if we can keep and save it, so the second tool is memory.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Memory is the ability to save and recall information, so a living being doesn't have to start from scratch every time it perceives something relevant.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Memories can be about events, places and associations, but also behaviours like hunting or foraging methods.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Some of these like flying have to be repeated over and over until they're mastered.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: This is what we call learning.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: The process of putting together a sequence of thoughts or actions.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Basically a string of repeatable behaviours that can be varied and adapted.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: These three tools enable seemingly stupid creatures to act in surprisingly intelligent ways.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: The a cellular slime mold, which is basically just a single huge slimey cell, shows behaviour similar to an animal with a simple brain.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: When putting a maze with food at one end, the slime mold explores its surroundings and marks its path with slime trails, sort of smearing memories on the ground.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: As it continues exploring, it avoids the marked pathways and finds its way to the food.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Instead of blindly getting stuck in dead ends, the slime mold adapts its behaviour to save time and effort.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: This behaviour is hard-wired and scientists can't agree if that's intelligent, although it does give the slime mold a certain advantage.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: These are an example of more adaptive smart behaviour.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Scientists trained bumblebees to move a coloured ball into a gold post for a sugar award.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Not only were the bees very skillful at this behaviour, which isn't natural to them, they got more efficient over time.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: When several balls were available, bees chose the ball that leaked closest to the goal, even if it was a different colour than the ball they were trained with.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: For more challenging problems, we need even more flexibility.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Fancy at all.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Building on the basic tools, more complex animals have a wider range of problems they can solve.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: They can memorize all kinds of associations, connections and mechanical tricks, will call this tool the Library of Knowledge.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Take Recoons.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Their favourite kind of food is human food.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Their approach to getting hold of such treats depends upon an assortment of theoretical and practical skills that makes them master burglars.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: They will to open windows or pick locks.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: In a study, Recoons were given boxes secured with different kinds of locks, like latches, bolts, plugs or pushbars.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: They needed less than 10 attempts to figure out how to open each box.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Even when different locks were put together into increasingly difficult combinations that had to be solved in the right order and with different amounts of strength.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: The year later, the Recoons still remembered how to open the boxes and were as fast as when they had first solved the puzzle.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Beyond our Library of Associations and Skills, the most impressive tool in our box is Creativity, a sort of mental ducts tape.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Being creative means producing something new and valuable from apparently unrelated things.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: In the context of intelligence, this means making new and unusual connections.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Paring input with memories and skills to come up with a unique solution to a problem.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: In another Recoon study, researchers showed the animals that by dropping pebbles into a water tank, they could raise the water level enough to reach a marshmallow floating at the top.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: One Recoon came up with a much better solution.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: It tipped the tub over.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Another facet of Creativity is applying a new resource to a task, physical tools.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Like primates that use sticks to fish for termites in trees, or some octopuses which assemble collected coconut shells around themselves as a sort of portable armor to hide from enemies.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Collecting materials for later use is connected to an even more advanced dimension of problem solving, planning.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Planning means considering the activities required for a desired goal and pushing them together in a plan.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: When unforeseen circumstances and new possibilities present themselves, they need to be assessed according to whether they match the plan or not.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: An example of this intelligent behaviour is hoarding food to eat at later.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: This is an instinctive behaviour in squirrels, but even though hiding food comes instinctively to them, they still need to use advanced thinking skills to make the best decisions.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Squirrels examine every nut and weigh the time and effort it would take to hide it against the benefits they would get from each one.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Damaged or low fat nuts are eaten right away, while nuts that still need to ripen go on the stop bar.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Squirrels also pretend to bury nuts when they feel watched.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: These empty cashes distract rivals from their real treasure.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: This is pretty advanced strategizing because to make a plan to distract someone else, you first have to be aware that there are others like you that want the same things.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: The more complex the problem, the more tools are needed in combination to solve it, so the more tools there are, the more flexibility it being has to solve the challenges life throws at them.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: But even for complex problems, each animal's individual situation is what counts.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Squirrels are omnivores that defend their territories fiercely.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: For them, it makes sense to remember where there's food in different locations and trick their enemies to improve their chances of survival.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Sheep don't have any such refined tricks up their sleeve, but they don't need to.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: They are grazers and live in flocks.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: The skills relevant to them are social.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: They recognize and remember many different sheep and even humans for years.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: A completely different skill.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Evolving and retaining a complex set of mental abilities they might never use would be a waste of resources for them.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Sheepens when the opposite way and invested in an unusually diverse intelligence toolkit, while this was helpful by accident, we added another set of tools on top, culture.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: No single person could ever build a space rocket or particle accelerator.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: But thanks to our ability to work together and to share knowledge across generations, we can overcome challenges beyond any single individual's ability.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: This allowed us to shape the planet to our liking.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: We also created new problems in the process Sudoku, tax forms, string theory, but also rapid climate change and antibiotic resistance.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: To solve these, we'll need to look past short-term survival and think about the distant future.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: We have the toolbox.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: We just need to use it.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: Speaking of tools for learning, we've heard from many teachers that are using our infographic posters in class.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: So we asked what would help them the most and made an education addition for teachers, students and everyone else.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: There's likely larger posters about various things that will expand over time, from a periodic table to a world map or the human body.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: You can get them in our shop and supporters if you want.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: And let us know which post-topics you want for your room or classroom.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: This video was part two of the three part video series relating to big questions of life and the universe, made possible thanks to a grant from the Templeton World Charity Foundation.

Title: What Is Intelligence? Where Does it Begin?
Sentence: You'll find our sources and further reading in the video description.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Since the Industrial Revolution, humans have released over 1.5 trillion tons of carbon dioxide or CO2 into the Earth's atmosphere.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: In the year 2019, we were still pumping out around 37 billion more.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: That's 50% more than the year 2000 and almost three times as much as 50 years ago.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: And it's not just CO2, we're also pumping out growing volumes of other greenhouse gases such as methane and nitrous oxide.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Combining all of our greenhouse gases, we're emitting 51 billion tons of carbon dioxide equivalents each year.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: And emissions keep rising.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: But they need to get down to zero.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: In recent years, the consequences have become more serious and visible.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Almost every year breaks some horrible record.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: We've had more heat waves, the most classier's melting and the lowest amount of ice ever recorded at the North Pole.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Of the last 22 years, 20 have been the hottest on record.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The only way to limit this rapid climate change is to decrease our collective emissions quickly.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: But although all countries agree on this goal in principle, they do not agree who is responsible or who should bear the heaviest load.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The developed countries point at their own efforts to reduce emissions and the fact that the large developing countries on the rise, especially China, are currently releasing much more CO2.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: On the other hand, developing countries argue that emissions by the West are lifestyle emissions while for developing countries they are survival emissions.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Others call rich countries hypocrites that got rich by polluting without restraint and now expect others not to industrialize and stay poor.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: So who is responsible for climate change and CO2 emissions?

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: And regardless of the past, who needs to do the most today?

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: In this video, we'll talk exclusively about nation state.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: We'll look at the fossil fuel industry in another video.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Question 1 of 3, which countries emit the most carbon dioxide today?

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: In 2017, humans emitted about 36 billion tons of CO2.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: More than 50% came from Asia.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: North America and Europe followed with 18% and 17%.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: While Africa, South America and Oceania together only contributed 8%.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: China is by far the world largest a matter with 10 billion tons of CO2 every year or 27% of global emissions.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: It's followed by the USA with 15% and the European Union with around 10%.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Together, this is more than half of the world's CO2 emissions.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: So it's clear that without the willingness and action of these three industrial blocks, humanity will not be able to become carbon neutral and prevent severe climate change.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Next on our list is India at 7%, Russia at 5%, Japan at 3%, and Iran, Saudi Arabia, South Korea and Canada, or just short of 2%.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: But if we only look at the current situation, we're not getting the full picture.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: If we look at emissions throughout history until today, the outlook changes drastically.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The US and the EU both knock China off the top spot.

Sentence: The UK is responsible for 1% of annual global emissions, but takes 5% of the historical responsibility.

Sentence: Germany producing 2% of emissions per year today has contributed almost 6%.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: As much as the whole of Africa and South America combined.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: So the narrative that rapid climate change is ready the responsibility of the developing world is hard to defend if facts matter to you.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: But this is still not the whole story, because focusing on countries mixes two things, population numbers and total emissions.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: If a country has more people in general, its emissions are of course higher.

Sentence: The average human is responsible for around 5 tons of CO2 each year.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: But averages can be misleading.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The countries with the largest CO2 emissions per person are some of the world's major orden gas producers.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: In 2017 Qatar had the highest emissions at a hefty 49 tons per person, followed by Trinidad and Tobago, Kuwait, the United Arab Emirates, Brunei, Varane and Saudi Arabia.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: But those are outliers.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Australians have one of the highest carbon footprints per person, 17 tons a year.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: That's more than triple the global average and slightly more than the average US American and Canadian at 16 tons.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The Germans do a little better at close to 10 tons, but this is still twice the global average.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: China may be the world's largest emitter, but it's also the world's most populous country with over 1.4 billion people, 18.5% of the world population.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Per person, it's above average at 7 tons.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Historically, CO2 emissions have been closely tied to a high standard of living.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Wealth is one of the strongest indicators of our carbon footprint because as we move from Port-Arich, we gain access to electricity, heating, air conditioning, lighting, modern cooking, car's or planes, smartphones, computers and interact with people across the world online.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The enormous rise of China's CO2 emissions is coupled with the greatest reduction of poverty in history.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: If we order CO2 emissions by income, we see that the richest half of countries are responsible for 86% of global emissions and the bottom half for only 14%.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: In just 2.3 days, the average American emits as much as the average Nigerian in a year.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: And not only that, the harsh reality is that it's the countries that contribute least to the problem that stand to lose the most from rapid climate change.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The developing world will be hit the hardest.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The consequences could be food insecurity, conflicts over resources, harsh and more frequent natural disasters, and large climate refugee movements.

Sentence: Many of today's richest countries are in a convenient position.

Sentence: They have become rich over centuries of fossil fuel burning and industrial production.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: They have a large historical footprint and their wealth means they still emit a lot per person.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: But their countries' annual emissions are now dwarfed by other countries because the giant that is China is finally catching up and other giants like India are on their way.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Many Germans, for example, wonder how if Germany only accounts 4% to 20% of year emissions, it can have a meaningful impact on reducing emissions?

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The answer is simple.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: For one, the richest countries have the resources, highly educated workforces and technology to develop low-cost, low-carbon solutions and spread them around the world.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: If we don't want poorer countries to become as fossil fuel dependent as we are, we need low-carbon technology to be cheap and available.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: And we're getting there.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: The cost of renewables is falling quickly and a variety of solutions are on the horizon for many different sectors.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: But it needs to happen much faster.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: If the rich countries of the West decide to seriously tackle rapid climate change, the rest of the world would follow because it has no choice.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Just like when the European Union enforced energy efficiency standards for technology, the rest of the world adopted them too because they wanted to be able to continue trading with the block.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Still, this doesn't absolve others of their responsibility.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: China is the largest CO2-metre today and its China's responsibility to grow in a way that will make it possible to transition to a zero-carbon world in time.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Others acting irresponsibly yesterday is a horrible excuse for repeating the same mistakes today.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Climate change is a global problem and no country alone can fix it.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Working out who's responsible is not as simple as it seems and in a way it's a dark question but one that has played international politics for decades.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: In the end, it's pretty simple.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: Everybody needs to do the best they can and right now we are all not doing that.

Title: Who Is Responsible For Climate Change? – Who Needs To Fix It?
Sentence: But we can begin today.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: The Sun, Smooth and Round and Peaceful, except when it suddenly vomits radiation and plasma in random directions.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: These solar flares and coronal mass ejections or CMEs can hit Earth and have serious consequences for humanity.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: How exactly do they work, how bad could they be, and can we prepare for them?

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: While the Sun seems pretty solid, it's actually like a very hot ocean.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: So hot that it rips atoms into electrons and nuclei all flowing around each other in a plasma.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: This plasma is pushed around and shaped by the Sun's magnetic field, similar to how the Sun's gravitational field reaches out to the planets and shapes their orbits.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: But magnetism is very different from gravity.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: Magnetism is one part of a geophores electromagnetism.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: Electricity creates magnetic fields and magnetic fields create electricity.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: On the Sun, the plasma made of electric-peach-charged protons and electrons creates a magnetic field as they move and this magnetic field then shapes the flow of particles.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: Their star in a dynamic feedback loop called a dynamo which keeps the Sun's magnetic field alive.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: This magnetic field stores enormous amounts of energy and leaks out over the solar system.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: It carrots with it a constant trickle of solar plasma like a light rain known as the solar wind creating a sort of space weather.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: And it isn't always calm and smooth as the Sun's plasma churns and flows around itself its magnetic field gets all kinks and twist it.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: This creates magnetic knots that build up enormous amounts of energy.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: When the magnetic knots break like a tankel of springs exploding outwards the Sun can vomit plasma and other awful things into the solar system.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: These solar storms come in many types like solar flares, a tidal wave of high energy radiation.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: They race through the solar system at the speed of light, sweeping up protons in the solar wind, accelerating them into a high speed solar proton storm.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: Then there are coronal mass ejections which rip millions or billions of tons of plasma from the Sun's atmosphere, catapulting it through the solar system that speeds of up to 9 million kilometers per hour.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: When these monsters hit us, nothing happens on Earth.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: Even smaller storms can damage satellites, affect radio communication, or will be dangerous to astronauts for people on the surface space weather is harmless.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: Earth's atmosphere protects us from the worst effects of a solar flare by absorbing the blast of x-rays high up in the atmosphere well before it reaches the surface.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: The electrified plasma from a CME is deflected by the Earth's magnetic field diverting the energy storm to the north and south poles where energetic particles fall into the atmosphere, causing the atmosphere to glow and creating beautiful auroras.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: As with any sort of weather, most of the time things are fine.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: Sometimes there are hurricanes, though, or in the case of the Sun, solar superstorms.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: And we know that they happen once or twice every century.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: If one were to happen today, we would first detect strong solar flares, a sort of flash before the much more dangerous thunder.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: The thunder is a CME consisting of billions of tons of hot magnetic plasma that crosses the 150 million kilometers between the Sun and Earth in less than a day.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: When it arrives, it causes a shockwave that violently compresses the Earth's magnetic field and transfers energy into the magnetosphere.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: But it can get worse.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: If the magnetic field of the CME is aligned to Earth's in just the right way, the two magnetic fields merge.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: Because the magnetic cloud passes over Earth, it stretches the Earth's field into a long tail.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: Eventually, the energy stored in the tail becomes too much to contain.

Title: Could Solar Storms Destroy Civilization? Solar Flares & Coronal Mass Ejections
Sentence: It snaps and explosively releases its energy towards Earth.
