Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Over the last decade, Milk has become a bit controversial.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Some people say it's a necessary and nutritious food vital for healthy bones.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: But others say it can cause cancer a lead to an early death.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: So, who's right?

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: And why are we drinking it anyway?

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Milk is the basis of every mammal's diet after birth when our digestive system are immature and small.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Basically, it's power food to kick start our bodies and help us grow.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Milk is rich in fat, vitamins, minerals and milk sugar, lactose.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: On top of that, for a while after birth, it also contains antibodies and proteins that protect us from infections and regulate our immune system.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: But it's a lot of effort for mothers to produce.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Eventually, humans stop drinking mother's milk and transition to the diet of their parents.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: This is how it's been for thousands of years.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Until about 11,000 years ago, when our ancestors settled down in the first agricultural communities.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Soon, they domesticated the first dairy animals.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Goat, sheep and cattle.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: They found that dairy animals are able to eat useless and abundant stuff and turn it into nutritious and tasty food.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: This made a huge difference in terms of survival, especially in hard times.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: So, groups that had milk available had an evolutionary advantage.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: And through natural selection, it changed the genes of communities who consumed a lot of it.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: This adaptation has to do with a specialized enzyme lactase.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Babies have a lot of it in their system, so they can break down the milk sugar lactose and digest milk easily.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: But the older we grow, the fewer lactase enzymes are body produces.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Worldwide, about 65% of the population do not have the enzyme after infancy, which means they are not able to digest more than about 150 milliliters each day.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: This lactose intolerance is not spread evenly around the world, though.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: In some East Asian communities, for example, it's up to 90%.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: In Northern Europe and North America, the rates are the lowest overall.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: There are probably a few reasons for this uneven distribution.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: The trait was first introduced by random mutation, which happened independently of each other in a few populations.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: The fact that farming, replaced hunting and gathering more and more, created natural selection pressure.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: People who were able to digest lactose had more food at hand, which was not advantage.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: The migration of dairy farmers to the north, then spread it further, which probably pushed back populations there that didn't have the trait.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Okay, but if milk has been a valuable part of our diet for thousands of years, why is it so controversial?

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: There are a number of claims regarding the negative and positive health effects of milk.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: The negative ones cover a wide variety.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: From brittle bones to cancer and cardiovascular diseases to intolerance and allergies.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: So, how do they hold up?

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Some older studies found a connection between milk and a high risk of breast, colon and prostate cancer.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: But metronalities found no impact on your cancer risk.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: On the contrary, the calcium in milk might even have a protective effect against colon cancer, although this could be calcium in general, it's not clear milk plays a role in this effects.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Only studies on prostate cancer showed an increased risk for people who consumed more than one and a quarter litres of milk a day.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: But again, the association is inconsistent and other studies don't find any effect.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: We discussed these studies in more detail in our sources document.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: All in all, the research seems to show that if you drink between 100 to 250 milliliters of milk per day, cancer is not a concern.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Similarly, metronalities could not find any impact from milk or dairy products on your risk of heart disease, stroke, or your total mortality.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Some studies even suggested that high blood pressure might be rare in people who eat a lot of dairy, although the evidence is not strong enough to claim this with confidence.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: The case gets more complicated, though, when we look at bones.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: A number of studies found neither positive nor negative effects for adults.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: What most people worry most about, though, are harmful amounts of pesticides, antibiotics, or hormones.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: There are hormones in milk, but only in very low concentrations.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: For example, to get the same amount of hormones as from the pill, you'd need to drink about 5,000 litres of milk, and even if you did, most hormones would be destroyed by your digestive system before they could affect you.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Which is the reason why so much medication is coated to protect it from our digestion.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: For pesticides and antibiotics, there are regulations in most parts of the world that only allow completely harmless amounts.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Milk that surpasses these thresholds is not allowed to go on the shelf, so there's nothing in particular to worry about.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Besides, allergies and those suffering from lactose intolerances, the best-known negative effects of milk are probably acne and general discomfort after drinking milk or eating dairy products.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: And here, the effects are very real.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: For example, skimmed milk has been found to statistically increase the rate of acne by 24%.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Anages against milk products are especially prevalent among children, with one in 18 kids in Germany suffering from them.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: In general, these anages tend to get better or disappear as they grow older, though.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Okay, it's milk health, then.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Milk no matter if it comes from mothers, cows, sheep, goats or camels is a nutrient dense food.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: It contains all necessary macro nutrients and many micro nutrients.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Especially in regions where people struggle to get enough calories, milk can contribute to a healthy life and lower child mortality.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: For those living in the developed world, in general milk is not harmful if you are not allergic or intolerant to it.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Especially for children, it's a good way to get large amounts of calcium and four vegetarians.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: It's a good source of vitamin B12 and B vitamins in general.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: This does not mean there are not other alternatives with the same effects.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: You do not need to drink milk to be healthy.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Milk is also definitely not a substitute for water.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Milk is powerful, and the additional calories from drinking a lot of it on a regular basis can contribute to being overweight.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Especially flavored milk or chocolate milk is more comparable to beverages like lemonade than a healthy snack.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: And there's another thing to consider.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Milk production has a significant impact on the global climate.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: About 33% of crop land is used to feed grazing animals, including dairy cattle.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Even though the carbon footprint of dairy products has declined since 1990, dairy production is still responsible for 3% of all greenhouse gas emissions, even more than all aeropains combined.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Milk is a huge industry, and sadly most of its production in factory farms causes incredible suffering.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Cows are impregnated over and over, separated from their young, shortly after birth, and slaughtered once their tortured bodies are not productive anymore.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: We can't ignore that much of the milk we consume stems from an industry that is basically torture and contributes to climate change.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: What about plant-based milk?

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: In terms of protein levels and nutritional value, only soy milk can compare to cow milk.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: The others need to be artificially enriched to reach similar levels of vitamins and calcium.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: So they can be an alternative to milk.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: And another option might be available soon.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Several startups have created non-animal milk that is nutritionally identical to dairy milk, for example through fermentation by gene modified bacteria.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: This lab-dromal can even be turned into cheese, something that plant-based alternatives struggle with, because they lack casin and way protein, the key ingredients that give dairy its taste and structure.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: The environmental impact is a different story, though.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: Many milk alternatives use significantly less energy, land and less water to produce, so they have a much lower environmental impact than animal milk.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: If you want to have the lowest possible negative impact on the planet, the best choice is whatever milk alternative is regional.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: As with almost any topic, milk is complicated.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: It's not harmful for the majority of the population, and it's crucial for many people around the world.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: It's good, nutritious food, but also harmful to the planet and causes a lot of suffering.

Title: Milk. White Poison or Healthy Drink?
Sentence: We need to decide as a society how we want to deal with these facts.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Nothing in the universe is static.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: In the Milky Way, billions of stars orbit the Galactic Centre.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Some like our Sun are pretty consistent, keeping a distance of around 30,000 light-years from the Galactic Centre, completing an orbit every 230 million years.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: This dance is not an orderly ballet, more like a skating rink filled with drunk toddlers.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: This chaos makes the galaxy dangerous.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Our solar neighborhood is constantly changing, with stars moving hundreds of kilometers every second.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Only the vast distances between objects protect us from the dangers out there.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: But we might get unlucky in the future.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: At some point, we can encounter a star going supernova, or a massive object passing by and charring Earth with asteroids.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: If something like this were to happen, we would likely know thousands if not millions of years in advance.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: But we still couldn't do much about it.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Unless we move our whole solar system out of the way.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: To move the solar system, we need a stellar engine, a mega structure used to steer a star through the galaxy.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: It's the kind of thing that might be built by an advance civilization with Dyson's fair level technology that's thinking about their future millions of years ahead of time.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: But how to be possibly move the hundreds of thousands of objects in the solar system?

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: The good news is, we can ignore all of that.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: We only need to move the sun, all the other stuff is glued to it by gravity and will follow it wherever it decides to go.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: There are lots of ideas about what a stellar engine might look like and how it would work.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: We've picked two grounded in our current understanding of physics that could be built in theory.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: The simplest kind of stellar engine is the Skado Thrustor, a giant mirror.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: It works on the same principle as a rocket.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Like rocket fuel, the photons released as solar radiation carry momentum, not a lot, but a base.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: For example, if an astronaut turned on a flashlight in space, it would push them backwards very, very slowly.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: A stellar engine will work a little better than a flashlight because the sun produces a lot of photons.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: The basic idea of the Skado Thrustor is to reflect up to half of the solar radiation to create thrust and slowly push the sun where we wanted to go.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: In order for the Skado Thrustor to work, it must be kept in the same place, not orbiting the sun.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Although the sun's gravity will try to pull it in, it would be supported by radiation pressure which props the mirror up.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: This means the mirror would have to be very light, made of micron thin reflecting foil from materials like aluminium alloys.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: The mirror's shape is important too.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: In developing the sun in a giant spherical shell wouldn't work because that would refocus light back to the sun heating it up and creating all sorts of unpleasant problems.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Instead, we use a parabola which sends most of the photons around the sun and in the same direction which maximizes thrust.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: To prevent accidentally burning all freezing earth with too much or too little sunlight, the only safe place to build a Skado Thrustor is over the sun's poles.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: This means we can only move the sun vertically in the plane of the solar system and one direction in the Milky Way which limits our travel options of it.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: But that is basically it.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: For a civilization capable of building a Dyson sphere, this is a relatively simple endeavor.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Not complicated, just very hard to build.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: At full throttle, the solar system could probably be moved by about 100 light years over 230 million years.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Over a few billion years, it gives us near complete control over the sun's orbit in the galaxy.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: But in the short term, this might not be fast enough to dodge a deadly supernova.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: That's why we thought we could do better.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: So we asked our astrophysicist friend if he could design a faster stellar engine for this video.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: He did and wrote a paper about it that's been published in a peer review journal.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: You can find it in our sources document.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: We're going to call our new stellar engine the Kaplan Thrustor.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: It works a lot like a traditional rocket, the shoot exhaust one way to push yourself the other.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: It's a large space station platform powered by a Dyson sphere that gathers matter from the sun to power nuclear fusion.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: It shoots out a very fast jet of particles that nearly 1% the speed of light out of the solar system.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: A second jet pushes the sun along like a tugboat.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: The Kaplan Thrustor requires a lot of fuel, millions of tons per second.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Together this fuel, our thruster uses very large electromagnetic fields to funnel hydrogen and helium from the solar wind into the engine.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: The solar wind alone doesn't provide enough fuel, though.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: And that's where the Dyson sphere comes in.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Using its power, sunlight can be refocused to the surface of the sun.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: This heats small regions to extreme temperatures, lifting billions of tons of mass off the sun.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: This mass can be collected and separated into hydrogen and helium.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: The helium is burned explosively in thermonuclear fusion reactors.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: A jet of radioactive oxygen at a temperature of nearly a billion degrees is expelled and becomes our primary source of propulsion from our stellar engine.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: To prevent the engine from just crashing into the sun, it needs to balance itself.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: To do this, we accelerate the collected hydrogen with electromagnetic fields using particle accelerators and shoot a jet back at the sun.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: This balances the thruster and transfers the thrust of our engine back to the sun.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: In this little as a billion years, this engine can move the sun by fifty light years, more than enough to dodge a supernova.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: At full throttle, the solar system can be completely redirected in its galactic orbit in ten million years.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: But wait, will we use up the sun this way?

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Fortunately, the sun is so massive that even billions of tons of material will barely scratch the surface.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: In fact, this mega structure will actually extend our sun's life since lower mass stars burn slower, keeping the solar system inhabitable for many more billions of years.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: With a cap and thruster, we could turn the entire solar system into our spaceship.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: For example, by orbiting backwards in the galaxy and colonizing hundreds or thousands of stars as we pass by them.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: It may even be possible to escape the galaxy entirely and expand beyond the Milky Way.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Stella engines are the kind of machines built by civilizations thinking not in terms of years or decades, but eons.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Since we know that our sun will die one day, a Stella engine could allow the far future descendants of humans to travel to other stars without ever having to venture into the terrifying darker bits of interstellar space.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Until we build a Stella engine, wear a drift and subject to the whims of the galactic sea.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: We may not like where it leads us.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Maybe our descendants will set sail and become an interstellar species for millions of years to come.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: This was our last video for the year 1219 of the human era, and what a year it was, so much stuff happened everywhere, to so many different people.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Cananders and holidays are just imaginary, but they help us to cut our lives into pieces that our brains can handle.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: We're leaving 12,19 behind with a weird mixture of disillusion and hope.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: The world is screwed up, but we can fix it.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: In a few days, this year will be over, and we'll get to try again.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: Thank you for watching our videos and for sticking around for so many years.

Title: How to Move the Sun: Stellar Engines
Sentence: See you all in 12, 2020.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: For most of our history, the human population grew slowly, until new discoveries brought us more food and made us live longer.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: In just a hundred years, the human population could root out.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: This led to a pocket-led tick-visions of an overcrowded earth, but the population growth rate actually peaked in the 1960s.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Since then, fertility rates have crashed as countries industrialised and developed.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: The world population is now expected to balance out at around 11 billion by the end of the century.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: But the big picture conceals the details.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Let's look at one region in particular, Sub-Saharan Africa.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: In 2019, it was home to a billion people living in 46 countries.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Although its growth rate has slowed down in the last few decades, it still much higher than in the rest of the world.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: While some projections expect around 2.6 billion people, others reckon without a 5 billion by 2,100.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Such growth would be a huge challenge for any society.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: But Sub-Saharan Africa is also the poorest region on earth.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: So, is Sub-Saharan Africa dood and why do the projections vary by 2.4 billion people?

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: As always, it's complicated.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Sub-Saharan Africa is a made-up idea and in many ways an unhelpful one.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: But Swayna is far away from Sierra Leone as island is from Kazakhstan and they have about as much in common.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: But without generalizing a little bit, this video would be an hour long.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: We've also talked to many different scientists for this video and they disagreed on a lot of things.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Mainly on how much fertility matters to poverty.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: We've done our best to summarize our research and what they told us, but take it with a grain of salt and check out our sources where we discuss this in more detail.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Okay, let's zoom out to the global perspective again.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: A few decades ago, many countries in Asia were at a similar point as Sub-Saharan Africa today.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Large parts of the population were living in extreme poverty and birth rates were very high.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Take Bangladesh.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: In the 1960s, the average woman had seven children in her lifetime.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: 25% of them died before they turned five and of the ones that survived, only one in five would learn to read and write.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Life expectancy was around 45 and per capita income was among the lowest in the world.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: So, beginning in the 1960s, Bangladesh started a family planning program based on three main pillars.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: One, education helped to change women's outlook.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Women with a higher education tend to want fewer kids and become mothers later in life.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Two, better health care lowered child mortality leading to parents wanting fewer children because they could expect them to survive.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Three, field workers brought contraceptives even to the remote esterias which drove contraceptive use from 8% in 1975 to 76% in 2019.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Together, these measures greatly slowed down population growth.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: In 1960, the average Bangladesh she woman had seven kids in 1995, four and in 2019 it was down to two.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: This also changed the country's demographics and the economy.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Before, many children were born but died before they got to contribute to society.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: As far fewer kids die and fewer kids are born, things change.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Kids get an education and turn into productive adults.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: The government was able to shift some of their resources from lowering child mortality to boosting the economy.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: By 2024, Bangladesh is expected to graduate from the category of least developed countries to the status of a developing economy.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Other Asian countries like South Korea, India, Thailand or the Philippines have gone through a similar process often even faster.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Investment in health and education led to lower birth rates which changed the composition of the population and enabled governments to boost the economy.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Why didn't the same thing happen everywhere in Sub-Saharan Africa?

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Africa as a whole has made considerable progress with childhood mortality but especially in Sub-Saharan Africa, education has improved slower than in other parts of the world.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: And one in total contraceptive use has doubled in the region since 1990, the unmet need for modern contraception among adolescents is still at about 60%.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: The reasons for their soil complicated and it's impossible to give a single answer here.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Africa is a big place with diverse cultures and people but there are a few main factors.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Many Sub-Saharan nations have suffered under colonization until only a few decades ago and had rough transition periods towards independence.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: The young nations were often ethnically heterogeneous and lacks unity.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Some areas have been repeated the right by civil wars, military conflicts or suffered under unstable governments which made it really hard to expand infrastructure and health care.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: So Africa had a worse starting point than Asia.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Foreign aid and how it was applied especially during the Cold War is also a contentious issue.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: But this topic is too complex to summarize in a few sentences so we'll make a whole video about it in the future.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: And lastly there are cultural aspects that make talking about family planning in the context of Africa difficult.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Critics say that trying to bring fertility down is an intrusion into culture and tradition but not speaking about an issue will not help solve it.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Not all of these things apply to every country in the region.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: We're talking about 46 countries after all some of them deeply troubled others already flourishing all different and facing unique problems.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: If population growth continues that it's present rate then Sub-Saharan Africa could grow to more than 4 billion people by 2001.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Okay so what can be done?

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Actually a lot especially investment and aid that helped to build systems for education family planning and healthcare.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Surprisingly small changes could have an extreme impact.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: For example if women get a better education and have their first child just two years later in life.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: This tiny gap between this generation and the next one would lead to 400 million fewer people in 2001 with 3.6 billion in total.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: If education and family planning are made available to every African woman universal access to contraception makes having kids a decision.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: If families get to choose how many kids they want both projections fall by 30% to 2.8 billion people.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: This isn't just theory there are already examples that a recent phropomism.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Ethiopia the African country with a second biggest population has made a lot of progress in a relatively short amount of time.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Improving health services led to a drop-in child mortality from 20% to 7% since 1990.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: And up to 30% of the annual budget was invested in education and the number of schools increased 25fold over 2 decades.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: So summarizing there are serious challenges ahead but they are far from unsolvable.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: Sub-Saharan Africa does not need pity or gifts but attention and fair investment.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: It's a region rich in resources, culture and potential.

Title: Overpopulation & Africa
Sentence: If things go right we'll see a turn around similar to the one we've seen across most of Asia in the last 30 years.

Title: An Antidote to Dissatisfaction
Sentence: Everybody is familiar with the feeling that things are not as they should be.

Title: An Antidote to Dissatisfaction
Sentence: The journal is successful enough.

Title: An Antidote to Dissatisfaction
Sentence: Your relationships are not satisfying enough.

Title: An Antidote to Dissatisfaction
Sentence: That you don't have the things you crave.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Getting to space is hard.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Right now it's like going up a mountain on a U-cycle with a backpack full of explosives.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Incredibly slow, you can't transport a lot of stuff and you might die.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: A rocket needs to reach a velocity of about 40,000 kilometres now to escape from Earth.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: To get to that speed, rockets are mostly containers for fuel with a tiny tip of payload.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: This is bad if you want to go to other planet because you need a lot of heavy stuff if you want to survive and maybe even come back.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: So is there a way to get a space with less fuel and more payload?

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: A nice thing that solved most of our transport problems on Earth is what you call infrastructure.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Whether it's roads for cars, ports for ships or rails for trains, we've made it easier to get to places.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: We can apply the same solution to space travel.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Space infrastructure will make getting into orbit and out to the moon, Mars and beyond, easier and cheaper.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Great, but what exactly is space infrastructure?

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Unlike an Earth Space elevator which is currently science fiction, there is a simple yet promising technology that does not require new science.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Magic materials or huge investments and that has been tested successfully in orbit already.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: A cable and a weight, known as a tavern.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The concept is so simple, it's surprising.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: What if we put taverns, hundreds or thousands of kilometres long into space and had space craft to use them as ladders to climb to higher altitude's and gain speed?

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: This concept is known as the Skyhook.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: It works even better if we make it spin.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The counterweight holds a long cable in place while it rotates around a circle.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: A rotating teather slows down its tip relative to the ground at the bottom and speeds it up at the top like a catapult.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: This means that you can transfer energy from the teather and get a massive boost when released, more or less for free, equal to twice the teather's rotation velocity.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The specialised fibers already exist that can survive the extraordinary stresses a skyhook would be faced with.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: To protect against cuts and collisions from debris and meteorites, we can thread our teather into a web of redundant fibers.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Since our skyhook would pass over the same spot many times a day, this would allow small, reusable shuttles to catch up with it.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Of course, it's not that easy.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: At its lowest point, the teather's tip is dashing through the atmosphere at around 12,000 kilometres per hour.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Because of Earth's atmosphere, we can't know the skyhook too much or it will get too hot from air friction.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: So it will dip to a height of 80 to 150 kilometres and no lower.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: To match this, we'll need specialised space craft that can get to the teather.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: While this isn't exactly easy, it's still much cheaper than getting a big tin can, filled with a rocket fuel to go 40,000 kilometres an hour.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Catching the tip will be a challenge too.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: There's only a short time window of 62-90 seconds to find a tiny thing in the sky, moving at Mark 12.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: To make this easier, the tip could have a sort of fishing line, a colloiter long with an navigation drone that helps the spacecraft connect.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Another challenge is keeping our skyhook in orbit.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: As more and more ships latch onto it and pull themselves up, they use up the momentum that keeps it in place.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: If we don't do anything, it will slow down and crash into the atmosphere.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: And here, we can cheat the universe a bit.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The skyhook is a battery of orbital energy.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: It's possible to balance the payloads coming in and being set off.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Arriving ships, bringing humans and materials home to Earth, add energy to the teather, which it can give to other ships departing into space.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: This way the teather doesn't lose any energy.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The more we use it, the cheaper it gets.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: If we're still losing energy with each boost, we can recover it with smaller electric or chemical engines that regularly correct the teather's position.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The set of tevers, one around Earth and one around Mars, could make trips between the planets fast, straight forward and low-cost compared to rockets.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The Earth teather would sit in low Earth orbit to grab people and payloads and fling them off to Mars.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The Mars teather catches them and slows them down for landing on the surface.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: In the opposite direction, the teather could pick up a vehicle travelling through Mars' thin atmosphere at only about 1,000 kilometres an hour, not much faster than our airliner's on Earth and fling it back to Earth to be caught and lower down.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The tevers could shorten trips between both planets from my months down to 5 or even 3 and reduce the scale of the rockets required by between 84 and 96%.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Even better, people may be able to travel in a relative luxury as we could afford to invest in passenger comfort.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Teather travel would be first class seats to Mars.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Together, tevers around Earth and Mars could provide the rapid and cost-efficient transportation backbone that would make space travel affordable.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: But let's go further.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Starting from low Mars orbit, a teather could boost ships to the asteroid belt.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The first craft sent to a new asteroid would need rockets to slow down at its destination.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Subsequent arrivals might find a teather waiting to catch them and send them back for free.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Listening to asteroids cheaply is a major factor in opening up the resources of the solar system.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Pressure metals and valuable minerals could be delivered to Mars just weeks after they were cut out of their asteroid.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: They would be the perfect building blocks for our interplanetary civilization.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: But why stop here?

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Mars moons are very convenient.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: No other moons in the solar system orbit that close to their planet.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The focus is so heavy that we don't need to worry about slowing it down, making it the perfect attachment point for supertellers just under 6,000 kilometers long.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The lower tip would fly just over the surface of Mars and be very easy to catch.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The upper tip can fling ships all the way to Jupiter and Saturn.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: The same supertether can also bring the inner solar system closer.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Venus and Mercury are a single swing away.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Unlike Mars, they're bursting with solar energy and our rich in minerals.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: In the long term, nothing is stopping humanity from constructing a zero-prepetent transport network for the terrestrial planets centered on the Martian moons.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Teather's RA comparably cheap and sustainable solution to making space travel affordable and the rest of the solar system accessible for exploitation and exploration.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Considering that we have the technology to build them today, there's really no good excuse to wait any longer.

Title: 1,000km Cable to the Stars - The Skyhook
Sentence: Parts of the solar system are far away, but they could be very close.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Playing around with nuclear weapons in videos is fun.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: There's a visceral join blowing things up and a horrifying fascination with things like fibrils, shock waves and radiation.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: And while it does help put out a destructive power and perspective, it's not the best way of understanding the real impact of a nuclear explosion.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: This isn't about city stacks of TNT or about how bright an explosion is.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Nuclear weapons are about you.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: So we've partnered with the Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement to explore what would really happen if a nuclear weapon were detonated in a major city today.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Not nuclear war, just one explosion.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: We begin our story in the middle of downtown in a major city.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: People are going to work, studying for exams, a lost in their thoughts and daily lives.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Right here, a nuclear weapon is detonators and time freezes.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The first phase of the explosion happens within less than a second.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: In a millisecond, a ball of plasma hotter than the sun appears and grows in a fireball to more than two kilometers across.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Within this ball, everyone is just gone.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Think of water dripped onto a very hot pan, a sizzle and then there's nothing.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Most buildings, cars, trees, tacky sculptures and people, all evaporated.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: First, the flash and intense tsunami of light washes over the city in an instant.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: If you happen to have your head pointed in the direction of the explosion, it renders you blind for a few hours.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The heat of this light produces a thermal pulse.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: So energetic and hot that it just burns everything as far as 13 kilometers from the destination site.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: What this means is that everything in an area of 500 square kilometers that is able to burn starts burning.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Plastic would fabric, hair, then skin.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: If you happen to be in reach of the thermal pulse, one moment you're in your way to work, the next moment you're on fire.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Now the second phase begins.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: It happens in a few seconds.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Most people will now first notice that something is wrong, but it's already too late for hundreds of thousands.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The flash is followed by the shockwave.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The heat and radiation of the fireball create a bubble of superheated and super compressed air around it that's now expanding explosively.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Faster than the speed of sound, creating winds stronger than hurricanes and tornadoes.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Human infrastructure is no match for its power.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Most major buildings with an a kilometer of the fireball are just ground up down to their base.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Only steel reinforced concrete is able to partially resist the pressure.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: In the surrounding parks where retirees feed the ducks, trees, blackened and smoldering from the heat a second before, snap like toothpicks.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: If you're outside you get tossed away like a grain of dust in a tornado.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The shockwave weakens as it travels outwards, but still about 175 square kilometers of houses collapsed like they're made of cart trapping tens of thousands of people who didn't have any time to react.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Gas stations explode and fires spread throughout the rubble.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: A mushroom cloud made from the remains of the fireball, dust and ash rises kilometers into the sky in the next few minutes and casts a dark shadow over the ruined city.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: This violently pulls in fresh air surrounding the city, destroying more buildings and providing an abundance of oxygen.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: It depends on the city what happens next.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: If there's enough fuel fires may turn into a firestorm that burns the rubble, everybody trapped in it and people trying to flee the devastation.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Up to 21 kilometers from the explosion, people just like you rush to their windows to take pictures of the mushroom cloud unaware that the shockwave is still coming at them about to shatter their windows and create a blizzard of sharp glass.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The third phase begins in the coming hours and days where used to the idea that help will come no matter the disaster.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: This time is different, a nuclear explosion is like every natural disaster at once.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: There are hundreds of thousands or millions of people with serious injuries, nasirations, broken bones, serious burns.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: In the next few minutes and hours, thousands more will die because of these injuries.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Countless people are trapped in collapsed buildings like in earthquakes or blinded by the flash, death from the blast wave and unable to flee through streets impossible with rubble and debris.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Their terrified, confused and don't know what's happened to them or why.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Most likely many hospitals have been leveled along with all the other buildings and most medical professionals are either dead or injured along with everyone else.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The survivors lucky enough to have been in Metro tunnels or standing in the right place to be unburned and unheard won't have truly escaped harm yet, depending on the type of weapon where it explodes and even the weather an awful black rain can begin with radioactive ash and dust descending on the city covering everything and everyone.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The invisible, malicious, silent horror of radiation takes its turn.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Every breath carries poison to the lungs of the survivors.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: O the coming days, the people who receive the highest doses of radiation exposure will die.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: There will be no help, not for hours, or maybe even days.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Civilization doesn't operate when there is a total breakdown of infrastructure.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Roads of blocks, train tracks, walks, runways, cluttered with rubble.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: No water, no electricity, no communication, no stores to replenish supplies from.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Help from surrounding cities will have a hard time entering the disaster zone and even if they can, the radioactive contamination will make it risky to get too close.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: After a nuclear attack, you're on your own.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: So, bit by bit, people emerge from the rubble, on foot, contaminated with radioactive fallout, carrying what little they may have left.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: They are slow, in pain, traumatized, and they all need food, water, and medical treatment fast.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: And the damage done by a nuclear weapon doesn't end when the fires burn out and the smoke clears.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The hospitals in the neighboring cities are under equipped raid disaster of their scale and overwhelmed with tens or hundreds of thousands of patients with serious injuries.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: In the weeks, months and years to come, many of those who survived will succumb to cancers like leukemia.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The reason no government wants you to think about this is because there is no serious humanitarian response possible to a nuclear explosion.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: There's no way to really help the immediate victims of a nuclear attack.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: This is not a hurricane, wild fire or earthquake, or nuclear accident.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: It is all of these things at once, but worse.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: No nation on earth is prepared to deal with it.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: The world has changed in the past few years, with world leaders again explicitly and publicly threatening each other with nuclear weapons.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Many experts think the danger of a nuclear strike is higher than it has been in decades.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Governments tell their citizens that it's good that we have nuclear weapons, but it's bad when anyone else gets them.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: That it's somehow necessary to threaten others with mass destruction to keep us safe.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: But does this make you feel safe?

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: It only takes a small group of people with power to go crazy or rogue, a small misstep or a simple misunderstanding to unleash a catastrophe of unimaginable proportions.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Exploding stuff in videos is fun.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Exploding things in real life not so much.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: There is a solution though.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Eliminating all nuclear weapons and vowing never to build them again.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: In 2017, almost two-thirds of all the world's countries supported by hundreds of civil society organizations and the international red cross and red present movement agreed to prohibit and eliminate nuclear weapons.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: It's not about who has nuclear weapons and who doesn't, the weapons themselves are the problem.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: They are deeply immoral and an existential threat to all of us.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: No matter what country you come from, no matter what political side you find yourself on, we need to demand that they disappear forever.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: This will not happen without pressure.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: If you want to be part of this pressure, there are things you personally can do too.

Title: What if We Nuke a City?
Sentence: Visit notenucest.org to learn more about nuclear weapons and what you can do about them.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: In nearly every corner of the earth, ants wage war against each other.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Their weapons are what nature gave them.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Some have strong armor, deadly stingers, or sharp mandibles.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: And then there's this tiny and not very impressive ant.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: But it rules the biggest empire any ant has ever built.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: A colony spanning continents and fighting wars that leave millions of casualties.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Let's take a look at this unlikely warrior s. Then epithomatically, the Argentine ant.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: This story begins in the flood plains around the Paraná River in South America.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: It's a crowded ant megalopolis where dozens of ant species fight for dominance, including fire ants, army ants, and the rather unimpressive Argentine ant.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: It measures only two to three millimeters in length, and with its small mandibles, it's surprising that it survived among its buff competitors.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Their homes are equally unremarkable.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Their colonies range from fairly small to very large and can be found anywhere.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Under logs, in loose leafletter, or the former colonies of other ants.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Here, Argentine ants prepare their most effective weapon against their competitors, bodies.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Most ants species have only one queen to produce ants, while Argentine ants went all in on numbers.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: For every 120 workers, there's one queen laying up to 60 eggs a day.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: So their colonies grow fast and have millions or billions of individuals.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Teams of queens and workers frequently branch out and found new colonies.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: But this strategy has a downside, as colonies grow and produce a lot of offspring, mutations occur, and new colonies adapt to new environments.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Their DNA slowly changes from generation to generation and differences accumulate.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: So, after a while, the ants that left the colony will become more like a distant cousins and start to compete with their mother colony.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: In their native South American range, this is how Argentine ants behave.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Within their colonies, they are very cooperative and well organised, but they fight vicious wars against other Argentine ant colonies and other ant species.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: With equally strong opponents on every side, the Argentine ants became extremely aggressive, fighting for every inch of ground.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: But it could never dominate its neighbors until humans showed up.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: We did what humans do and transported things around the world by ship.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: On one of them, a few Argentine ant queens hitched a ride as still ways from South America to Medira and New Orleans.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: The Argentine ants suddenly found themselves in a strange world.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Instead of being surrounded by deadly enemies, they found only victims.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Nobody could fight them effectively.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Because only a few Argentine ant queens were introduced to the outside world, the resulting colonies had very low genetic diversity.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: On top of that, the introduced Argentine ants can up to 90% of their queens every year.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Fewer queens, less genetic variation.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: So, as these colonies spread across the landscape, ants that left the colony were no longer considered distant cousins.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: As a result, the new colonies form not opposing, but cooperating parties called Super colonies.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: This is a very uncommon strategy in the Ant Kingdom, only a few of the 16,000 ant species have evolved Super colonies.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: A Super colony was established on the west coast of the USA and became a base for the tiny ants global conquest.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Today, the Argentine ant inhabits the Mediterranean zones of six continents and many islands.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: This one Super colony was especially successful establishing sister locations in California, Europe, Japan, New Zealand and Australia, forming one massive intercontinental megacolony of Argentine ants.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: This makes them the largest society on Earth more numerous than even the human one.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: But their success has changed the ecosystems they invaded.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: California is a perfect example of this.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: In their greed for more territory, the invading Argentine ants have overrun and replaced 90% of the native ant species, including several species of California and Carpenter ants.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Although Carpenter Ant workers are giants, their colonies have only between 3,000 and 6,000 individuals and stand no chance against an expanding Super colony of billions of Argentine ants.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Argentine Ant workers attack by wiping toxic chemicals on their victims, which irritates the enemy and marks them as a target for other Argentine ants.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: When they attack, the Argentine ants wash over their victims, clinging onto their opponents in groups and pulling apart their limbs.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: It doesn't matter how many of them die, there are always more.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Once the colony is overrun and exterminated, the Argentine ants feed on their victims' brood and take over their home and territory.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: The Argentine ants' numbers allow them to hunt down and devour such an excessive mass of different insects that over time some species disappear from the ant's territory completely.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Argentine ants don't care about working with the local flora and fauna, they consume them and move on.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: And if their next stop happens to be human property, they will really make themselves in home there too.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: They forage in dumpsters, bowls of pet food and sleek into kitchens to claim leftovers.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Not just our homes, our gardens and fields are also impacted by Argentine ants since they tend to hoards of aphids as their cattle.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: The aphids feed from plants and produces sweet honeydew, which they trade with the ants for protection.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Since the ants have no major enemy to fear in their new homes, the aphids thrive and ultimately kill the plants they live on.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: So on top of being a major disruption for the ecosystems they invade, they are also a huge pest for agriculture.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: But the rule of the Argentine Ant is being challenged.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Parts of the supercolonies have broken off and become their own empires.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: A merciless civil war has broken out.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: For example, the Lake Hodges' supercolony has been fighting against the very large colony for years in San Diego County.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: A massive war is going on over a dynamic front line stretching over colotis and estimated 30 million ants die here each year.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: On other fronts, an older quaintance from the Paranara river has risen from the shadows.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Red imported fire ants, which were accidentally introduced from their old home to the coast of Alabama.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Not only are the red fire ants fierce fighters and more than able to deal with the Argentine ant, they are also able to form supercolonies themselves.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Now the old wars from their distant home have been taken to a foreign battleground.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: In the southeast in the US, the supercolonies clashed fiercely.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: The Argentine ants found themselves outgunned by the fire ants.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: The fire ants major workers are more than twice the size of the Argentine ants and wield venom injecting steers.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: Even though the Argentine ants fought fiercely, the fire ants were too much for them.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: The cyclist lost battles, the red imported fire ants exterminated the Argentine ants supercolonies from much of the southeast in US.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: This is one territory lost, but the Argentine ants will fight on.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: This amazing network of cooperating supercolonies is the biggest success in their history.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: And they are not given up because of a small defeat.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: They will stand their ground against any enemy that might arise.

Title: The Billion Ant Mega Colony and the Biggest War on Earth
Sentence: No matter if it is on the Paraná River or on one of the large battlefields across the world.
