Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Neutron stars are the densest things that are not black holes.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: In their cores, we might find the most dangerous substance in existence.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Strange matter.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: A bizarre thing, so extreme, that it bends the rules of the universe and could infect and destroy everything it comes into contact with.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Or it could teach us about how the universe began.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Maybe both.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: To understand how extreme strange matter really is, we first need to get a few basics.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: What is a neutron star and how does strange matter break the rules of the universe?

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: To get all of this into one video, we'll grossly over-simplify a few things, but we'll provide you with further reading if you want more details.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: A neutron star is what remains after a very massive star explode in a supernova.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: When this happens, the stars core collapses under its own gravity, with such a strong inward force that it squeezes nuclei and particles together violently.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Electrons are pushed into protons, so they merge and turn into neutrons.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: All the nothing inside of atoms is suddenly completely filled with particles that really don't want to be close to each other, but have no choice.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: They desperately push back against gravity against the collapse.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: If gravity wins, they will become a black hole.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: If they win, they become a neutron star.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: This makes neutron stars like giant atomic nuclei, the size of a city, but holding the mass of our sun.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: And here, things get weird.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: The environment in the core of neutron stars is so extreme that the rules of nuclear physics change.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: And this could lead to a strange and extremely dangerous substance.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: But let's not get ahead of ourselves.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: We first need to know the rules before we learn how they can be broken.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Protons and neutrons, the particles making up the nuclear air atoms, are made up of smaller particles called quarks.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Quarks really don't want to be alone.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: They are what we call confine.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: You can try to separate them, but the harder you pull, the harder they try to pull themselves back together.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: If you use a lot of energy, they just use this energy to create new quarks.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Quarks only exist together as the building blocks of other particles and have never been observed by themselves.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: They come in many types, but only two appear to make stable matter.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: The up and down quarks found in protons and neutrons.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: All other quarks seem to decay away quickly.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: But this may be different inside neutron stars.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: The forces operating in their cores are so extreme that they are actually similar to the universe shortly after the big bang.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Nutron star cores are like fossils, which can let us peer back in time to the beginning of everything.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: So learning how quarks behave inside a neutron star is a way of understanding the very nature of the universe itself.

Sentence: One hypothesis is that inside a neutron star core, protons and neutrons deconfine.

Sentence: All the particles crammed shoulder to shoulder, dissolve and melt into a sort of bath of quarks.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Uncountable numbers of particles become one giant thing made purely from quarks.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Quark matter.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: A star made from this is called a quark star, though from the outside it may not look any different than a regular neutron star.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: Now we can finally talk about the most dangerous substance.

Title: The Most Dangerous Stuff in the Universe - Strange Stars Explained
Sentence: If the pressure inside a quark star is great enough, it may get stranger.

Sentence: Literally.

Sentence: In the cause of neutron stars, some of the quarks may be converted into strange quarks.

Sentence: Strange quarks have bizarre nuclear properties and they are heavier and for the lack of a better word, stronger.

Sentence: If they turn up, they could create strange matter.

Sentence: More stable than any other matter in the universe.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Many of our viewers have asked us a very serious question.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: What if we made a big pile of bombs and exploded every nuclear weapon in the world all at once?

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Strangely enough, we couldn't find a good source to answer this question to our satisfaction.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: So, we gathered together a few scientists to calculate what would happen and find an answer to this extremely important scientific problem once and for all.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Currently there are 15,000 nuclear weapons on Earth.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The US and Russia both have around 7,000 well-franced China, the UK, Pakistan, India, Israel and North Korea, own around 1,000 between them.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: But how much destructive power is this, really?

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Let's try to put these numbers into perspective.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: On Earth, there are about 4,500 cities or urban areas with at least 100,000 inhabitants – some are bigger than others, so we'll assume that on average we need 3 nuclear bombs to complete a Y-Pout one city.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: This means we could destroy every single city on planet Earth without nuclear arsenal, killing more than 3 billion people, roughly half of humanity, in an instant.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: And we'd still have 1,500 nuclear weapons left.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Now that's what an expert would call overkill.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: So we can say with confidence that we have a lot of nuclear weapons and they can do a lot of damage.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: What if we make a huge pile of all 15,000 bombs and pull the trigger?

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Let's drop our nuclear pile in the middle of the Amazon rainforest, just to show nature who's boss.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Our warheads powered up, has it lit into a small warehouse.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: A typical US warhead has the power of 200,000 tons of TNT, so 15,000 warheads would be the equivalent of 3 billion tons of TNT.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: For scale, this is enough to rebuild the whole island of Manhattan with every building in skyscraper using Stax of TNT.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The closest thing we can compare to the energy gathered here is a volcano.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: One of the deadliest volcanic eruptions in recorded history took place in 1883 on the island of Cracatur.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The eruption was so powerful that 70% of the island and the surrounding archipelago was destroyed killing tens of thousands of people.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Its effects were felt around the world for days after the event.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Our nuclear pile contains 15 times the energy of the Cracatur volcanic eruption.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: So let's finally push the button.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: In a second, a fireball 50 kilometers across vaporizes everything in its way and creates a blast wave that flattens 3,000 square kilometers of forest.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Every living thing within 250 kilometers will start to burn.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The explosion will be heard literally around the world as the pressure wave circles the earth tens of times over the next few weeks.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Millions of tons of incinerated material are catapulted into the atmosphere.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The mushroom cloud reaches the outer reaches of the stratosphere pushing up against space itself.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: After things have calmed down, a small crater about 10 kilometers across is left in the centre of the worst world-fised up planet has seen in millennia spreading throughout South America, burning down forests and cities alike.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: And now, the unpleasant part begins.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Extremely radioactive material will kill living things very quickly and a large area several kilometres around the crater is now uninhabitable as is everywhere for hundreds of kilometers downwind.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Much of the fallout is carried high into the atmosphere by the mushroom cloud and carried around the planet.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The amount of radioactive material in the environment doubles worldwide which still isn't civilization ending but we may see more cancer for a while.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The portion of the particles will flow to the edge of space for years and cause a nuclear winter that could lower global temperatures by a few degrees for a few years.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: This explosion was pretty bad if you're in South America and especially Brazil.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The Amazon rainforest is pretty much history which is not great but human life will go on.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: OK, but what we've exposed more nuclear weapons.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Let's suppose humanity decided to mine every bit of uranium on earth and build as many nuclear bombs as possible.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: At current usage, it's estimated that there are around 35 million tons of uranium in earth's crust.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Enough to power human civilization for over 2,000 years or to build millions of nuclear warheads.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: For the sake of argument, let's say we create a pile with the yield of 10 billion Hiroshima bombs which makes up a cube 3 kilometres high that contains roughly the energy of the asteroid impact that ended the age of the dinosaurs 65 million years ago.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Except it's also nuclear.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Our pile explodes in a fireball stretching so high into the sky that it's visible from half of South America with so much power that the ground just splashes like water, forming a crater 100 kilometres across.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Bedrock on the scale of whole mountain ranges is vaporized in an instant while thousands of tons of material is catapulted away with such speed that it's ejected into space.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The ground leaves earth forever while most of it comes raining down as hot, burning debris that heats up the atmosphere to other like temperatures, killing most big animals and causing firestorms all over the world.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The earth's crust rings like a bell struck by global earthquakes stronger than anything in recorded history, decimating cities around the world while hurricane force winds flasin every single tree in South America and wildfires consume the continent.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The abundance of hydrocarbons in the Amazon burn to form ash are cast into the atmosphere, darting the sky and keeping sunlight from reaching the surface, dropping temperatures to near freezing worldwide.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The ensuing global winter may last for decades and results in the extinction of every large animal species, humans included.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: We could also mention that every corner of the planet is covered with radioactive fallout, but at this point it doesn't matter that much anymore.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: This is Humanity's Extinction Event.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The astronauts aboard the International Space Station get to enjoy a great view for a while, but it's not unlikely that the spray of rocks blast into orbit will destroy the station.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Those lucky enough to be in bunkers or in submarines deep below the ocean surface may survive the longest before they exhaust their food supplies and have to venture out for more.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: They'll find the world a chart, freezing, radioactive wasteland.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: The planet itself doesn't care at all.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: It's just a few million years, the wounds of the explosions have healed and life is thriving arguably even more so than when humans are around.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: If intelligent life emerges again, it might be able to work out what happened.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: When they studied geology, they'll find a bizarre and very thin layer of rock covering the entire world enriched in radioactive elements like uranium and the other nasty things it took to case two mixed with rare earth metals and plastics that humans used.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: They would probably be very, very confused.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Videos like this one take well over 1200 hours to finish.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: Over the years, we put more and more effort into research conversations with experts, illustration and animation, sound design and fact checking.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?
Sentence: For this video, we put a lot of extra work into our sources document.

Title: What If We Detonated All Nuclear Bombs at Once?

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Consciousness is perhaps the biggest reddling nature.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Strip to its core meaning.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Consciousness is what allows us to be aware both of our surroundings and of our own in a state.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: But thinking about Consciousness has this habit of taking us around in circles.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: We all intuitively know what consciousness is, it's this.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: It's what you're experiencing here right now.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: But once we try to pinpoint just what exactly it is, it leaves us grasping at thin air.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: And not just us.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Philosophers and scientists struggle to define Consciousness.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Different schools and ideas compete with one another, but no one has come close to figuring it out.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: It's unsettling to realise that we don't understand what makes us aware of ourselves and the world.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: In this fuzzy area, Consciousness and Intelligence are also related, although they are not the same.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: We'll talk in greater depth about theories of Consciousness and Intelligence in other videos.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Like much of what makes us human, our Consciousness is likely to have evolved from less complex forms as a productive evolution by natural selection.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: It has probably emerged from an immense several hundred million year sequence of countless micro steps that together make up a sort of gradient of Consciousness.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: What was the first step on this path from the non-conscious to the basic Consciousness that ultimately led to the convoluted Consciousness we humans enjoy today?

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Take a stone.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: The consensus is that a stone is not conscious, though not everyone agrees even on this.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Some pan-psychists claim that a lump of rock may have an inner life.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: However, there are no real grounds for any such assumption, since stones never show behavior.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Their inner life can neither be proven nor disproven.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: A more common starting point is with the living things.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: A living thing or a self is a part of the universe that sustains itself and makes more of its kind.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: To do so, pitly, energy.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: And this is where an awareness of the world comes in handy.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: The original function of Consciousness was probably to direct a mobile self that was short of energy to a fresh supplier food.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: On the smaller scales of life, you don't need to be aware to find food.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Trico-placks at herons, one of the simplest of all animals, moves around haphazardly.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: It slows down in the presence of food and speeds up in its absence.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: This is highly effective and makes the tiny creature spend more time where there is food than where there is not.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: But it never moves in a particular direction towards a particular target, and there's no need for it to be conscious of its environment.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: The first major step towards Consciousness was probably taken when mobile selves started to move themselves directly.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Moving towards what was good for them, say food, and away from what was less good, say someone else who thought that they were food.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Take Dugusia to Greener, a tiny worm known for its funny face.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Sometimes the worm is hungry and sometimes not.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: This means that when it moves, the worm self is not simply producing an automatic response to an external stimulus, but that it actions depend upon its inner, physiological state, whether it's hungry or satis.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: When it's just eaten, the worm is less energetic, but when staff for a while, it will move itself in the direction of tasty things.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: It uses chemo receptors on its head to smell its environment and guided in the direction where the center food is strongest.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: After finding and eating a meal, our worm buddy heads back to a dark, sheltered spot to digest it in safety, until it's hungry again.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: But animals that blindly follow their sense of smell don't have a concrete objective in view.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: They still lack any sense of where they are heading.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: So the next step on the ladder of Consciousness is to add some perception at a distance, like vision.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Vision adds context and depth to our world.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: With vision comes a sense of the space we and our food exist in.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: It adds a whole new dimension to our awareness and is a huge step towards more familiar consciousness.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: An optical apparatus like an eye enables us to visualize our goal and lock on to it.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: But even at this stage, a self is only able to pursue its food as long as it sees it.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: So the next logical step needs to happen on the inside.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: To visualize food in its absence, for example, a self needs to create some sort of inner representation of the world.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Now an animal can continue looking for food even when it escapes its sensory range.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Because of this inner representation of what is relevant in the world, it can remain focused on its food and its desire to get it.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Our self now exists in a world it can get familiar with.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: The ability to remember things has emerged.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Thanks to memory, animals can be distracted from a pursuit for a few seconds, but quickly continue their path afterwards.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: A related phenomenon is called object permanence.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: This describes our awareness that things continue to exist even when we can't see them.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: This cognitive skill is enjoyed by some mammals and birds, and perhaps other animals too.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Human babies tend to develop this ability around the time they turn eight months, while baby chickens show this ability with an a day or two of being born.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: The capacity to remember a thing in its absence suggests at least a basic sense of time.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: A sense of time is a big step on the ladder of consciousness.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: It may also enable itself to look forward from the present moment and anticipate the future.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Adult chickens, for example, are able to resist a meal put in front of them if they expect to receive a bigger meal as a prize for holding back for a while.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: This sort of delayed gratification means there is an ability to visualize a reward that only exists in the future, which can be quite a challenge even for adult humans.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Western scrubjays are experts in delayed gratification.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: They show an even more elaborate sense of the future when they hide food and a cash to retrieve it at a later date.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: The scrubjays will even re-hide their food if they become aware that a potential thief has been watching them.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: This means that they know that there are other hungry selves out there who are aware and see the world from their own different perspective.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Crafty scrubjays can sort of read the mind of their fellow birds.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: This ability to mind-read is crucial for complex levels of consciousness.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: By putting yourself in the position of others, you can outsmart a rich competitor or empathize with a hungry friend.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Language takes the ability to read minds and represent what is absent to a whole new level.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Words enable us to construct hypotheses about the world, make detailed plans and to communicate them with others.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Words enable us to think about ourselves and our place in the universe.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: And even about our own consciousness, which is something we'll be doing more in future videos.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: So what is the origin of our consciousness?

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: It probably began as the directed motion of a hungry self towards a source of food, with the survival benefits this gave it over competitors that moved at random or not at all.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: It probably all started with the urge for more food.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: So even with the sophisticated consciousness that allows us to dream about space, build skyscrapers or obsess about novels, it's not surprising that we can't stop thinking about where we'll get our next meal.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: Collectively, we've put so much thought and ingenuity into getting food that we can now just get our food to come to us with little conscious effort.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: This video is part one of a three-part video series relating to big questions of life and the universe, made possible by a grant from the Temple and World Charity Foundation.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: You can find our sources and further reading in the video description or get the consciousness book by Rupert Glasgow for free, link down below.

Title: The Origin of Consciousness – How Unaware Things Became Aware
Sentence: If you want to help us make more videos, you can do so on patreon.com or get one of our posters from our shop.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Can you trust Codesk's ARCED videos?

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: To answer this question, we'll first explain how we research them and then talk a bit about past videos and what we want to achieve with the channel.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Making a Codesk's ARCED video always begins with a question or an issue.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: For example, after our meet video, many viewers asked about the health effects of meat on humans.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: We had no idea and were pretty curious too, so we just decided to work on it.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: The first step is research.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: We start by looking for books and scientific papers to get an overview and just read a lot.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: The plan is to find a story worth telling.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Is there something surprising to learn?

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Is there a larger context or a new perspective?

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Or will it be an overview or introduction?

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Once we have the first readable version, we reach out to experts or scientists and ask them to fact check and correct us.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: If enough they find a flaw or pointers in the direction of contradictory research, at this point many scripts die.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: If our idea does hold up, we continue working on this.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: This process can take weeks or months.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Our loneliness script, for example, took over a year and a half to finish.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: The hardest part is being brief, well not simplifying too much.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: It's much easier to write a long script than a short one.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Then we're finally done, we do another round of research and show the script to experts again, ideally, different ones than the ones we talk to at the beginning of the process.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: When we express an opinion, we market as such, that's not saying that we don't draw conclusions from the research.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Homeopathy does not work and meat is ready bad for the planet.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Climate change is real, but organic food is not a good way of solving it.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: If the facts clearly support a conclusion, it's okay to present it as such.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Of course, we can't always make everybody happy.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: People who know a lot about a topic sometimes get annoyed if we don't mention an aspect they think is crucial or when we omit technical terms.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: This is more or less unsolvable because of the nature of our videos.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Strips have around 1,300 words, so there's always some degree of simplification.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: You will always find a list of our research and sources and further reading material in the video description.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Just citing sources doesn't make your work accurate or your research good though, so we encourage you to use our sources document as a starting point to look at the topic yourself and learn more.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: But it would be dishonest to say that we've always worked this way.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: Some order videos don't live up to the standards we set ourselves today.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: The two that annoy us the most are the Refugee and Addiction videos.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?
Sentence: In both of them we didn't try to present a balanced perspective, but instead chose a taken ram with it.

Title: Can You Trust Kurzgesagt Videos?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Everybody feels lonely from time to time.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: When we have no one to sit next to a lunch, when we move to a new city, or when nobody has time for us at the weekend.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: But over the last few decades, this occasional feeling has become chronic for millions.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: In the UK, 60% of 18 to 34 year olds say they often feel lonely.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: In the US, 46% of the entire population feel lonely regularly.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: We are living in the most connected time in human history, and yet an unprecedented number of us feel isolated.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Being lonely and being alone are not the same thing.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: You can be filled with bliss by yourself and hate every second surrounded by friends.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: LoLinus is a purely subjective individual experience.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: If you feel lonely, you are lonely.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: A common stereotype is that loneliness only happens to people who don't know how to talk to people or how to behave around others.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: But population-based studies have shown that social skills make practically no difference for adults when it comes to social connections.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: LoLinus can affect everybody.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Money, fame, power, beauty, social skills, a great personality.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Nothing can protect you against lolliness because it's part of your biology.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: LoLinus is a bodily function like hunger.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Hunger makes you pay attention to your physical needs.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: LoLinus makes you pay attention to your social needs.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Your body cares about your social needs because millions of years ago, it was a great indicator of how likely you were to survive.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Natural selection rewarded our ancestors for collaboration and performing connections with each other.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Our brains grew and became more and more fine-tuned to recognize what others thought and felt and to form and sustain social bonds.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Being social became part of our biology.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: He was born into groups of 50 to 150 people which you usually stayed with for the rest of your life.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Getting enough calories, staying safe and warm or caring for offspring was practically impossible alone.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Being together meant survival, being alone meant death.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: So it was crucial that you got along with others.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: For your ancestors, the most dangerous threat to survival was not being eaten by Lain but not getting the social vibe of your group and being excluded.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: To avoid that, your body came up with social pain.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Pain of this kind is an evolutionary adaptation to rejection.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: A sort of early warning system to make sure you stop behaviour that would isolate you.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Your ancestors who experienced rejection as more painful were more likely to change their behaviour when they got rejected and thus stayed in the tribe while those who did not got kicked out and most likely died.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: That's why rejections hurt and even more so, why loneliness is so painful.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: These mechanisms for keeping us connected worked great for most of our history until humans began building a new world for themselves.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: The loneliness epidemic we see today really only started in the late Renaissance.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Western culture began to focus on the individual.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Intellectuals moved away from the collectivism of the Middle Ages, while the young Protestant theology stressed individual responsibility.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: This trend accelerated during the Industrial Revolution.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: People left their villages and fields to enter factories.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Communities that had existed for hundreds of years began to dissolve while cities grew.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: As our world rapidly became modern, this trend sped up more and more.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Today we move vast distances for new jobs, love and education and leave our social net behind.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: We meet fewer people in person and we meet them less often than in the past.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: In the US, the mean number of close friends dropped from 3 in 1985 to 2 in 2011.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Most people stumbled into chronic loneliness by accident.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: You reach adulthood and become busy with work, university, romance, kids and Netflix.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: There's just not enough time.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: The most convenient and easy thing to sacrifice is time with friends.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Did you wake up one day and realize that you feel isolated?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: The two yearn for close relationships.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: But it's hard to find close connections as adults.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: And so loneliness can become chronic.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: While humans feel pretty great about things like iPhones and spaceships, our bodies and minds are fundamentally the same they were 50,000 years ago.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: We are still biologically fine-tuned to being with each other.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Large scale studies have shown that the stress that comes from chronic loneliness is among the most unhealthy things we can experience as humans.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: It makes you age quicker, it makes cancer deadlier, Alzheimer's advanced faster, your immune system's weaker.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Loneliness is twice as deadly as obesity and as deadly as smoking a pack of cigarettes a day.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: The most dangerous thing about it is that once it becomes chronic, it can become self-sustaining.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Physical and social pain use common mechanisms in your brain.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Both feel like a threat and so social pain lead to immediate and defensive behavior when it's inflicted on you.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: When loneliness becomes chronic, your brain goes into self-preservation mode.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: It starts to see danger and hostility everywhere.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: But that's not all.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Some studies found that when you're lonely your brain is much more receptive and alert to social signals, while at the same time it gets worse at interpreting them correctly.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: You pay more attention to others, but you understand them less.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: The part of your brain that recognizes faces gets out of tune and becomes more likely to categorize neutral faces as hostile, which makes it distrustful of others.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Loneliness makes you assume the worst about others intentions towards you.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Because of this perceived hostile world, you can become more self-centered to protect yourself.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Which can make you appear more cold, unfriendly and socially awkward than you really are.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: If loneliness has become a strong presence in your life, the first thing you can do is to try to recognise the vicious cycle you may be trapped in.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: It usually goes something like this.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: An initial feeling of isolation leads to feelings of tension and sadness, which makes you focus your attention selectively on negative interactions with others.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: This makes your thoughts about yourself and others more negative.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Which then changes your behaviour.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: You begin to avoid social interaction.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Which leads to more feelings of isolation.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: This cycle becomes more severe and harder to escape each time.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Loneliness makes you sit far away from others in class.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Not answer the phone when friends call, decline invitations until the invitation stops.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Each and every one of us has a story about ourselves, and if your story becomes that people exclude you, others pick up on that.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: And so the outside world can become the way you feel about it.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: This is often a slow creeping process that takes years and can end in depression and a mental state that prevents connections even if you yearn for them.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: The first thing you can do to escape is to accept that loneliness is a totally normal feeling and nothing to be ashamed of.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Literally everybody feels lonely at some point in their life, it's a universal human experience.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: You can't eliminate or ignore a feeling until it goes away magically, but you can accept that you feel it and get rid of its cause.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: You can self-exemple what you've focused your attention on and check if you are selectively concentrating on negative things.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Was this interaction with a colleague really negative?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Or was it really neutral or even positive?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: What was the actual content of an interaction?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: What did the other person say?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: And did they say something bad or did you add extra meaning to their words?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Maybe another person was not really reacting negatively, but just short on time.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Then there are your thoughts about the world.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Are you assuming the worst about others intentions?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Do you enter a social situation and have already decided how it will go?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Do you assume others don't want you around?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Are you trying to avoid being hurt and not risking opening up?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: And if so, can you try to give others the benefit of the doubt?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Can you just assume that they're not against you?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Can you risk being open and vulnerable again?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: And lastly, your behaviour.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Are you avoiding opportunities to be around others?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Are you looking for excuses to decline invitations?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Or are you pushing others away preemptively to protect yourself?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Are you acting as if you're getting attacked?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Are you really looking for new connections or have you become complacent with your situation?

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Of course, every person in situation is unique and different and just introspection alone might not be enough.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: If you feel unable to solve your situation by yourself, please try to reach out and get professional help.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: It's not a sign of weakness, but of courage.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: However, we look at loneliness as a purely individual problem that needs solving to create more personal happiness, or as a public health crisis, it is something that deserves more attention.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Humans have built a world that's nothing short of amazing, and yet none of the shiny things we've made is able to satisfy or substitute our fundamental biological need for connection.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: Most animals get what they need from their physical surroundings.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: We get what we need from each other.

Title: Loneliness
Sentence: And we need to build our artificial human world based on that.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Over the last few years, organic food has spread like wildfire.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Despite higher prices, buying organic is turning from an alternative into a moral and social responsibility.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Organic food is supposedly healthier, more natural and more ethical.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: But what do we even mean when we say organic?

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: There's no global consensus, so different regions have different definitions and rules.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: In general, organic food is farmed without GMO seeds, synthetic fertilizers or synthetic pesticides.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Instead, organic farmers use more traditional ways of producing food like crop rotation and use organic fertilizers such as compost or manure.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: While the motivation to buy organic food is clearly noble, is it actually effective or just another costly trend we can skip without feeling guilty?

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Is organic food healthier?

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: One idea associated with organic crops is that their natural cultivation is supposed to make them more nutritious and healthier.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Indeed, several studies found that organic foods contain more antioxidants.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Plants produce them as a sort of homemade pesticide.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Organic plants seem to have to work a little harder while regular plants have plenty of help from humans.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Antioxidants are believed to have some health benefits, although scientists are still on the fence about them in general.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: We have no idea if and how exactly they help us or how much produce you'd have to eat to absorb a certain amount.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: What about organic being more nutritious?

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Well, the evidence is mixed.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Some studies found that organic food can have slightly higher concentrations of vitamin C and omega-3 fatty acids, while others did not find significant differences.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Overall, the mixed evidence suggests that there are only small differences in nutritional value.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: So from the science available so far, it doesn't look like organic food has significant health benefits.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: What we do know is that eating fruit and veggies in general is good for you, and most of us don't do that enough.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Eating veggies is more important for your health than how they were produced.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Is organic food more natural?

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: People don't only buy organic to get extra vitamins, but to avoid something toxic, artificial pesticides and fertilizers.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: And indeed, several studies show that there actually is less pesticide residue on organic produce, but here's where things get complicated.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Less pesticide does not mean none at all.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: While pesticides are supposed to be a last resort in organic farming, they're not forbidden.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Most organic pesticides are natural toxins like vegetables, hot ash soap, sulfur or copper sulfates, but there are synthetic substances as well.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: What's the difference between organic and regular pesticides?

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Not a lot actually.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Organic pesticides are not necessarily safer than conventional ones.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The toxic is toxic, no matter if the substance is manufactured or derived from nature.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: In fact, in the case of copper sulfate, often used on organic apples, the organic pesticide of choice is actually more harmful to humans.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The toxicity of any substance depends on its concentration and your exposure to it, not if it's natural or not.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: There are few recent studies about how our current level of pesticide exposure affects our long-term health.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: A 2018 study from France associated never-eating organic food with a higher risk of certain cancers.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The study was criticized a lot though.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The participants reported their dietary habits themselves, while no actual tests of pesticide levels in their bodies were done.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Complicating things even more, a Danish study from 2018 found that the danger from pesticides from adult was similar to drinking a glass of wine every three months.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The pesticides on your vegetables are nothing to lose sleepover.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Despite this, we should continue to demand strict standards for our food.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: All pesticides are regulated and tested very strictly in the EU and the US.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Every year, thousands of food samples are screened for pesticides.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The majority of samples have no residues or just a fraction of the tolerance level.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Right now, contamination from bacteria and fungi is much more dangerous.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: And on this front, the risk is the same, be it organic or regular food.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Is organic food better for the environment?

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: In 2017, a meta-analysis looked at organic farming in detail and analyzed organic and regular foods from over 700 production sources and their impact on categories like greenhouse gas emissions, energy consumption and land needs.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The result, no production method is clearly better for the environment.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Organic systems use less energy than conventional ones, but have similar greenhouse gas emissions.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Organic farms use less pesticide, but need much more land to produce the same amount of crop.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: These mixed results were also confirmed by a report from the Swedish food agency.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Organic and regular were equal in most regards.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The biggest difference was land use and here conventional farming clearly won and eco-toxicity, where organic farming has a clear advantage.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: So according to these results, conventional farming actually has a little bit less impact on the environment compared to organic.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The bottom line is organic food isn't superior to regular produce as far as we know.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: But organic agriculture also has an impact at a broader level.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Demand is rising constantly, and the struggle to supply the market can lead to production methods that are less sustainable in other ways.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Spain, for example, grows tons of regular and organic vegetables destined for export, in vast greenhouse areas which use a lot of energy and have other environmental impacts such as significantly higher greenhouse gas emissions.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: And because growing demand can't be covered by domestic production, the global trade and organic foods is also increasing.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: As supply chains get more and more complex to make all kinds of foods available in organic quality, ensuring organic quality standards and regulations gets ever more difficult.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: This has led to instances of fraud, where conventional food was labeled and sold as expensive organic produce.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: But organic versus conventional food isn't even an objective discussion.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Organic is not simply a production method for many its ideology, buying organic feels right.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: People want to do the correct thing for the health of their children and the well-being of the planet.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: But our instinct to think of organic as good and conventional as bad can get in the way of making the most reasonable decision.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The solution could be to stop seeing organic and conventional farming as irreconcilable.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: They both have pros and cons and the best way to produce healthy food efficiently would be a combination of their best features.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: And as for your personal shopping, what food you should buy depends on what you expect from it.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: If you simply want to eat healthy, you should buy more frozen veggies of any kind, not necessarily organic.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: If your concern is for the environment, then simply buying organic won't solve this problem for you.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: The easiest option is to buy local food that's in season.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Basically, seasonal is the true organic.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: To sum up, an organic label is a manufacturing notice, not a security certificate or a silver bullet for your diet.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: What you eat is much more important than how it's produced.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: Production is very important for our animations, though.

Title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?
Sentence: We make them with a lot of love and care, and the best thing is, you can learn how to do them.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Rope planets are planets that travel through the universe alone.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: They inhabit the dark and vast space between the stars.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Drifting alone through eternal darkness, no light warms their surfaces, and they're exposed to the freezing cold of outer space.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: They no no seasons, no days, and no nights, which could give away the passing of time.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: And yet, Rope planets might carry alien life to all corners of the galaxy.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: How would that work, and how does a planet become a rogue anyway?

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: There are several very different things that get called rogue planets.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: For example, sub-brown dwarfs, gas giants that form from collapsing gas clouds and are the boring little brothers of brown dwarfs.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: There are sort of failed star, and we'll now start talking about them.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: A far more interesting sort of rogue, are terrestrial planets similar to Earth that got kicked out of their planetary system.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Young star systems are dangerous places where proto planets are battling for the available mass guzelling up as much material as possible.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: In this fight for dominance, they collide with each other or get dangerously close to each other's orbits.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: If a very massive planet moves its orbit closer to the star, it can kick smaller planets out of the system.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: But just because a planet has survived the growing pains of formation doesn't mean it's safe.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Planetary systems can be disrupted by flybys from stars or black holes at any point.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Up to half of all planets born could end up as rogues.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Scientists don't agree on the numbers, but it's like that at the very least there are billions of rope planets in the Milky Way alone.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Most rogues will share the same depressing fate, as their star becomes smaller day by day, the planet's surface quickly cools down to minus 270 degrees Celsius.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: If they have oceans, they'll freeze and become as hard as better.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Their atmospheres will sink down to the surface and eventually freeze too.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: But weirdly enough, some of these frozen dark deserts could harbor life.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: To understand how, let's imagine a planet similar to Earth in the same order of magnitude in terms of mass and composition.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: If we put it into deep space, how could it still support life?

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: As far as we understand the nature of life, there is one indispensable ingredient it needs, liquid water.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Water is important because it mixes things, both matter and energy, which lets interesting chemistry happen, like life.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: So our planet needs enough energy to keep at least a part of our oceans warm enough to sustain liquid water.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Annoyingly, about 99.97% of Earth's energy budget comes from the sun.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: So our imaginary roguer needs to work with the 0.03% of energy it has left, which almost exclusively comes from its hot center.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Earth's inner core is a giant metal ball, about as hot as the surface of the sun that's surrounded by the outer core made up of liquid metals that are very, very slowly solidifying, releasing a lot of heat in the process.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: As long as this process is ongoing, our planet will be geologically active, with solid and liquid material moving around and transporting energy to the surface where it can be harnessed as geothermal energy.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: While the hot core of every planet will cool off eventually, this process takes billions of years, enough time for life to come into existence and thrive.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: There's even one scenario that could allow an Earth-like planet to have oceans that are not frozen over.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: If the planet had an extremely dense and high-pressure hydrogen atmosphere, the gas would not freeze and could trap enough of the heat trying to escape the planet to enable oceans that extend all the way to the surface.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: And there's another possible way to stay warm, moons.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: If a rope planet brings a moon or more along with them, a large enough moon could inject additional energy into the system via tidal forces.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: These forces stretch and squeeze the planet a little bit every day, like needing dough, keeping it warm.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: But the most likely scenario for a rogue bearing life is one with subglacial oceans under a kilometre thick layer of mostly water ice.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: These are not completely absurd, since we already have a few of them in the solar system.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: So how could life sustain itself at the bottom of a completely dark cold ocean?

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: On Earth deep down in our oceans in complete darkness involcanically active areas, there are hydro thermal vents called black smokers.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: They spew out a cloud of black material and hot water, providing a constant flow of minerals from Earth's mantle.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Bacteria feed on the minerals and produce organic materials which attracts crustaceans, bivalves, snails, fish, octopus and tube worms up to two meters long.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Not only are hydro thermal vents home to an incredibly diverse group of living beings, but also a contender for the place where life could have begun on Earth billions of years ago.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: In the dark ocean of a rogue planet, similar vents or volcanic activity could be the starting point and basis for complex ecosystems we can only imagine right now.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: One upside and ecosystem in a rogue planet ocean has is that the environment is extremely stable.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: The thick ice sheet protects it from all sorts of extinction events and as long as the energy from the core keeps on coming things stay pretty much the same.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: The most likely forms of life are bacteria and other microorganisms, but given enough time, more complex alien animals could feed on the smaller beings and thrive.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: It's not impossible that intelligent life could emerge in such an environment.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: If it did, it would find itself in a pretty weird world.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Constricted by an impossible wall of rock hard ice at the top and bedrock at the bottom, without any plants to store star energy, there would be no wood or a law coal.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Even if there were, it's not like you discover fire at the bottom of a notion.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Without this energy, metals may never be forged into useful things.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Our intelligent alien friends might never break through the ice.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: They might never realize that there is such a thing as outside and assumed that their small world is all there is.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Millions of generations might live and die in these dark oceans, ignorant of the unbelievably big universe above the ice.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Until the core of their planet calls off and all life fanciers.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: As the oceans completely freeze, the remnants of cultures and ecosystems will be trapped in an icy grave forever.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: If you think about it, it might be better not to be aware of all that, but the concept is disturbing and exciting.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: The universe might be teeming with life trapped on planets that are basically impossible to leave.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: World like this could frequently pass the solar system without us even knowing.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: Maybe one day, in the far future, humans will set foot on one of these frozen worlds and try to say hello.

Title: Aliens under the Ice – Life on Rogue Planets
Sentence: OK, so we love gloomy future scenarios, but let's go back to the present for a different kind of surprise.

Sentence: Many of you want to know how we make our videos, so we made a video about that.
