Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: When the gods granted King Myders one wish, he wished that everything he touched would turn to gold.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Myders was delighted, trees, rocks, buildings, all gold.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: But soon he found in horror that his food turned into gold as well.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: When he hugged his daughter to soothe his pain, he realized his mistake too late.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: The richest man in existence was starving, heartbroken and alone.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Humanity got a similar wish granted when we learned how to turn brown stinky goo into magic.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Plastic.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Cheap, sterile and convenient, it changed our lives.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: But this wonder of technology got it out of hand.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Plastic has saturated our environment.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: It has invaded the animals we eat and now it's finding its way into our bodies.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: What is plastic?

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: The most of our history, humans used stuff we found in nature to build the things we needed, but the invention of plastic roughly 100 years ago completely changed our world.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Plastic is made from polymers, long repeating chains of monochil groups.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: In nature polymers exist everywhere.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: The walls of cells, silk, hair, insect carapaces, DNA.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: But it's also possible to create them.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: By breaking down crude oil into its components and rearranging them, we can form new synthetic polymers.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Sympathetic polymers have extraordinary traits.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: They are lightweight, durable, and can be molded into almost any shape.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Not requiring time consuming manual work, plastic can be easily mass produced, and its raw materials are available in vast amounts and incredibly cheaply.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: And so the golden era of plastics began.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Baker Light was used for mechanical parts, PVC for plumbing, electric gears and cases.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: A acrylic has a shatter-resistant alternative to glass and nylon for stockings and war equipment.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Today almost everything is at least partly made from plastic, our clothes, phones, computers, furniture, appliances, houses and cars.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Plastic has long ceased to be a revolutionary material instead it became trash.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Coffee cups, plastic bags, or stuff to wrap a banana.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: We don't think about this fact a lot, plastic just appears and goes away.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Unfortunately, it doesn't.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Since synthetic polymers are so durable, plastic takes between 500 and 1000 years to break down.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: But somehow, we collectively decided to use this super-tuff material for things meant to be thrown away.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: 40% of plastics are used for packaging.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: In the US, packaging makes up one third of all the waste that is generated annually.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Since its invention, we have produced about 8.3 billion metric tons of plastic, 335 million tons in 2016 alone.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: More than 6.3 billion metric tons of plastic have become waste since 1907.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Piled up in one place, that makes a cute with a side length of 1.9 kilometres.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: So what do we do with all this waste?

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: 9% was recycled.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: 12% burned.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: But 79% of it is sticking around still.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: A lot ends up in the ocean around 8 million tons a year.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: That's so much plastic that it will outweigh all the fish in the ocean by 2050.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Because it's everywhere, the marine animals keep getting trapped in plastic and swirling it.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: In 2015 already 90% of sea birds had eaten plastic.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Many animals starve with stomachs full of indigestible trash.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: In 2018, a dead sperm whale washed up in Spain.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: He had eaten 32 kilos of plastic bags, nets, and a drum.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: While this is tragic, it makes for great magazine covers, there's an even more widespread, invisible form of plastic.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Microplastics.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Microplastics are pieces smaller than 5 mm.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Some of them are used in cosmetic or toothpaste, but most result from floating waste that is constantly exposed to UV radiation and crumbles into smaller and smaller pieces.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: 51 trillion such particles floating the ocean where they are even more easily swallowed by all kinds of marine life.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: This has raised concerns among scientists, especially about health risks from the chemicals that are added to plastic.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: BPA, for example, makes plastic bottles transparent, but there's also evidence that it interferes with our hormonal system.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: D-E-H-P makes plastics more flexible, but may cause cancer.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: It would be pretty bad if microplastics are toxic because they travel up the food chain.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Though a plankton eat microplastic, small fish eat zoo plankton.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: So do oysters, crabs, and predatory fish, and they all land on our plate.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Microplastics have been found in honey, in sea salt, in beer, in tap water, and in the household dust around us.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: 8 out of 10 babies and nearly all adults have measurable amounts of fulates, a common plastic additive in their bodies, and 93% of people have BPA in their urine.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: There is little science about this so far and right now it's inconclusive.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: We need a lot more research before panic is justified, but it is safe to say that a lot of stuff happened that we didn't plan for, and we have lost control over plastic to a certain extent, which is kind of scary.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: But just to make sure we should simply ban plastics right?

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Unfortunately, it's a bit more complicated than that.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Plastic pollution is not the only environmental challenge we face.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Some of the substitutes we'd use for plastic have a higher environmental impact in other ways.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: For example, according to a recent study by the Danish government, making a single use plastic bag requires so little energy, and produces far lower carbon dioxide emissions compared to a reusable cotton bag that you need to use your cotton bag 7,100 times, before it would have a lower impact on the environment than the plastic bag.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: We're left with a complex process of trade-offs, everything has an impact somehow, and it's hard to find the right balance between them.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Plastic also helps solve problems that we don't have very good answers for at the moment.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Globally, one third of all food that's produced is never eaten and ends up rotting away on landfills, where it produces methane, and the best way of preventing food from spoiling and avoiding unnecessary waste is still plastic packaging.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: It's also important to know whether vast majority of the world's plastic pollution is coming from right now.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: 90% of all plastic waste entering the ocean through rivers comes from just 10 rivers in Asia and Africa.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: The Yanksi in China alone plushes 1.5 million tons of plastic into the ocean each year.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Countries like China, India, Algeria or Indonesia industrialised at an impressive pace in the last few decades, transforming the lives of billions of people.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: This development was so fast that the garbage disposal infrastructure couldn't keep up with collecting and recycling all the new waste this brought.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: If politicians in Europe and the US want to address this issue, investing in infrastructure and developing countries is just as important as fighting plastic pollution at home with campaigns and redesigning products to minimize unnecessary plastic production.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: The bottom line is, as long as we don't address plastic pollution from a global perspective, we will not solve it.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Plastic pollution is a complicated problem.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: We found a magic material and we had a really good time with it, but we need to be careful or just like Midas will end up in a world that we didn't wish for.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Your individual daily actions still have a huge impact.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: What you do matters.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Refuse disposable plastics, convince your friends and family to do the same.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Pressure companies and politicians to take the necessary steps to keep our oceans clean and our food safe.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: Together, we can beat plastic pollution.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: This video was a collaboration with UN Environment and their Cleansees campaign.

Title: Plastic Pollution: How Humans are Turning the World into Plastic
Sentence: If you want to take action to turn the tide on plastics, go to cleansees.org and make your pledge.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: All around the world, Marijuana is being decriminalised or even made legal, but is this really a good idea.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: In the online debate, the harmful sites are often downpied, so let's look at the three most powerful arguments against legalizing Marijuana.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: The argument number one.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: In the last few decades, Marijuana has been engineered to become much more potent.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Today, Marijuana is so potent that it's actually a strong drug that may cause psychosis.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: The main active ingredient of Marijuana is THC, and there's strong evidence that THC is related to psychosis, regardless of other risk factors.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Marijuana also contains a substance called CBD that seems to counteract vis-a-fax.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: It's even being tested as a treatment against psychosis and anxiety, but because it doesn't make you high, growers have gradually decreased the amount of CBD in Marijuana over the last few decades, while increasing THC levels.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Sample testing showed that THC levels have risen from around 4% in the 1990s, to nearly 12% in 2014, shifting the ratio of THC to CBD from 1 to 14 in 1995 to about 1 to 80 in 2014.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: It's unclear how precise those tests were, however.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Overall, recent findings suggest that the more Marijuana you consume and the stronger it is, the higher your risk of developing psychosis.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: But how high is the risk of psychosis for the general population?

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: A study from Britain found that while Marijuana used has risen significantly between 1996 and 2005, the number of schizophrenia cases at type of psychosis remained stable.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: The risk of Marijuana induced psychosis remains the highest for people who already have a high risk of psychosis to begin with.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: For them, it seems more likely that Marijuana speeds up the development of their condition rather than causing it, as far as we know right now.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: So the reasoning goes, if fewer people have access to Marijuana, the lower the risk of Marijuana induced psychosis.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: But actually, you could argue that precisely because Marijuana is illegal, more people will end up with psychosis.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Prohibition makes illegal drug stronger and more potent because this way you can ship more product in a smaller space and sell it at a greater profit.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: This is what happened during the prohibition of alcohol in the US where hard liquor became the norm.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: And the same is happening with Marijuana now.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Imagine a world where liquor is the only alcohol available.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: You have the choice of either not drinking at all or getting much stronger than you would like to.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: This is the situation for many Marijuana smokers today.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: People didn't stop drinking during prohibition and the numbers show that laws don't deter people from using Marijuana.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: We can't make Marijuana go away but we can make it safer.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: If Marijuana were legal, there would be more options for consumers and regulators could, for example, insist on a high level of CBD.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Just like most people don't drink an after-work bottle of vodka, many people would gladly consume the after-work beer version of Marijuana.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: argument 2 Marijuana is a gateway drug.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: If it's legalized, there will be a spike in the use of much more dangerous drugs.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: A 2015 study found that about 45% of lifelong marijuana users took some other illegal drug at some point.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Legalizing Marijuana could reinforce this trend.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: As more young people try legal Marijuana, they might end up trying harder drugs.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: But it turns out that the real gateway drug use comes much earlier, cigarettes.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: One study showed that teens who started smoking before the age of 15 were 80% more likely to use illegal drugs than those who didn't.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: And a 2007 study found that teenagers between 12 and 17 who smoked were three times more likely to binge drink.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Seven times more likely to have used drugs like heroin or cocaine, and were also seven times more likely to resort to Marijuana.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: But if that's the case, how could making more drugs legal stop the use of hard drugs?

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: At first, it's important to acknowledge that people don't use drugs because they're legal or not.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: If you want to buy any drug, you'll always find someone happy to sell.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: The real question is why do people develop an unhealthy relationship with drugs at all?

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Studies show that certain conditions make people especially vulnerable to drugs and addiction.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: A difficult childhood, early trauma, low social status, depression, even genetic factors.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Which drug they get addicted to is more often than not a matter of chance.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Addics take drugs to escape their problems, but drugs don't solve any of those problems and instead become a new problem.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: But punishing people for their unhealthy coping mechanisms doesn't change anything about the underlying causes either.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: So some argue we need to take a completely different route.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: In 2001, Portugal had one of the worst drug problems in Europe, so it was desperate enough to try something radical.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Possession and use of all the legal drugs was de-criminalized.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: You would no longer be arrested instead authorities launched a major health campaign.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: People who were found with a small amount were referred to support services and got help with treatment and harm reduction.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Drug use was seen as a chronic disease, not a crime.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: The results were stunning.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: The number of people who tried drugs and kept using them fell from 44% to 28% by 2012.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: The use of hard drugs decreased as well as HIV and hepatitis infections and overdoses.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Making drugs legal might overall help society much more than it harms it.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Argument number 3.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Marijuana is addictive and unhealthy.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: It needs to remain illegal to keep harm at a minimum.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: While marijuana addiction is more psychological than physical, it is still a real problem.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: The demand for treatment for marijuana addiction has more than doubled in the past decade alone.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: In total, about 10% of people who try marijuana will become addicted.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: This is also related to higher THC levels.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: A study released in 2017 tracked the potency of marijuana in Dutch coffee shops over a period of 16 years.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: For every 1% increase in THC, 60 more people enter treatment nationwide.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: In terms of negative health effects, some studies linked marijuana used to increase blood pressure and lung problems.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: While a 2016 study found that marijuana use was unrelated to physical health problems, except for a higher risk of gum disease.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Some studies showed that marijuana use altered teenagers' brains and decreases their intelligence, but when more recent studies took drinking and smoking it to account, the results were inconclusive.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Overall, research shows that taking any drugs while the brain is still in development is bad for you.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: But the truth is we don't know yet how unhealthy marijuana is.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: We need more funding for research, which is hard to get while marijuana remains illegal.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: We can put what we know into perspective, though.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: 16% of people who consume alcohol become alcoholics and 32% of people who try cigarettes become smokers.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: We know for sure alcohol affects your brain, destroys your liver and causes cancer, while tobacco clogs your arteries destroys your lungs and also causes cancer.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: 3.3 million people die from alcohol abuse each year while smoking kills more than 6 million people.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Nobody is suggesting tobacco and alcohol are harmless just because they're legal.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Also, nobody is seriously proposing to prohibit them even though they are extremely dangerous.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Legality is a way to exercise some control over them, especially when it comes to protecting young people.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: It's often much harder to buy legal drugs for teenagers than to buy illegal ones.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Official sellers can get hefty fines and lose their license if they sell to underage kids.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Legality creates incentives here that drug dealers can't exploit.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: So making marijuana legal doesn't mean endorsing it.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: It means taking responsibility for the risks it poses.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: It could also open the floodgates to tons of new research that shows us how harmful it really is and to whom.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Conclusion.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Marijuana is a drug and just like any other drug, it has negative consequences for a sizable portion of the people who use it.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: It is not harmless.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: The best way to protect society from its negative consequences seems to be legalization and regulation.

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed

Title: 3 Arguments Why Marijuana Should Stay Illegal Reviewed
Sentence: Check it out and subscribe to Practish Your German Skills.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: A war has been raging for billions of years, killing trillions every single day, while we don't even notice.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: The war is fought by the single deadliest entity on our planet, the bacteria-fage, or phage for short.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: A phage is a virus, not quite alive, not quite dead.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Also, they look as if someone made them up.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Their head is an icosahedron, a sort of dice with 20 faces and 30 edges.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: It contains the genetic material of the virus, and often sits on a long tail that has led like fibres.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: There are more fages on earth than every other organism combined, including bacteria.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: And they are probably everywhere living things exist.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Billions are on your hands, in your intestines, and your eyelids right now.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Which might make you nervous since fages are responsible for the majority of deaths on earth.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: But you're lucky.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: While they do commit genocide for breakfast, they only kill bacteria.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Up to 40% of all bacteria in the oceans are killed by them every single day.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: But fages also have major flaws, like any other virus, fages need a host to survive and we could use.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: They're not much more than genetic material in a hole, and they specialize.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Usually, a phage has chosen one specific bacteria, and maybe some of its very close relatives.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: These are its prey.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Imagine a phage as like a cruise missile that only hunts and kills members of one very unlucky family.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: When a phage finds its victim, it connects its tail fibers with receptors and uses a sort of syringe to puncture surface.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: In a weird motion, the phage squeezes its tail and injects its genetic information.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Within minutes, the bacteria is taken over.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: It's now forced to manufacture all the parts of new fages.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: They only stop when the bacteria is filled up with brand new fages.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: In the final step, they produce an endolyson, a powerful enzyme that punches a hole in the bacteria.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: The pressure is so high that the bacteria sort of vomit out all of its incites and dies.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: New fages are released and begin the cycle of new.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: In the last few years, bacteria fages have enjoyed the attention of the second devdius beings on earth, humans.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Recently, we've started looking into injecting millions of them into our bodies, because we're sort of getting desperate.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: We screwed up.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: In the past, a single cart or a sip from the wrong puddle could kill you.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: The bacteria were our fages, tiny monsters that hunted us mercilessly.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: But then, about 100 years ago, we found a solution in nature.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: By accident, we found fungi that produced a compound that killed bacteria antibiotics.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Suddenly, we had a powerful superweapon.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Antibiotics were set effective that we stopped thinking of bacteria as monsters.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Only the old and weakest among us were killed by them.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: We used antibiotics more and more for less and less serious causes.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: We lost respect for the monsters and the weapon.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: But bacteria are living things that evolve, and one by one, they started to become immune against our evidence.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: This continued until we had created what are called superbox.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Bacteria immune to almost everything we have.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: This immunity is spreading across the world as we speak.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: By 2050, superbox could kill more humans a year than cancer.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: The days when a cart or bladder infection or a cough could kill you or your loved ones are coming back.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: In the US alone, more than 23,000 people die from resistant bacteria each year.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: But it turns out that fages, our tiny killer virus robots, could save us.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: We could inject them into our bodies to help cure infections.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Hold on, how can injecting millions of viruses into an infection be a good idea?

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Fages are very, very specialized killers of bacteria.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: So specialized in fact, that humans are completely immune to them.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: We are too different.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: We encounter billions of fages every day and we just pollide the ignore each other.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Antibiotics are like carpet bombing, killing everything even the good bacteria in our intestines that we don't want to harm.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Fages are like guided missiles that only attack what they're supposed to.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Wait a minute, if we use fages to kill bacteria, we're bacteria developed ways of defending themselves.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Well, it's more complex than that.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Fages evolve too.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: There has been an arms race between their man bacteria for billions of years and so far, they're doing great.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: This makes fages smart weapons that are constantly getting better at killing.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: But even if bacteria were to become immune against our fage, we still might be able to win.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: We might be able to trap them in a catch 22.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: This has already been successfully tested with a patient who had no other hope left.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: They are naturally resistant to most antibiotics and can even survive in alcoholic hand gel.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: After years of suffering, a few thousand fages were directly inserted into his chest cavity together with antibiotics the bacteria were immune to.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: After a few weeks, the infections had completely disappeared.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: Unfortunately, this treatment is still experimental, and far more companies are still reluctant to invest the necessary billions in a treatment that has no official approval yet.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: But things are finally changing.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage
Sentence: And we better get used to it because the era in which antibiotics have been our superweapon is drawing to a close.

Title: The Deadliest Being on Planet Earth – The Bacteriophage

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Black holes are the largest collections of pure violent energy in the universe.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: If you come to close, they'll devour you and add your energy to their collection.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: And so, the energy is lost to us forever.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Or is it?

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: It turns out there's a universe cheat coat, a way of powering civilizations until the very death of everything, or of constructing the largest bomb in the universe.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: But how?

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Didn't we learn that all energy is trapped forever in Black holes, even like this is true?

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Everything you think you know about the weirdest thing in the universe is about to get where to, for one simple reason, Black holes are spinning.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Why Black holes spin?

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: When ready, really massive stars die, their coat collapse under their own gravity into their holes.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: This means something very big becomes very, very tiny, like the tiniest anything can be in this universe.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: But stars are rotating and a fundamental property of our universe is that things that are spinning don't want to stop spinning.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: We call this angular momentum.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: And this angular momentum can't go away.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: A big thing that spins and becomes smaller spins faster.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: So, as the core of a star collapses, its momentum makes it spin faster and faster and faster until it collapses into a black hole.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: And the black hole keeps on spinning, inconceivably fast.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Some of them spin millions of times a second.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Why spinning black holes are special?

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Just like non-spinning black holes, spinning black holes have an event horizon and a singularity at their core where all of their mess is concentrated.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The singularity is usually described as a single, infinitely small point with no surface area.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: But points can't rotate, so a rotating singularity can't be a point.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Instead, it's a ringularity.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: A ringularity is a ring with a thickness of zero and no surface, spinning extremely fast, maintaining all the mass of the black hole.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The black hole is spinning so fast that it morphs space and time itself.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: It literally drag space with it, such as its power.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: This creates a new and super weird region of space time.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The Urgosphere, which envelopes the black hole.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: If space and time are completely broken inside the event horizon, then there only half broken inside the Urgosphere.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Inside the Urgosphere nothing makes sense.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: It's possible to enter it and then leave it again, but it's probably not a great experience.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: You can imagine it like this.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Falling into a static black hole is like sliding down a hole.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Being inside the Urgosphere of a spinning black hole is like sparling down a deadly drain.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The black hole transfers its own kinetic energy in the form of rotation to everything that enters the Urgosphere.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The regularity makes you dance whether you want to or not.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: You need to move faster than the speed of light's just to stand still here, which is impossible.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: But here's our cheat code.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: We can steal this energy and there's a lot of energy to steal.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: How to steal energy from a monster.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Take the supermassive black hole at the center of the Milky Way.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: We could steal as much energy from it as every single star in the Milky Way emits in a billion years combined.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The easiest way to steal this energy is of enough to drop something into the black hole.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: We've seen that the ringinarity forces energy on us when we enter the Urgosphere, which is a lot like being in a whirlpool with space time rushing around and around.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: If you're clever, you can use the water to your advantage and swim faster than before.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: In practice, this means sending a rocket into the Urgosphere and making a trade with the black hole.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: We give it some mass energy and it gives us some of its rotational energy.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: But it's not a fair trade, we get the better deal.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Normally, if you fire a rocket, you exchange chemical energy for kinetic energy.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: This is like pushing yourself forward in a swimming pool.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: But if you fire a rocket inside the Urgosphere, it's like pushing yourself forward in a wave pool.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The rotational energy of the waves gives you a much stronger boost than you could get just by pushing yourself.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The boost from the rotation of the black hole is so big that you leave the Urgosphere with much more energy than you instate.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The black hole gives a tiny amount of its rotational energy to you and slows down a little.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Obviously this requires a lot of food.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Fortunately, black holes aren't picky eaters.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The advanced future civilization would probably harvest asteroids to drop them into the black hole when they need an energy boost.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: But there's an even better way to get energy from a black hole and oddly enough, it builds the biggest bomb any living thing could ever hope to build.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The black hole bomb.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: We only need two things to build a black hole bomb, a fast spinning black hole and a big mirror.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The mirror has to completely envelop the black hole, which is similar to a dyesonsphere, a megastructure that harvest the energy of an entire star.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Although our mirror would be easier to build, mirrors are simpler and black holes are much more compact than stars.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: If we made the mirror 10 centimeters thick, the metal of a big asteroid would probably be enough material for a black hole with a massive arson.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Once our mirror is in place, we only need to over-window and shoot electromagnetic waves of the black hole.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: You can imagine what happens next by imagining tossing a ball at a wall and it's coming back faster than a buddhist.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The waves hit the black hole at night speed.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: A small proportion of the waves falls past the event horizon to disappear forever.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: But a much larger amount sloshes through the ogresphere where the black hole forces some of its rotational energy on them and amplifies them.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: They now begin super-rayian scattering, which are fancy science words meaning bouncing around between mirror and black hole and getting stronger.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Every time they go around, they are getting exponentially stronger.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: By opening some windows in the mirror, we can extract the energy from the waves as fast as they grow, which we could use in theory to create what would be for all practical purposes and endless source of energy for trillions of years.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Or, we could blow it up.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: If the waves are not released, they will continue to get stronger and stronger and take more and more energy from the black hole until the mirror shatters.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: A super-massive black hole would release as much energy as a supernova making the bomb the lightest explosion any living being could ever create.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The last home in a dying universe.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: The beauty of the black hole bomb, the pen rose process and the super-radian scattering, is that they are not science fiction.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: In the far-far future, this might be the only way to survive in our dying universe.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: After all the red dwarfs have cooled down and all the white dwarfs transformed into black dwarfs, the universe will turn dark forever.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Rotating black holes might be the only sources of energy in the entire universe that knife could harvest.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: If so, the last living being in existence might one day end its life around a black hole, which is equally chilling and uplifting.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: It turns out that even without any light, there are places we can go.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Black holes are as interesting as they are mysterious, but there's actually a surprising amount we do know.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Using maths, we can calculate things and come up with theories about how we die if we fall into them.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: If you're the sort of person who gets excited about maths and calculating these things for yourself, our friends at Brilliant have put together a fantastic black hole quiz to help you get your head around them.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: Brilliant is a problem-solving website that teaches you to think like a scientist by guiding you through the problems.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations
Sentence: They take concepts like these, break them up into bite-sized pieces, present clear thinking in each part, and then build back up to an interesting conclusion.

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations

Title: The Black Hole Bomb and Black Hole Civilizations

Sentence: If you want to truly learn about black holes and support Cotskazard, this is one of the best ways to do it.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Until recently, the vast majority of the world population worked on farms and the total production of the world's economy was mostly the total agricultural output.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: And this output was limited by the fixed size of the land.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The total output of the economy did not change a lot year by year.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The size of the pie was fixed.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The world was a zero-sum game.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: In such a stagnating world, the only way to get better off is if someone else gets worse off.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: If you take a bigger piece of the pie, someone else is get smaller.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: If you want more food, then conquering, plundering and stealing our great strategies, your neighbors' loss is your gain.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: This was the state of things for thousands of years.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Society has invaded each other constantly to get more pie.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Economic inequality was extreme.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Some had all the pie they wanted while others had to live with the crumbs.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Then the industrial revolution happened and everything changed.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: We developed machinery, better crops, better fertilizers, agricultural output skyrocketed.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: But we didn't just produce more food, every industrial sector exploded in terms of productivity.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: From 1700 to 1870, the production of iron in Britain increased 137fold.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The industrial revolution led to a previously unimaginable increase in economic output.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: This altered the nature of our societies.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Economic growth changed the world from a zero-sum game to a positive sum game.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: We had found a way to create a bigger pie.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Not only a bigger pie, but a pie that was growing bigger each year.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: What people could have more at the same time.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: This development is spreading and continuing today.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Antibiotics kill bacteria, hard plants to live energy, cell phones, connectors, planes, letters travel cheaply, fridges, stall food.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Continuous progress in all sectors of the economy seems normal to us today.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: But the change from stagnation to economic growth really was the most drastic shift in human history.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: How was this possible?

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: At the very core of this massive transformation, stand new ideas that lead to innovation.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Innovation has many different definitions.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: But in the context of this video, we mean better solutions to existing problems and solutions to problems we didn't know we had.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The more you innovate, the more complex and interesting problems you discover as your wishes and needs evolve.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The average citizen in Norway 250 years ago might have wanted some really good shoes.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: 150 years ago, maybe a bicycle, 80 years ago, a car, 30 years ago, cheap air travel.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: And so on.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Once we get what we want, we don't stop.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: We can see how we can improve things even more and how to make things even better.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The new positive some world has existed for 0.1% of human history and we have yet to get used to it.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: It's a consequence that feels really unintuitive.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: In a positive some world, it's in your personal selfish, best interest that every human on planet Earth is well off.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: It's good for you if people in obscure parts of countries you've never heard of of prospering.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: There is a genuine selfish argument for making the world a better place.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: In a positive some world, the more people are well off, the better your own life is.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: This is because of the nature of innovation.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: It is fundamentally driven by supply and demand.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The supply increases when more people have the freedom and education to contribute.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: They become inventors, researchers, engineers or thinkers that come up with new ideas.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The demand for ideas increases as people get richer and can pay for new solutions.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: They increase the size of the market for innovations.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Innovation follows incentives.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: So naturally if many people want and can pay for something, it will get the innovators' attention and energy.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Improving the lives of those who are worse off has a multiplying effect.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: It increases demand for ideas while at the same time making it easier for ideas to be produced.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Let's take an example that interests all of us a cure for cancer.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: If there are 1 billion people in the world that have the wealth to pay for cancer treatments, innovation will follow this demand.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: So hundreds of billions of dollars have been invested in medical research.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: This had a huge effect but we still know where near to curing all forms of cancer.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Today every sixth person in the world dies of cancer and you might be one of them.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Now imagine if demand were higher.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Imagine instead of 1 billion people being able to pay for a cure for cancer, there were 4 billion or 7 billion.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Imagine how far medicine could have developed if we'd invested 7 times as much in curing cancer.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: On top of that, there's so much human potential being wasted right now.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The work of a poor farmer in a developing nation is not useful to you, but if he becomes better off, his children might spend their time in the university developing things that are useful to you.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Instead of having some hotspots of innovation in the developed world, we would have many hotspots all over the world.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The research output of humanity would be many times what it is right now.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Could we have cured cancer by now if that were the case?

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Well maybe, if we spent 7 times as much on research, had 7 times as many people working on it and a global network of medical research, things would certainly be further ahead than they are now.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: And this is the core of the argument.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The more people want the same thing that you want, the more likely you are to get it.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: That is what it means to live in a positive some world.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: You don't gain more pif or places staple.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Instead, you get more pif or places get richer, contribute ideas and grow the global pif.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: But you like space travel?

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Imagine there were billions of people in Africa and Asia with their own space programs and demand for satellites and moon bases and cities on Mars.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: Do you like being alive?

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: A few billion people paying for medical research could literally save your life.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: It's in your interest for people around the world to become better off.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: The faster we get to this version of the world, the better for you personally.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: No matter what your motivation is, working on a better world is a very good thing to do.

Title: A Selfish Argument for Making the World a Better Place – Egoistic Altruism
Sentence: For others, and for you.
