Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Health is the most valuable thing we have in life, but we tend to forget that until we lose it.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: We're living longer than ever before, which is great.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: But an unforeseen consequence of this is that we also spend a larger and larger portion of our lives being sick.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Getting old currently means spending more time in pain.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: So scientists are trying to shift the attention of the medical community from optimizing life spans to optimizing health spans, the part of our lives during which we're disease-free.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: To do this, we need to attack the root cause of almost all bodily defects, aging itself.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Unbeknown to most people, the science of aging has made enormous progress in the last few years, with human trials about to begin in the near future.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Let's look at three examples of discoveries that might benefit people who are alive right now.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: One, Sinescent cells.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Your cells have an expiration date.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Each time one of your cells divide, it copies its chromosomes.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Because of the way this works, they lose a tiny bit of DNA at the ends.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: This could be catastrophic, so to protect themselves, we have a lot of problems with the brain.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: The other works, they lose a tiny bit of DNA at the ends.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: This could be catastrophic, so to protect themselves, we have long segments of DNA called telomeres that sort of act like the stiff bits at the end of shoelaces, but they shrink with every cell division.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: In some cells, after a number of divisions, the telomeres are gone and the cell becomes a zombie, a Sinescent cell.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Sinescent cells stay around and don't die.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: The older you get, the more of them there are inside you.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: They harm tissue around them and are linked to many diseases that accompany old age, like diabetes and kidney failure.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: But what if you could kill them off?

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Scientists genetically engineered mice so that they could destroy their Sinescent cells as they pleased.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Older mice without Sinescent cells were more active, their hearts and kidneys worked better and they were less prone to cancer.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Overall, they lived up to 30% longer and in better health than average mice.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Since we can't genetically engineer all the cells in the human body, we need to find another way to get rid of our Sinescent cells.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: But how do we kill them without harming healthy cells?

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Most cells in the body commit a programmed cell suicide when they're damaged, but Sinescent cells don't.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: It turns out that they underproduce a protein that tells them when it's time to die.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: So, in a late 2016 study, mice were given an injection of this protein.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: It killed 80% of all their Sinescent cells while causing almost no harm to healthy cells.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: The treated mice became Germany healthier and even re-gruelost hair.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: As a result, there are a number of new companies looking at treatments involving Sinescent cells and the first human trials will start soon.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: NAD+.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Cells are made from hundreds of millions of parts.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: They're the structures, machines, messages and the catalysts that make reactions happen.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: All these parts constantly need to be destroyed, cleaned up and rebuilt.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: As we age, this process becomes less effective and so parts become crumpled, bunched up, or are removed slower.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: All they are no longer produced in the quantities we need.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: One of these parts is NAD+.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: A co-enzyme that tells ourselves to look after themselves.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: At age 50, we only have about half as much in our bodies as we do at age 20.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Low amounts of it are linked to a whole bunch of diseases from skin cancer to Alzheimer's, cardiovascular disease and multiple sclerosis.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: But NAD+.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Can't enter cells, so we can't get it as a pill.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: But scientists noticed that other more flexible substances could enter cells and would then turn into NAD+.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: In 2016, multiple trials on mice show that they boosted the modification of skin, brain and muscle stem cells.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: They were rejuvenated, had a higher ability to repair their DNA and had a slightly increased lifespan.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: This even got nasser-interested, which is looking for a way to minimize the DNA damage astronauts would be exposed to from cosmic radiation on Mars missions.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: There are human trials being planned right now, but it's too soon to say if this will boost our health span or even lifespan.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: But NAD+.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Is a serious candidate and could become the first human anti-aging pill.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Three.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Stem cells.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Stem cells are like cell rubrens that sit at various places in the body and copy themselves to produce a steady flow of fresh young cells.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: But they decline as we age and so we decline too.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Without new parts, human bodies break.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: In mice scientists observed that as the stem cells and their brains disappeared, they started to develop diseases.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: So they took stem cells from baby mice brains and injected them directly into the brains of mid-lage mice.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: More specifically, the hypotheralamus, apart that's involved in regulating a lot of bodily functions.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: The fresh stem cells re-invigorated older brain cells by secreting microRNAs that regulated their metabolism.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: After four months, brain and muscles worked better than those of untreated mice and on average, they lived 10% longer.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Another study took stem cells from mice embryos and injected them directly into the hearts of older mice.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: As a consequence, they had improved heart function could exercise 20% longer and weirdly enough, their hair re-group faster.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: What all of this tells us is that there is not a single magic bullet with which to cure aging.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: It requires a complex array of different therapies.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: We can kill off some essence cells to clear away the junk, give ourselves fresh new stem cells to fill the gap, or while regulating the metabolism of the other cells using medication.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: This video comes with a big caveat.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: After all, these studies have been carried out on mice.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: There's no guarantee that same therapies would work in us to the same extent, but they are proof of concepts.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: To learn more about how we can modify our own health span, we need human trials.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: We've only covered a tiny part of the research that's being done right now and only scratch the surface of these ideas.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: The field of health span extension needs more attention and funding.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: If it gets it, all of us might enjoy growing old without late.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: If you now want to support the research on aging directly, you can do so at lifespan.io.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: A community of people actively supporting the scientists working to cure aging.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: Check them out to learn about the latest advances and visit their blog or group on Facebook.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: The lifespan team also kindly supported the creation of this video with 8 donation and their expertise.

Title: How to Cure Aging – During Your Lifetime?
Sentence: If you want to help us make more of our videos, you can do so on patreon.com.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: If you had to choose right now, how long would you want to live?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: 80 years?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Longer?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: And do you think you'll change your mind once you reach that age?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: 50,000 years ago, most humans died very young.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: As we learned how to use the resources around us to treat ourselves, they've got better and better.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Today, humans are living longer and healthier lives than ever before.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: But this has an unforeseen consequence.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We spend an ever increasing part of our lives being sick and in need of care.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Most of us will die in a hospital bed, which is depressing enough by itself, but we also have to witness the same happening to our loved ones.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Except, maybe we can stop this forever.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: The most effective way to treat a disease is to prevent it.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: It saves many more lives if you stop a million people from smoking than coming out with better chemotherapies.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: So why not put a halt to the cause of all disease?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: The process of aging.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: In a nutshell, aging is caused by physics and not biology.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Think of cars, parts where down from rubbing and grinding, metal rasts, filters get blood, rubber cracks.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Our bodies are worn down by trillions of tiny physical processes.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Oxygen, radiation from the sun, our metabolism.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Our bodies have many mechanisms to repair this damage, but over time they become less effective.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: So our bones and muscles weaken, our skin wrinkles, our immune system gets weaker.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We lose our memory and our senses diminish.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: There's no such thing as dying of old age.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We all die because one of our important parts breaks.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: The older we get, the more damaged and fragile we become until one or multiple diseases take over and kill us.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Unnoticed by most of us, longevity research has made some unprecedented advances in the last few years.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: For the first time, we're starting to understand the mechanisms behind aging and how to manipulate them.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Aging is neither mystical nor inevitable, and we might be able to stop or delay during your lifetime.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We'll discuss the science behind it and how scientists are trying to stop it in another video.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: But first, if we could, should we end aging?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Is this a good idea?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: The end of aging or life extension makes many people uncomfortable.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We're born, a young, become older, and then we die.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: This has been the natural order for literally all of human history, and getting old is a good thing, right?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We celebrate the idea of living long enough to experience old age.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We even call them the Golden Years.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: But the reality is that everybody wants to become old, but nobody wants to be old.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Think of the Greek myth of Tithönus, for example.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Tithönus was the lover of the goddess Eos, and probably an amazing dude, because she begsus to grant him immortality, so they could spend eternity together.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: But she forgot to specifically ask for eternal youth.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Tithönus was granted eternal life, but he kept aging unable to die.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: After a few hundred years, he was reduced to the size of a grape, babbling on senselessly forever.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Thousands of years ago, humans already feared never ending old age.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: But ending aging does not mean getting weaker and weaker, if you've become too old, it's too late.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: A 90-year-old who stopped aging would die anyway after a few years, too much damage has been done to his internal machinery, there are already too many surfaces for disease to attack.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Instead, the concept of life extension promises to end diseases and with them the end of a fixed maximum age.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We don't know how much we could prolong our lives.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We might make every human healthy to the currently accepted maximum age of around 120, or we might stop biological aging and disease indefinitely.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Nobody knows at this point what's possible.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Okay, but even if we could achieve that, should we?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Well, life extension is ready just another phrase for medicine.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: All the doctors are doing is trying to prolong life and minimize suffering.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: The vast majority of healthcare resources are spent on the consequences of aging.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Nearly half of your lifetime healthcare costs will be spent during your senior years, and another third during mid-lage.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: We are actually already trying to prolong life with our current medicine, we're just doing it very inefficiently.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Trying to stop aging from happening is not less natural than transplanting a heart, treating cancer with chemotherapy, using antibiotics or vaccines.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Nothing humans do nowadays is purely natural anymore, and we enjoy the highest standard of living ever as a consequence of that.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: What we're doing right now is waiting until it's too late and the machine is failing.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: And then we use the vast majority of our resources trying to fix it as well as we can, while it rains down even further.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: But life extension still feels heuristic.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Most people assume that they will want to die once they reach a certain age, and this might still be true.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: The idea of avoiding death entirely is off-putting for many.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: The end of biological aging would not be in the end of death in any way.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: It's more like a summer evening when you were a kid, and your mum called you inside.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: You just wanted to keep playing, have a little more fun during sunset, before you went to sleep.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: It's not about playing outside forever, just a little longer until we feel tired.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: If you imagine a world without disease where you and your loved ones could live in good health for another 100 or 200 years, how would this change us?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Would we take better care of our planet if we knew we would be around longer?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: If we could work for 150 years, how much time would we spend figuring out what we're good at?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: How much more time would we spend learning?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Would the intense feeling of pressure and stress many of us are feeling right now go away or get worse?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: So, ask again, if you could choose how long to live right now, in good health and with your friends and family, what's your personal answer?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: What would you like your future to look like?

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: But maybe you're still unconvinced, some nagging feeling remains.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: That is the Reaper whispering into your brain.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Watch my video to hear what he says and why you shouldn't listen.

Title: Why Age? Should We End Aging Forever?
Sentence: Your eternal future may depend on it.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: My crops are everywhere.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: On your phone, in your water bottle, on your hands before you wash them, on your hands after you wash them, and literally everywhere else on top of you too.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: My crops are omnipresent at any moment, and there is nothing we can do about it.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: So millions of years ago, we made a pact.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: We give them shelter and food, and in turn, they work for us.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: But the more we learn about this partnership, the more it looks like a cold war.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Inside our mother's womb, humans start out sterile.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: When we're born and traveling through the birth canal, billions of our mother's bacteria cover every single part of our bodies.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: This is an essential part of human health.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Children born via sea section have a higher rate of asthma, immune diseases and even leukemia.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: So our bodies do not only accept the invasion of microorganisms, they welcome it.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Over millions of years, we co-evolved to make the best of our relationship.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Mother's milk, for example, contains special sugars that are meant to feed and support certain groups of microbes, work as a decoy for others, and help to modulate the immune system.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: It takes up to two years until a healthy microbe community has formed.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Every human has their own unique microbiome, made up of bacteria, viruses, fungi, and other organisms.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: We have three categories of guests on and in our bodies.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: One, quiet passengers that do their own thing, and are politely ignored.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: By being there they take up space and keep more aggressive intruders in check.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Two, guests that harm us, but with whom we've learned to live.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: For example, bacteria that literally create acid that melts our teeth if we don't brush enough.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: They want to take up as much space as they can, and we don't want them to.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: But we can't get rid of them entirely.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Three, friendly fellows that are bodies want to have around.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Most of them are a community of 380,000 billion bacteria from up to 5,000 different species that live in our gut.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: These gut microorganisms help us digest food and pull additional canteries from things we can't digest ourselves.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Unfortunately, our gut is also the perfect point of attack for intruders, so it's guarded by an aggressive army, our immune system.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Two survive here, our microbiome co-evolved with us to be able to communicate with our body.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: The most important part of that is to ask the immune system to not kill them.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: But they also have a real motivation to keep our gut healthy, so some of them produce messenger substances that help to educate the immune system and others stimulate the gut cells to regenerate faster.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: But over the last few years, evidence has emerged that the influence of our gut microbiome goes much, much further.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: It might even talk directly to our brain.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: We've observed a few curious things.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: 90% of our bodies serotonin, an important messenger substance for nerve cells is produced in the gut.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Some scientists think the microbiome does this to communicate with the vagus nerve, the information highway of our nervous system.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Other examples are bacteria that stimulate immune cells in the gut, so they send a kind of alarm signal to the brain.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Here it activates immune cells that help the brain recover from injuries.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Since the brain decides where we eat, the microbiome is interested in a healthy brain.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: A new field of science is opening up here, and we're just on the verge of understanding how these complex systems inside our bodies interact.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: But we are starting to see how much our microbiome actually influences us and our behaviour.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Take depression, for example.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Healthy rats fed microbes from the guts of depressed people began showing anxiety like behaviour and symptoms that look like depression.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: And in early 2017, a study linked the microbiome to intelligence by connecting a certain set up of bacteria in newborns with better motor and language skills.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: But it might also influence our daily lives.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Tests with fruit flies show that their microbiome influenced what kinds of food they craved.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: This could mean your microbes are able to tell your brain which food it should get them, although this is not a one-way straight.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: The seed for our microbiome comes from our mother, but how it develops and changes is determined by what we eat.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: The organisms in our gut feed on different things, some like fibros and leafy greens, others go for sugars and starches and some love greasy fries and butter.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Our gut is like a garden in which we constantly decide what will grow and blossom.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: If we eat healthy, we breed bacteria that like healthy food.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: If we eat a lot of fast food, then we breed fast food loving bacteria.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Life is hard, so we can get trapped in a vicious circle.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: You have a stressful time and eat lots of burgers and fries and pizza.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: This is awesome for fast food bacteria.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: They multiply and multiply and take up space from vegetable loving bacteria.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: But even worse, they send signals to the brain to continue what it's doing.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: This makes you want more fast food which breeds more fast food bacteria which makes you crave fast food and so on.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: This kind of self-reinforcing cycle could play a huge role in obesity, but it's important to stress that you can fight this process and reverse it by eating healthy and breeding more good bacteria.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Beyond weight gain, our microbiome has also been linked to other serious diseases like autism, schizophrenia and cancer.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: One of the earliest symptoms of Parkinson's is actually gut problems.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: If your body is overrun with bacteria that harm you, there is often only one solution.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: You bring in an army of good guys.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: That's very easy.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: You just transplant some healthy poop.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: You do that by literally transferring poop from a healthy person into your gut.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: This method is already used to cure diarrhea that's caused when sea-differous bacteria take over a gut microbiome.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: But we just don't know enough about the complex interplayer work here yet.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: For example, a transplant from an overweight donor cured a woman's diarrhea, but contributed to her obesity down the line.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: This caused some ways and another study tries to reverse the effect.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Poop transplants from slim people to obese ones gave them a more diverse microbiome and made them less sensitive to insular.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: Both things that also happen when people lose weight.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: We need to do a lot more science to really understand how our microbes make us healthy or sick.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: But whether we like it or not, we need our microbiome and it needs us.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: We'll never have our bodies to ourselves, but we have gained a powerful ally.

Title: How Bacteria Rule Over Your Body – The Microbiome
Sentence: If we can just keep the peace.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: We humans are unable to experience the true nature of the universe unfiltered.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Our senses and brains can only process a fraction of the world.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: So we have to use concepts and tools to learn about the true nature of reality.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Technological progress not only widened and knowledge about the universe, it also made us aware of unsettling possibilities.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: In the future, it might become possible to simulate entire universes.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: But if this is an option, how can we know that it's not already happened?

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: What if we are not creators, but creations?

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Is it possible that we are not real and we don't even know it?

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: If our current understanding of physics is correct, then it's impossible to simulate the whole universe with its trillions and trillions of things.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: But we don't actually need to anyway.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: We only need enough universe to fool the inhabitants of our simulation into thinking the burial.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Who needs billions of galaxies?

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: We only need to space our subjects are allowed to explore.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: The best universe could just be a flat projection and they would have no way to know.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: What about small things like cells or bacteria?

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: We don't really need them.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: When you use a microscope, what you see could be instantly created.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Same with atoms.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: The chair you're sitting on right now does not need to be simulated with quadrillions of atoms.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: We just need the out most layer of it.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: It might be empty inside until you decide to break it open.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Your body might feel like it's filled with bubbly things, but it might be empty until you open it.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: The minimum requirement for our simulation is only the consciousness of our virtual humans.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Our subjects just need to think the simulation is real.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: OK, so are we being simulated?

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Well, maybe, but there are a few conditions that need to be met.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Obviously, we have no authority over this topic, so please take everything we say with a grain of salt.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Based on a modified version of the original simulation argument by Nick Bostrom, we have five assumptions for you.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: If they're true, you, dear viewer, are living in a simulation.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Assumption one, it's possible to simulate consciousness.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Nobody knows what consciousness is.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: For the sake of argument, that's assumed that you could generate consciousness by simulating a brain.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Brains are pretty complex.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: If you count every interaction between synapses as one operation, your brain runs at about 10 to the power of 17, or 100 million billion operations per second.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Let's generously assume we need 10 to the power of 20 operations, to simulate one second of human consciousness.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: But we don't want to simulate just one human.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: We want to simulate all of human history at once, so we can skip around.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Let's say we want to simulate 200 billion humans with an average lifespan of 50 years.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: One year has 30 million seconds.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Times 50 years, times 200 billion humans, times 10 to the power of 20 operations.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: So we need a computer able to handle a million trillion trillion operations per second.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: More operations than there are stars in the observable universe.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: A computer like this is just impossible, except maybe it isn't.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: A assumption too, technological progress will not stop anytime soon.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: If we assume that technological progress continues in a similar fashion as it has so far, then there might be galaxies spanning civilizations with unlimited computer power at some point.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Beings on a technology level third-vance that we could barely distinguish them from gods.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: A computer that can handle a million trillion trillion trillion operations is serious business, but there are actually concepts for computers which could handle this.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: The matriarch brain is the theoretical megastructure made up of billions of parts, orbiting a star feeding on its radiation.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: A computer of this scale would have enough power to simulate many thousands, if not millions of humanity's at the same time.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Under technologies, like high-end future quantum computers, might lower the size drastically, so it might be possible to do this with a structure the size of a large city, or even smaller.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: But only if there's still someone around to build the computer.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: A assumption three, advanced civilizations don't destroy themselves.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: If there is a point at which all civilizations destroy themselves, this whole discussion ends here.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Looking into space, you'd expect to universe filled with millions of alien civilizations, but we see nobody.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: The reason for this might be great filters.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Great filters are barriers life has to overcome like nuclear war, asteroid, climate change, or a black hole generator.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: If life is inherently self-destructive, then there are no simulations.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: We explain this in more detail in our Fermi Paradox video.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: A assumption four, super advanced civilizations want to run simulations.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: When we speak of post-human civilizations, we don't know what we're dealing with.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: To think we know what beings as powerful as gods want is pretty arrogant.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Imagine the smartest ant on earth living next to an amusement park.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: It's curious about what humans are up to, so you try to explain.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Unfortunately, the ant just doesn't understand.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: The concept of rollercoasters and standing in lines and holidays and fun doesn't make sense to an ant living and ant life.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: It's the same with us and a post-human being.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Compared to them, we are ants.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Running simulations for fun or science might be an absurdly stupid idea to them.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: But if they do want to run simulations for whatever reasons and assumptions one to three are true to, then the chances are not zero that you are living inside a simulation.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Assumption five, if there are a lot of simulations, you are probably inside a simulation.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: If there are simulated civilizations, it's likely that there are a lot of them.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: After all, we assume that post-human beings have access to practically unlimited computing power.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: So if they run simulations, it would be convenient to run millions or even billions of them.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: If there are billions of simulated universes, there are probably trillions and trillions of simulated conscious elements.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Simulated conscious beings, which would mean that the vast majority of all conscious beings that will ever have existed are simulated.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: So for every conscious being made of flesh, a billion simulated ones exist.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Since we have no way of knowing if we are simulated or not, in this case the chances of you being one of the 99999,999, 999, are pretty high, so what you consider reality might not be real at all.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: You really might be simulated.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: All of this is based on a lot of assumptions that we can't really test right now, so many scientists disagree with this whole thought experiment.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: So don't burn your house down to test if there will be glitches.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: If you are simulated, not that much changes for you.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: You might be on a small planet speeding through a tunnel nothingness or a simulation inside a computer.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Your existence does not become more or less scary and bizarre.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: All we can hope to do is try to live good lives and have a good time, and hope that if we actually are simulations in a supercomputer, nobody trips over the power cable.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: Oh, oh no.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: I think I just unplugged the simulation.

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: But what if that doesn't matter?

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: What if we are in one right now?

Title: Is Reality Real? The Simulation Argument
Sentence: What if you are simulated?

Sentence: Jay Covert Vsauce 3 is looking into that.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: What would happen if you were to bring a tiny piece of the sun to earth?

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Short answer, you die.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Long answer, it depends which piece of the sun.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Like most of the matter in the universe, our sun is neither solid, liquid, or gas, but plasma.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Plasma is when stuff is so hot that the nuclei and electrons can separate and flow around freely, which creates a goolike substance.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: So you can imagine our sun as an extremely big, spherical ocean of very hot goo.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: The deep you go, the denser and the witter, the goop becomes.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: So let's bring three samples each the size of a house to our lab here on earth and see what happens.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: The first sample, the chromus sphere.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: The chromus sphere is the atmosphere of the sun.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: A layer of sparse gas up to 5,000 kilometres deep that's covered in a forest of plasma spikes that can be almost as big as earth.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: It's pretty hot here between 6,000 and 20,000 degrees Celsius, but if we brought a solver of it to earth, we're not really getting our money's worth.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: In the area where we take our sample, the chromus sphere is over a million times less dense than air, so compared to our atmosphere at sea level, it's basically the same as bringing the vacuum of space down to earth.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: The moment our sample arrives, it would immediately be crushed by earth's atmospheric pressure and implode.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Air would rush to fill the vacuum and use as much energy as 12 kg of TNT in the process.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: This creates a high pressure shock wave which shatters glass, ruptures itrums and maybe some internal organs.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: If you're standing too close, it could kill you, so you'd better keep your distance.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Let's go deeper.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Second sample, the photosphere.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Beneath the chromus sphere is the glowing surface of the sun, the photosphere, which produces the light we see.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: It's covered in a grid of a million hotspots called granules, each of them about as big as the United States and over 5,000 degrees Celsius.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: These granules are the tops of convective columns, churning gas that brings the heat up from the centre of the sun to its surface.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: In these columns, a few hundred kilometres down, we take our second plasma sample.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: It has about the same pressure as our atmosphere on earth.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Though still much less dense than air, its heat supports it so it won't implode.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Asphere now carries twice as much energy as much as 25 kg of TNT that this time is heat.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: For a dazzling instant, this plasma would glow with a million times the brightness of the sun seemed from earth, instantly lighting fires throughout our land.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: But a few milliseconds later, those fires are all that's left.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: The plasma has cooled to harmless gas floating up from the flaming ruins.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: What if we go deeper?

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Third sample, the radius of zone.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Here, the plasma is about two million degrees Celsius and so dense and tightly packed that it creates a sort of maze for itself.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Energy in the form of photons tries to escape, but has to wonder for hundreds of thousands of years, bouncing endlessly from particle to particle until it eventually finds an exit.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Bringing matter from here to our lab is what experts call a very bad idea.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: As soon as it arrives in our lab, the extreme pressure that holds the plasma tightly together is gone, and the material explodes with a power of a thermonucleo weapon.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Our lab is what is the city around it will be destroyed in an instant.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: On the bright side, there won't be any radioactive fallout.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Without lab destroyed, we can abandon the illusion that we're trying to do any science today.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: What if we go much much deeper?

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Last sample, the core.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Here in the central 1% of the star, we find a third of the sun's mass.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: The matter here is compressed by the weight of the entire star above it.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: In the center of the core, the temperature is 15 million degrees, hot enough to make helium by smashing together hydrogen, haring the sun by nuclear fusion.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: In billions of years after the death of the sun, this core will remain as a white dwarf.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: If we brought a sample of it to earth, it would cause a lot of inconvenience.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: The biggest nuclear weapon ever designated had an energy of 40 megatons of TNT, or a cube the size of the Empire State Building.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Our sample has the equivalent of 4,000 megatons.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: This is 4 billion tons of TNT, or a cube 1.3 km high.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: To give you a sense of scale, this is the cube inside Manhattan.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Once the sphere arrives on earth, this super-dense matter expands instantly and creates an explosion with the force of, well, the sun.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: If we get the sample in Paris in the morning, the citizens of London would see what looks like a second sunrise, but one that gets brighter and brighter and hotter and hotter until London burns to ashes.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: In a radius of about 300 kilometres around the blast, everything would be burnt.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: The shockwave would travel around the earth multiple times.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: Most buildings in Central Europe would be fattened, ir drums would rupture, and windows break across the continent.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: The explosion would be apocalyptic, possibly human civilization ending.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: If humans did survive, we could count on the dust blown into the atmosphere to create a small ice-age.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: So, if there is one tiny bright side, it would be that the explosion might be an effective way to control human-caught climate change for a few decades.

Title: What Happens If We Bring the Sun to Earth?
Sentence: While this is definitely a good thing, all in all, we conclude that we should not try to bring the sun to earth.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Black holes are the most powerful things in the universe.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Strong enough to rip whole stars into atom-sized pieces.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Well, this is scary enough.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: They have an even more powerful and dark property.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: They might delete the universe itself.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Black holes in a nutshell.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: A black hole appears when an extraordinary amount of matter is concentrated in a tiny space.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: At their center, gravity is almost infinitely strong, and whatever gets too close is ripped into its elementary particles.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Not even light can escape black holes, and so we perceive them as spheres of blackness.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: If you were to fall into a black hole, nothing bad would happen until, well after you crossed its outer border, the event horizon.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: You can imagine this as swimming in a river that ends in an enormous waterfall.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: As you float along, imperceptibly, the stream gets faster and faster, even if you can't see the waterfall yet.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: You could swim to safety until without even noticing it, you crossed the point of no return.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: No matter how fast you try to swim now, the stream will pull you towards certain death.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Nothing can escape a black hole waterfall once it gets too close.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: This order completely separates black holes from the rest of the universe.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: We can't access them unless we're willing to never return.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: So there's no way of telling what's really going on inside black holes, but we have a few ideas about what's going on right at their various edges.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Black holes radiate their matter way, like a hot pot on a stove, losing its water a steam.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: This is called Hawking Radiation.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Black holes constantly lose an extremely tiny amount of their mass.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: A process that's unbelievably slow.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: It will take a black hole with a mass of our sun, 10,000 billion billion billion billion billion years to lose 0.00001% of its mass.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: This is happening constantly and unstoppably, and as it goes on, it speeds up more and more.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: In the fall of far future, when the last star in the universe has been dead for trillions of years, black holes will come tiny and tiny until they evaporate and disappear, leaving behind just a bit of radiation.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: But this is a problem, because in the process of disappearing, black holes might delete something fundamental.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Information.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Two, what is information?

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Information is nothing tangible.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: It's typically understood as a property of the arrangement of particles.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: What does this mean?

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Imagine a bunch of carbon atoms.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: A range that's in a certain way and you get coal.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: A range that's in a different way and you get a diamond.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The atoms are the same.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: What changes is the information.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: If we make this more complex and add in a few more atoms, we get a banana.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Change the arrangement of the atoms and we get a squirrel.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The basic building blocks of everything in the universe are the same, and don't care if they're part of a bird, or a rock, or a cup of coffee.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Without information, everything in the universe would be the same.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: According to the theory of quantum mechanics, information is indestructible.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: It might change shape, but it can never be lost.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: For example, if you burn a piece of paper, you get ash.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: That ash will never become paper again.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: But if you were able to carefully collect every single carbon atom in the ash, and measure the exact properties of the smoke and heat radiating from the fire, you could in theory reconstruct the paper.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The information of the paper is still in the universe.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: It's not lost, it's just heart to read.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: If you could somehow measure every single atom and article and waver radiation in the universe, you could see and track every bit of information there is.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Hypothetically, you could see the entire history of the universe right back to the Big Land.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: And here, black holes, trevazard.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Information tells us how things are different from each other and what used to be what.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Black holes do the opposite.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: They take different things and make them the same.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: They destroy information.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: This creates the information paradox, and this is a serious problem.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The information paradox.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: It's fundamental for all our laws of physics that information can never be lost.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Existing, not existing, without information, everything is relative.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: When it comes to our understanding of reality, we need absolute.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: How could we solve this paradox?

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: There are a few possibilities.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: One, information is lost, irretrivably and forever.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: This means we have to mix all our laws of physics, throwing out a lot of stuff that's worked very well so far and to start from scratch.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: What those new laws of physics would look like?

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Or what that means for us?

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Nobody knows.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: This is a little frightening, but also kind of exciting.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Two, information is hidden.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Maybe a little part of the black hole splits off and forms a baby universe.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The information would be transferred into this new, weird place where we could never observe or interact with it, but technically it would not be lost.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: It's like having a broken heart drive with all your family photos that you could never access.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Sure, it's nice that they've not been deleted, but also not very helpful.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Or maybe black holes don't disappear completely after the end of their life cycles, but a little piece is left, an information diamond.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Like a clown car filled with an infinite amount of information clowns.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: But there's a third option, information is safe after all, not lost or hidden.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Perhaps we've just been looking at this whole thing the wrong way.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: We know that black holes trap information and might delete it later, but we never thought about what they do with it in the meantime.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Where do black holes store their information?

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Cosmic housekeeping.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Let's create a black hole with dirty laundry.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: First we fill up a room with laundry baskets.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The more laundry you want to store, the more baskets you put in the room.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: But at some point every single basket is full and the room is completely state.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Not a single extra sock fits in.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The room is at maximum capacity.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: But if we still squeeze the sock in with a lot of energy and violence, the room collapses in on itself and forms a black hole.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: But the capacity of the room itself has not changed, fitting in more staff or information is still impossible.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: So what happens if we throw more laundry into it?

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The room itself gets a little bit bigger to make space for the new information.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: It turns out a black hole grows its surface by a tiny pixel for each bit of information we throw into it.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: In a nutshell, more information means more surface area.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The information gets painted on the surface similar to what happens when we throw a stone into a pond.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: After the stone sinks to the bottom, we can't see it anymore, but we can tell that something went in from the ripples on the surface of the pond.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Even the smallest black hole can store more information on its surface than all the data ever produced in human history.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: They do this by storing information in a type of pixel that is unbelievably tiny.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Black holes are the ultimate hard drive.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: This is a bit like taking a paperback and turning it into an e-book.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Two things that look completely different, but their content is the same.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: It's just encoded and memorized in another way.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Black holes, saw-loing stars and panets, is a bit like transferring the whole library onto an e-reader.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: This solution is called the holographic principle, but if it's correct, then everything we thought we knew about the universe is wrong.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The universe is a hologram.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: If information is actually stored on the boundary of a black hole, the Hawking radiation has a chance of learning about the information encoded there and can carry it away.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: So, information is not lost when black holes fade away and we do not need to redo physics.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The information paradox is resolved, but we still have to change our understanding of reality in a fundamental way.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: If everything that falls into the black hole is stored on its event horizon, that basically means that three-dimensional stuff is encoded on a flat surface.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: We have a name for this, a hologram.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: A hologram is like a 3D photo, a flat piece of plastic that encodes a three-dimensional image.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: A black hole is like a hologram because everything inside it is encoded on its event horizon.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: A person inside a black hole would experience their usual three-dimensional life, but for us on the outside, they are flattened images on the surface of the black hole.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The consequence of this is counter-insurtive, but stay with us for a moment.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Black holes are very extreme objects, but they are still bound to the same rules as everything else.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: So, if this crazy duality between 2D and 3D works for black holes, then it might work for the whole universe and you in it.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Since a person inside a black hole would not realize that they are encoded on a flat surface, we might share the same fate.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: You really might be stretched over a flat screen at the end of the universe.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: The science behind this is complicated and really weird, with toy universes to play with, string theory and a lot of maths.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: We'll talk about this more in another video.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: Regardless of what the true nature of the universe radiates, we just know that it's strange and complicated, and we have to do a lot more physics to understand it.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
Sentence: But black holes might be key to understanding the nature of reality itself.

Title: Why Black Holes Could Delete The Universe – The Information Paradox
