Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Let's start this video by throwing a mouse, a dog, and an elephant from a skyscraper onto something soft, let's say, a stack of matrices.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The mouse lands and is stunned from a moment before it shakes itself off, and walks away pretty annoyed because that's a very rude thing to do.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The dog breaks all of its bones and dies in an unspectacular way, and the elephant explodes into a red puddle of bones and inside and has no chance to be annoyed.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Why does the mouse survive, but the elephant and dog don't?

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The answer is size.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Size is the most underappreciated regulator of living things.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Size determines everything about our biology, how we are built, how we experience the world, how we live and die.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: It does so because the physical laws are different for different sized animals.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Life spans seven orders of magnitude, from invisible bacteria to mites, ants, mice, dogs, humans, elephants, and blue whales.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Every size lives in its own unique universe right next to each other, each with its own rules, upsides, and downsides.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: We'll explore these different worlds in a series of videos.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Let's get back to the initial question.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Why did our mouse survive the fall?

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Because of how scaling size changes everything, a principle that will meet over and over again.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Very small things, for example, are practically immune to falling from great heights because the small you are, the less you care about the effect of gravity.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Imagine a theoretical spherical animal, the size of a marble.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: It has three features, its length, its surface area which is covered in skin, and its volume, or all the stuff inside it like ovens, muscles, hopes and dreams.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: If we make it ten times longer, say the size of a basketball, the rest of its features don't just grow ten times, its skin will grow 100 times, and its inside so it's volume grows by 1,000 times.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The volume determines the weight, or more accurately, mass of the animal.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The more mass you have, the higher your kinetic energy before you hit the ground and the stronger the impact shock.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The more surface area in relation to your volume or mass you have, the more the impact gets distributed and softened, and also the more air resistance will slow you down.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: An elephant is so big that it has extremely little surface area in ratio to its volume, so a lot of kinetic energy gets distributed over a small space and the air doesn't slow it down much at all.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: That's why it's completely destroyed in an impressive explosion of goo when it hits the ground.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The other extreme insects have a huge surface area in relation to their tiny mass, so you can literally throw an ant from an aerobane and it will not be seriously harmed.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: But while falling is irrelevant in the small world, there are other forces that are harmless for us, but extremely dangerous for small beings.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Like surface tension, which turns water into a potentially deadly substance for insects, how does it work?

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Water has the tendency to stick to itself.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Its molecules are attracted to each other through a force called cohesion, which creates a tension on its surface that you can imagine as a sort of invisible skin.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: For us, this skin is so weak that we don't even notice it normally.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: If you get wet, about 800 grams of water or about 1% of your body weight sticks to you.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: A wet mouse has about 3 grams of water sticking to it, which is more than 10% of its body weight.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Imagine having 8 full water bottles sticking to you when you leave the shower.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: But for an insect, the force of water's surface tension is so strong that getting wet is a question of life and death.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: If we were to shrink you to the sides of an ant and you touch water, it would be like you were reaching into glue.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: It would quickly engulf you, its surface tension too hard for you to break and you drown.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: So insects evolve to be water repellent.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: For one, their exoskeleton is covered with a thin layer of wax, just like a car.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: This makes their surface at least partly water repellent because it can't stick to it very well.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Many insects are also covered with tiny hairs that serve as a barrier.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: They vastly increase their surface area and prevent the droplets from touching their exoskeleton and make it easier to get rid of droplets.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: To make use of surface tension, evolution cracked nanotechnology billions of years before us.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Some insects have evolved as surface covered by a short and extremely dense coat of water repelling hair.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Some have more than a million hairs per square millimeter.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: When the insect dives underwater, air stays inside their fur and forms a coat of air.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Water contented because the hairs are too tiny to break its surface tension.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: But it gets even better.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: As the oxygen of the air bubble runs out, new oxygen diffuses into the bubble from the water around it while the carbon dioxide diffuses outwards into the water.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: And so the insect carries its own outside lung around and can basically breathe underwater thanks to surface tension.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: This is the same principle that enables pond skaters to walk on water by the way.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Tiny and water hairs.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The smaller you get, the where do the environment becomes.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: At some point, even air becomes more and more solid.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Let's now zoom down to the smallest insects known.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: About half the size of a grain of salt only 0.15mm long.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The very fly.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: They live in a world even weird at the northern insects.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: For them, air itself is like thin gelo, a syrup-like mass surrounding them at all times.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Mildland through it is not easy.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Flying on this level is not like elegant gliding.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: They have to kind of grab and hold onto air.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: So their wings look like big hairy arms rather than proper insect wings.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: They literally swim through the air like a tiny gross alien through syrup.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: All these only become stranger from here on as we explore more universes of different sizes.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: The physical rules are so different for each size that evolution had to engineer around them over and over as life grew in size in the last billion years.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: So why are there no ants the size of horses?

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Why no elephants the size of a meaver?

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: Why?

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: We'll discuss this in the next part.

Title: What Happens If We Throw an Elephant From a Skyscraper? Life & Size 1
Sentence: We have a monthly news lesson now.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Human existence is scary and confusing.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: A few hundred thousand years ago, we became conscious and found ourselves in a strange place.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: It was filled with other beings.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We could eat some, some could eat us.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: There was liquid stuff we could drink.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Things we could use to make more things.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: The daytime sky had a tiny yellow ball that warmed our skin.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: The night sky was filled with beautiful lights.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: This place was obviously made for us.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Something was watching over us.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We were home.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: This made everything much less scary and confusing.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: But the older we got, the more we learned about the world and ourselves.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We learned that the twinkling lights are not shining beautifully for us.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: They just are.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We learned that we're not at the centre of what we now call the universe.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: And that it is much, much older than we thought.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We learned that we're made of many little dead things, which make up bigger things that are not dead for some reason.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: And that we're just another temporary stage in a history going back over a billion years.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We learned in awe that we live on a moist spec of dust moving around a medium-sized star, in a quiet region of one arm of an average galaxy, which is part of a galaxy group that we will never leave.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: And this group is only one of thousands that together make up a galaxy supercluster.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: But even our supercluster is only one in thousands that make up what we call the observable universe.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: The universe might be a million times bigger, but we will never know.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We could throw words around like 200 billion galaxies or trillions of stars or bazillions of planets, but all of these numbers mean nothing.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Our brains can't comprehend these concepts.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: The universe is too big, there is too much of it.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: But size is not the most troubling concept we have to deal with.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: It's time or more precisely the time we have.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: If you're lucky enough to live to 100, you have 5,200 weeks in your disposal.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: If you're 25 now, then you have 3,900 weeks left.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: If you're going to die at 70, then there are 2,340 weeks left.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: A lot of time, but also not really.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: And then what?

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Your biological processes will break down, and the dynamic pattern that is you will stop being dynamic.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: It will dissolve until there is no you left.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Some believe that there is a part of us we can't see or measure, but we have no way to find out.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: So this life might be it, and we might end up dead forever.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: This is less scary than it sounds though.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: If you don't remember the 13.75 billion years that went by before you existed, then the trillions and trillions of years that come after will pass in no time once you're gone.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Close your eyes.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Count to one.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: That's how long forever feels.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: And as far as we know, in the end, the universe itself will die and nothing will ever change again.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Our videos induce existential dread in many people, and the last few minutes probably haven't helped.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: So for once we want to offer a different way of looking at these things, an unscientific, subjective point of view.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: The philosophy of course is that if you want, please take it with a grain of salt.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We don't know any more about human existence than you do.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We count to existential dread with optimistic realism.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: What do we mean by that?

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Well, to summarize, it seems very unlikely that 200 trillion trillion stars have been made for us.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: In a way it feels like the cruelest joke and existence has been played on us.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We became self-aware only to realise this story is not about us.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: While it is great to know about electrons and the powerhouse of the cell, science doesn't do a lot to make this less depressing.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Okay, but so what?

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: You only get one shot at life, which is scary, but it also sets you free.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: If the universe ends in heat death, every humiliation you suffer in your life will be forgotten.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Every mistake you made will not matter in the end.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Every bad thing you did will be voided.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: If our life is all we get to experience, then it's the only thing that matters.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: If the universe has no principles, the only principles relevant to the ones we decide on.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: If the universe has no purpose, then we get to dictate what its purpose is.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Humans will most certainly cease to exist at some point.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: But before we do, we get to explore ourselves and the world around us.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We get to experience feelings.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We get to experience food, books, sunrises, and being with each other.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: The fact that we're even able to think about these things is already kind of incredible.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: It's easy to think of ourselves as separated from everything, but this is not true.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We are as much the universe as a neutron star, or a black hole, or a nebula.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Even better actually, we are its thinking and feeding part, the sensory organs of the universe.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We are truly free in a universe-sized playground.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: So we might as well aim to be happy and to build some kind of utopia in the stars.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: It's not as if we found out everything there is to know.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We don't know why the rules of the universe are as they are.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: How life came into existence, what life is?

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: We have no idea what consciousness is, or if we are alone in the universe.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: But we can try to find some answers.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: There are billions of stars to visit, diseases to cure, people to help.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Happy feelings to be experienced and video games to finish.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: There is so much to do.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: So wrapping up, you've probably used up a good chunk of the time available to you.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: If this is our one shot at life, there is no reason not to have fun and live as happy as possible.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Bonus points if you made the life of other people better.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: More bonus points if you help build a galactic human empire.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: Do the things that make you feel good.

Title: Optimistic Nihilism
Sentence: You get to decide whatever this means for you.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: How long do you think it will take before machines do your job better than you do?

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Automation used to mean big stupid machines doing repetitive work in factories.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Today they can now thereafter diagnose cancer and trade stocks.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: We are entering a new age of automation unlike anything that's come before.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: According to a 2013 study, almost half of all jobs in the US could potentially be automated in the next two decades.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: But wait, hasn't automation been around for decades?

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: What's different this time?

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: The things used to be simple.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Innovation made human work easier and productivity rows, which means that more staff for services could be produced per hour, using the same amount of human workers.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: This eliminated many jobs but also created other jobs that were better, which was important because the ground population needed work.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: So, in a nutshell, innovation, higher productivity, fewer all jobs, and many new and often better jobs.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Overall this worked well for a majority of people and living standards improved.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: There's a clear progression in terms of what humans did for a living.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: For the longest time we worked in agriculture.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: With the Industrial Revolution, this shifted to production jobs.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: And as automation became more widespread, humans shifted into service jobs.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: And then only a few moments ago in human history, the information age happened.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Suddenly, the rules were different.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Our jobs are now being taken over by machines much faster than they were in the past.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: That's worrying, of course, but innovation will clearly save us, right?

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: While new information age industries are booming, they are creating fewer and fewer new jobs.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: In 1979, General Motors employed more than 800,000 workers and made about $11 billion.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: In 2012, Google made about $14 billion dollars while employing 58,000 people.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: You may not like this comparison, but Google is an example of what created new jobs in the past.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Innovative new industries.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Old innovative industries are running out of steam, just look at cars.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: When they became a thing 100 years ago, they created huge industries.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Cars transformed our way of life, our infrastructure, and our cities.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Millions of people found jobs either directly or indirectly.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Decades of investment kept this momentum going.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Today, this process is largely complete.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Innovation in the car industry does not create as many jobs as it used to.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: While electric cars are great in all, they will create millions of new jobs.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: But wait, what about the internet?

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Some technologists argue that the internet is an innovation on a power with the introduction of electricity.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: If we go with this comparison, we see how our modern innovation differs from the old one.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: The internet created new industries, but they're not creating enough jobs to keep up with population growth or to compensate for the industry's the internet's killing.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: At its peak in 2004, blogbusters had 84,000 employees and made $6 billion US dollars in revenue.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: In 2016, Netflix had 4,500 employees and made $9 billion in revenue.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Or take us, for example, with a full-time team of just 12 people, Codz Gazant reaches millions of people.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: A TV station with the same amount of yours needs way more employees.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Innovation in the information age doesn't equate the creation of enough new jobs, which would be bad enough on its own, but now a new wave of automation and a new generation of machines is slowly taking over.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: To understand this, we need to understand ourselves first.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Human progress is based on the division of labour.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: As we advanced over thousands of years, our jobs became more and more specialised.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: While even our smartest machines are bad at doing complicated jobs, they are extremely good at doing narrowly defined and predictable tasks.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: This is what destroyed factory jobs.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: But look at a complex job long and hard enough, and you'll find that it's ready just many narrowly defined and predictable tasks one after another.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Machines are on the brink of becoming so good at breaking down complex jobs into many predictable ones, that for a lot of people, there will be no further room to specialise.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: We are on the verge of being out-competed.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Digital machines do this via machine learning, which enables them to acquire information and skills by analyzing data.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: This makes them become better at something through the relationships they discover, machines teach themselves.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: We make this possible by giving a computer a lot of data about the thing we wanted to become better at.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Show a machine all the things you bought online and it will slowly learn what to recommend to you, so you buy more things.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Machine learning is now meeting more of its potential because in recent years, humans have started to gather data about everything.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Behaviour, weather patterns, medical records, communication systems, travel data, and of course data about what we do at work.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: What we've created by accident is a huge library machines can use to learn how humans do things and learn to do them better.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: These digital machines might be the biggest job killer of all.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: They can be replicated instantly and for free.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: When they improve, you don't need to invest in big metal things you can just use the new code.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: And they have the ability to get better fast.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: How fast?

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: If your work involves complex work on a computer today, you might be out of work even sooner than the people who still have jobs in factories.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: There are actual real-world examples of how this transition might be happening.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: A San Francisco company offers a project management software for big corporations which is supposed to eliminate metal management positions.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: When it's hired for a new project, the software first decides which jobs can be automated and precisely where it needs actual professional humans.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: It then helps assemble a team of freelancers over the internet.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: The software then distributes tasks to the humans and controls the policy of the work, tracking individual performance, until the project is complete.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Okay, this doesn't sound too bad.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: While this machine is killing one job, it creates jobs for freelancers, right?

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Well, as the freelancers complete their tasks, learning algorithms, track them and gather data about their work and which tasks it consists of.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: So what's actually happening is that the freelancers are teaching a machine how to replace them.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: On average, this software reduces cost to spy about 50% in the first year and by another 25% in the second year.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: This is only one example of many.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: There are machines and programs getting as good or better than humans in all kinds of fields.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: From pharmacists to analysts, journalists who radiologists, cashiers, bank tellers or the unskilled worker flipping burgers.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: All of these jobs won't disappear overnight, but fewer and fewer humans will be doing them.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: We'll discuss a few cases in a follow up video.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: But while jobs disappear in its bad, it's only half of the story.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: It's not enough to substitute old jobs with new bodies.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: We need to be generating new jobs constantly because the world population is growing.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: In the past, we have solved this through innovation.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: But since 1973, the generation of new jobs in the US has begun to shrink.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: And the first decade of the 21st century was the first one where the total amount of jobs in the US did not grow for the first time.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: In a country that needs to create up to 150,000 new jobs per month, just to keep up with population growth, this is bad news.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: This is also starting to affect standards of living.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: In the past, it was seen as obvious that with rising productivity, more and better jobs would be created, but the numbers tell a different story.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: In 1998, US workers worked to total of 194 billion hours.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Over the course of the next 15 years, they're output increased by 42%.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: But in 2013, the amount of hours worked by US workers was still 194 billion hours.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: What this means is that despite productivity growing drastically, thousands of new businesses opening up, and the US population growing by over 40 million, there was no growth at all in the number of hours worked in 15 years.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: At the same time, wages for new university graduates in the US have been declining for the past decade, while up to 40% of new graduates are forced to take on jobs that don't require a degree.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Productivity is separating from human labor.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: The nature of innovation and the information age is different from everything we encountered before.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: This process started years ago and is already well underway.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Even without new disruptions, like self-driving cars or robot encounters, it looks like automation is different this time.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: This time, the machines might really take our jobs.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: Our economies are based on the premise that people consume, but if fewer and fewer people have decent work, who will be doing all the consuming, are we producing ever more cheaply only to arrive at a point where two few people can actually buy a large staff and services?

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: All world of futures see a tiny minority of the super-age who own the machines, dominating the rest of us, and does our future ready to have to be that grim?

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: While we were fairly dark in this video, it's far from certain that things will turn out negatively.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: The information age and modern automation could be a huge opportunity to change human society and reduce poverty and inequality drastically.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: It could be a seminal moment in human history.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: We'll talk about this potential and possible solutions like a universal basic income in part two of this video series.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: We need to think big and fast, because one thing's for sure, the machines are not coming.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: They are already here.

Title: The Rise of the Machines – Why Automation is Different this Time
Sentence: This video took us about 900 hours to make and we've been working on it for over nine months.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Humans can survive in this universe as long as we have an energy source.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Unfortunately, the universe will die.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: It will happen slowly over many billions of years, but it will happen.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: On a universal timescale, stars like our son will be gone in no time.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Luckily, there are places that will exist practically forever from a human perspective.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: The corpses of dead stars.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: White dwarfs.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: They could be humanized as last home right before the death of the universe.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: What are these strange things?

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: And what happens when they finally die?

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: How long stars live very drastically, depending on how massive they are.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: For example, really massive stars burn hot and fast, dying violently in supernova a few million years after birth.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: But they're the exception.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: 97% of all stars will end their existence as white dwarfs.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: There are two ways this can happen.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Small stars so-called red dwarfs burn out over trillions of years until they eventually quietly turn into white dwarfs.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Medium-sized stars like our son are more interesting.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Imagine the sun as a huge pressure cooker that fuses hydrogen into helium in its core through its gravity.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: The fusion of elements releases extreme amounts of energy that pushes outwards and stabilizes the star, keeping it in a delicate balance.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: When the sun is old, the hydrogen in the core is exhausted, and the sun will begin to burn helium into heavier elements.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: While doing so, it will shed its outer layers.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: When this process is over, more than half of the sun's mass will be lost into space as a spectacular planetary nebula millions of kilometers across.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: What remains will be its former core.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: A white dwarf is born, a star corpse.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: While its former self was about 100 times its diameter, now its only about as big as Earth, but still with about half of its former mass.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: This means it's extremely dense, a teaspoon of white dwarf is about as massive as a car.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Its surface gravity is over 100,000 times higher than Earth.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: If you try to land on it, you'd immediately be compressed into a steaming puddle.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Life around a white dwarf is very unlikely, but possible.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Most of them that exist now were former stars that, well, died, which probably ruined any planet they once had.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: But that's not all.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Since they are so small, the planet would need to orbit them about 75 times closer than Earth is to the sun to have liquid water.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: This proximity has up and down sights.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: For one, it would tidally lock the planet, giving it a permanent day and permanent night.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: At the edges of these day and night zones, life could be possible.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: But white dwarfs have a very stable energy output, so they might actually be safer to live around than many red dwarfs.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: This is still speculation at this point, but if we could find a white dwarf with the right conditions to settle around, we could have a home for many billions of years.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: But why do they shine so much longer than other star types?

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: White dwarfs are very, very hot, up to 40 times hotter than our sun, ranking among the hottest objects in the universe, that they are not incredibly active.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: All the heat inside of them is trapped and has nowhere to go, only on its outer layer can escape into space.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: But space is mostly empty, so heat can't be transferred by conduction.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: The only way energy can escape is by radiation.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: This is so inefficient that white dwarfs will take trillions of years to cool down, which may make the humanities last refuge.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: They might be the last sources of light and energy in a dying universe.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: According to some estimates, white dwarfs might shine as long as 100 billion billion years.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: 10 billion times longer than the universe has existed.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: So far into the future that no regular stars will shine anymore.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: Galaxy's will have evaporate it, and only then will the first white dwarf turn into the first black dwarf.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs
Sentence: When this happens, the last hope for life will die off.

Title: The Last Light Before Eternal Darkness – White Dwarfs & Black Dwarfs

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Are there any machines in existence that deserve rights?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Most likely, not yet.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: But if they come, we are not prepared for it.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Most of the philosophy of rights is ill-equipped deal with the case of artificial intelligence.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Most claims for rights with a human or animal are centered around the question of consciousness.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Unfortunately, nobody knows what consciousness is.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Something that it's immaterial, others say it's a state of matter like gas or liquid.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Regardless of the precise definition, we have an intuitive knowledge of consciousness because we experience it.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: We're aware of ourselves and our surroundings and know what unconsciousness feels like.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Some neuroscientists believe that any sufficiently advanced system can generate consciousness.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: So if your toast is hardware was powerful enough, it may become self-aware.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: If it does, would it deserve rights?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Well, not so fast.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Would what we define as rights makes sense to it?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Consciousness entitles beings to have rights because it gives a being the ability to suffer.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: It means the ability to not only feel pain, but to be aware of it.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Robots don't suffer, and they probably won't unless we program them too.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Without pain or pleasure, there's no preference and rights or meaningless.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Our human rights are deeply tied to our own programming.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: For example, we dislike pain because our brains evolved to keep us alive, to stop us from touching a hot fire or to make us run away from predators.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: So we came up with a right that protect us from infringements that cause us pain.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Even more abstract rights like freedom are rooted in the way our brains are wired to detect what is fair and unfair.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Would a toaster that is unable to move mind being locked in a cage?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Would it mind being dismantled if it had no fear of death?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Would it mind being insulted if it had no need for self-esteem?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: But what if we programmed a robot to feel pain and emotions?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: To prefer justice over injustice, pleasure over pain and be aware of it.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Would that make them sufficiently human?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Many technologies believe that an explosion in technology will occur when artificial intelligence can learn and create their own artificial intelligence even smarter than themselves.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: At this point, the question of how robots are programmed will be largely out of our control.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: What if an artificial intelligence found it necessary to program the ability to feel pain just as evolutionary biology found it necessary in most living creatures?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Do robots deserve those rights?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: But maybe we should be less worried about the risk that super intelligent robots pose to us and more worried about the danger we pose to them.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Our whole human identity is based on the idea of human exceptionalism that we are special, unique snowflakes entitled to dominate the natural world.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Humans have a history of denying that other beings are capable of suffering as they do.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: In the midst of the scientific revolution, many take heart argued that animals were mere or tomater robots, if you will.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: As such, injuring a rabbit was about as morally repugnant as punching a stuffed animal.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: And many of the greatest crimes against humanity were justified by their perpetrators on the grounds that the victims were more animal than civilized human.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Even more problematic is that we have an economic interest in denying robot rights.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: If we can coerce a sentient AI possibly through programmed torture, into doing as we please, the economic potential is unlimited.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: We've done it before, after all.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Violence has been used to force our fellow humans into working, and we've never had trouble coming up with ideological justification.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Slave owners argued that slavery benefited the slaves.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: It put a roof over their head and taught them Christianity.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Men who were against women voting argued that it was in women's own interest to leave the hard decisions to men.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Farmers argued that looking after animals and feeding them justifies their early death for our dietary preferences.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: If robots become sentient, there will be no shortage of arguments for those who say that they should remain without rights, especially from those who stand to profit from it.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Artificial intelligence raises serious questions about philosophical boundaries.

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: While we may ask if sentient robots are conscious or deserving of rights, it forces us to pose basic questions like, what makes us human?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: What makes us deserving of rights?

Title: Do Robots Deserve Rights? What if Machines Become Conscious?
Sentence: Regardless of what we think, the question might need to be resolved in the near future.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: We are prisoners on Earth.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: The universe torts us by showing us all the places we can't ever visit.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: However, if our species wants to have a long-term future, we have to escape our prison.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: But what's keeping us here in the first place?

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Turns out, we owe the universe a debt that is 4.5 billion years old.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Everything with mass in the universe attracts every other thing with mass.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: We call this phenomenon gravity.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: The closer you are to a big chunk of mass, the stronger the attraction or the more you're pulled in.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: This effect traps us on Earth.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: We can imagine this as being prisoners in a gravity prison or a gravity well.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: It's not a literal well, but a handy concept to understand how this works.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Being in a gravity prison means that you owe gravity energy.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: But how can you owe energy?

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Because in our universe, things don't want to change their speed or direction.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: To convince them to move, you have to expend energy.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Billions of years ago, the gravitational attraction of trillions of trillions of dust particles orbiting our sun, caught them together until they formed a planet.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: This process used energy and created the gravity well in our part of.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: The deeper you are inside a gravity well, the more energy you owe gravity.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: If you don't find a way to get enough energy, you're not able to leave no matter what you do.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Because your atoms were once part of the dust that the universe expanded energy on to get to this place.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Okay, hmm.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Let's summarize all of that again.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Objects in the universe don't like to move.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: You have to convince them to do so with energy.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Gravity used energy to convince the path that make our planet to move together.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: This created a gravity prison in the process trapping us.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: To escape it, we need to repair it with energy.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Okay, how do we do that?

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: To get into space, we need to go through a complicated process of exchanging energy.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: For this purpose, we build a negative potential energy repaying machines, known by their more boring name, rockets.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: rockets work by using some of the most energetic chemical reactions humans know about to basically explode fuel in a controlled way.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: This converts chemical energy into kinetic energy.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: The exhaust of the reaction is directed outwards and pushes the rocket away from Earth.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: By expanding a lot of energy, we are increasing our gravitational potential energy, which is a complicated way to say that we're paying back our energy debt to gravity.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: But it's actually a lot trickier than that.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: When you burn fuel to get into orbit, you lose lots of energy to heat the exhaust and atmospheric drag, so you actually need much more.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: And you can't just par a huge amount of really explosive dangerous fuel close to your payload and detonate it.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: You need a controlled burn, which is complicated and makes your rocket very heavy.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Which means it has more mass.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: The more mass something has, the more energy you need to convince it to move.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: So you need more fuel to lift up your rocket.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: But if you need more fuel, that means you need more rocket to carry that fuel.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: But this makes your rocket heavier, thus requiring more fuel, which requires more rocket to carry that new fuel and so on.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: At the end of this madness, you need closer to 100 times the weight of your payload to launch.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Ariana 6, for example, the European rocket will weigh 800 tons and should be able to transport 10 tons into geocationary transfer orbit or 20 tons into medium Earth orbit.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: But a rocket can only produce so much thrust, so there's a maximum weight after which it just won't take off.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: If you add too much weight, it won't lift off, so you can't just build bigger and bigger fuel tanks.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: This is the tyranny of the rocket equation and it means space flight will never become easy.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: But wait, it gets worse.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Getting to space is still not good enough.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Your still inside the gravity prison at the edge of space and will crash back to earth.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Staying in space is much harder than getting there.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: To get to a stable position where it can stay for a while, the rocket has to reach low Earth orbit.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: To do this, you need a lot of kinetic energy, which means going extremely fast.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: At an altitude of about 100 km, this is 8 km per second, 28,000 km per hour.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Fast enough to travel around Earth in 90 minutes.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Here, we can use a trick.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Instead of flying straight up, we can go sideways.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Earth is a sphere.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: So if you're going sideways fast enough, even though you're falling towards Earth, the ground will cover way beneath you.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: So as long as you're above the atmosphere, about 100 km up, you'll be able to stay up there in orbit.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: This is what the ISS does, falling around Earth, expanding energy from time to time to stay fast enough.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: If we look at orbits in scale, we see that near Earth orbit is a laughably close to Earth.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Two deploy, for example, satellite, soar leaf for other planets requires another round of energy debt repayment.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Getting to orbit is the most difficult part of spaceflight for us right now.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: For example, if we want to send a rocket to Mars, half the energy is necessary just to get into orbit, and the other half for the 55 million kilometers to Mars.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Therefore, to be as effective as possible, rockets aren't built in one giant piece, instead we use multi-stage rockets.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: You don't need to carry an empty fuel tank, so rocket's drop it.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: rockets today said their boosters and main stage as they are sent, with each successive stage being its own fully contained rocket, complete with its own engine and fuel.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: Okay, so this is why getting to space is hard.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: If you feel all of this seems really complicated, don't worry.

Title: Why Earth Is A Prison and How To Escape It
Sentence: It's literally rocket science.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Never before in history, have there been so many people on earth as right now.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Our numbers have skyrocketed from 1 billion in 1800 to 2.3 billion in 1940, 3.7 billion in 1970, and 7.4 billion in 2016.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The world population increased fourfold in the last century, so what can we expect for the next century?

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: And what does population growth mean for our future?

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Will there be mass migration over crowded slums in megacities covering continents, diseases and pollution, chaos and violence over energy, water and food?

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: And a human species focused only on sustaining itself?

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Will population growth destroy our way of life?

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Or is this prophecy just ungrounded panic?

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: In the 1960s, population growth reached an unprecedented rate, which led to a bock-a-liptic prophecies.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The poor would procreate endlessly and overrun the developed world.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The legend of overpopulation was born.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: But it turns out high birth rates and the population explosion are not permanent features of some cultures or countries, but rather part of a forced-eprocess the whole world is going through.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The demographic transition.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Most developed countries have already made the transition while other countries are doing it right now.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Let's go back to the 18th century when the entire world, including Europe, was in the first stage of the demographic transition.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: By today's standards, Europe was worse off than a developing region, suffering from poor sanitation, poor diets, and poor medicine.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: A lot of people were born, but lots of them died just as fast, so the population hardly grew.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Women have between four and six children, but only two of them would reach adulthood.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Then the industrial revolution happened in the UK and brought the greatest change in human living conditions since the agricultural revolution.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: People went from being peasants to workers.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Manufactured goods were mass produced and became widely available.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The science is flourished and advanced transportation, communication and medicine.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The role of women in society shifted and created the conditions for their emancipation.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Slowly, this economic progress not only formed a middle class, but also raised standards of living and healthcare for the poor working population.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The second transition stage started.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Better food supplies, hygiene and medicine meant people stopped dying over time, especially so at a very young age.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The result was a population explosion, doubling the UK's population between 1750 and 1850.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The main reason families used to have lots of children was that only a few of them were likely to survive.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Now that had changed, so the third stage of the transition was set in motion, fewer babies were conceived and population growth slowed down.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Eventually, a balance emerged.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Few of people were dying and fewer children were born, so the death rate and birth rate became stable.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Britain had reached the fourth stage of the demographic transition.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: This didn't only happen in the UK, more and more countries went through the four stages.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: First, many births and many deaths due to bad living conditions.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Second, better living conditions leading to fewer deaths and a population explosion.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Third, fewer deaths resulting in fewer births and population growth came to an end.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: But, if birth rates have dropped so much, why is the population still growing so fast?

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Well, the children born in the population explosion of the 70s, and 80s are having kids themselves now, leading to a noticeable spike in overall population.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: But they are having far fewer children on average than their parents.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The average today is 2.5, it was 5, 40 years ago.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: So, as this generation gets older and fertility declines further, the rate of population growth will keep on slowing.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: This is true for every country.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: In the West, we tend to overlook progress in other regions of the world, but actually most of the world's countries have made it to the fourth stage.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Just look at Bangladesh.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: In 1971, the average woman had seven kids, but 25% of them were dimer for the age of five.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: In 2015, the mortality rate was down to 3.8% and women had only 2.2 kids on average.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: This is the role, not an exception.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: We're not special, which has had a head start.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: It took developed countries about 80 years to reduce fertility from more than six children to less than three.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Others are catching up fast, Malaysia and South Africa did it in only 34 years.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Bangladesh took just 20.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Iran managed it in 10 years.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: All these countries that are catching up didn't have to start from scratch and the more support they get, the faster they catch up.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: This is why programs that help lower child mortality or help poor nations develop a so important.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: No matter what your motivation is, whether you dream of a world where all people live in freedom and wealth or you just want fewer refugees coming to your country, the simple truth is that it's beneficial to you personally if people on the other side of the globe can live a good life.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: And we are getting there, the percentage of people living in extreme poverty has never been as low as today.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: So the future of global population growth is actually not an apocalyptic prophecy at all.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: It's a promise.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Population growth will come to an end.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: The UN forecasts that the 12th billionth human will never be born at all.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: And as the development level of the world rises, the number of people with a higher education will increase 10fold.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Countries who used to be a need will help advance to development instead.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: More people is going to mean more people able to advance our species.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: This video was a collaboration with Max Rosa and our world in data where he explores the progress of humanity through research and data visualization.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Make sure to check it out.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: In 2016, we were able to make more and better content than ever before because of your support on patreon.com.

Title: Overpopulation – The Human Explosion Explained
Sentence: Thank you so much and we'll be back in the year 1217.

Title: A New History for Humanity – The Human Era

Title: A New History for Humanity – The Human Era
Sentence: As far as we know, with the first beings to awaken and completely take over a planet.

Sentence: The transition from hunting and gathering to farming and building was so breathtakingly fast that many of our ways of thinking about the world are no longer useful.

Title: A New History for Humanity – The Human Era
